name: * 2023-2024 RSO Training Demonstration Group  💙
description: This group is intended to be used to demonstrate tools and modules of the CalLink org management system for registered student organizations who are ASUC-sponsored at UC Berkeley for the 2022-2023 academic year.
summary: test - 2022-2023 RSO Training Demonstration Group.

name: 180 Degrees Consulting at Berkeley
description: 180 Degrees Consulting is the world's largest student consultancy for the social sector, with 200+ branches around the world. At Berkeley, our branch keeps social impact at the forefront of our work, engaging with non-profits, social enterprises, and the corporate social responsibility divisions of for-profit enterprises. We aim to build a more compassionate, equitable world--one project at a time. Check out our website at https://www.180dcberkeley.com/apply
summary: 180 Degrees Consulting provides pro-bono consulting for nonprofits and social enterprises. We work with organizations to develop innovative, practical, and sustainable solutions to strategic, operational, and financial challenges they are facing.

name: 3D Modeling and Animation at Berkeley
description:
We are a student organization dedicated to education, research, and creation in fields encompassing, and related to, the production of 3D animation. We provide a group for students who are interested in working in the 3D animation or related industries, researching in relevant fields, or simply for students who are interested in learning about the topic. To facilitate a healthy ecosystem of support, we run a DeCal class called UCBUGG: 3D Modeling & Animation (http://www.ucbugg.com). We also host guest lectures related to the topic of 3D Modeling & Animation, to help students pursue their career and self-learning goals.
 
To join, just hop on our Discord (https://discord.gg/ZUFgDry) and follow us on social media. That's it. No apps, dues, etc.
summary: We are a student organization dedicated to education, research, and creation in fields encompassing, and related to, the production of 3D animation. We also run a DeCal class called UCBUGG: 3D Modeling and Animation (ucbugg.com).

name: 3DMC
description:
3DMC focuses on teaching and learning 3D printing and modeling skills. We hold workshops, participate in competitions, teach DeCals, and host an annual 24-hour 3D printing designathon.  We also tinker with 3D printers and 3D print cool projects!

If you are interested in learning more about 3D modeling/printing, teaching it to other students, or competing in design competitions, then swing by one of our meetings or check out our 3D Printing and Design decal!

Follow us on Facebook at "3DMC at Berkeley" or join our Slack (goo.gl/cF63vZ) to get the latest updates on our club's meetings and events.
summary: Interested in Design, 3D Printing, and 3D Modeling?  Come check out 3DMC!

name: A.N.T.I. : Artistic Nerds 4 Theatre Inclusivity
description: The vision behind A.N.T.I. is much broader than just providing a performance space to promote inclusivity. We stand to create an atypical platform for performances, allowing for students to create more devised or individual pieces, politically-charged or focused performances, and non-traditional classic theatre productions. From breaking gender roles in casting, to pushing away racial stereotypes, to even developing minority-based perspectives, A.N.T.I. strives to promote what a theatre company for actionable social change to the existing problems within the theatre industry can look like. While our goal for supporting inclusivity is related to many departments and clubs on campus, A.N.T.I. is different because our primary goal is to be inclusive and to create a theatre company on campus that specifically and primarily focuses on promoting the recognition of an individual's artistry, whether it be identity-based, politically-focused, or just artistic expression.
summary: A.N.T.I. aims to create a theatre company where inclusivity and promoting identity expression are at the focus of our performances.

name: AAAA - Furries at Berkeley
description: The furry fandom is a subculture interested in anthropomorphic animals. Its origins date back to at least the 1980s in science fiction and comic conventions. Due to the diversity within the fandom, as well as fictional portrayals of the fandom based heavily on stereotypes, a certain amount of stigma and controversy is unfortunately associated with the fandom. The Anthropomorphic Animal Appreciation Association hopes to serve and portray the furry population on campus positively, as well as foster community collaboration between furries at Berkeley with other interest-based or academic groups.
summary: Furries at Berkeley, a chapter of the Anthropomorphic Animal Appreciation Association, aims to serve the interests of fans of anthropomorphic animals through education on topics related to and community building centered around the furry fandom.

name: AAPI (Asian African Pacific Islander) Affinity Group
summary: AAPI (Asian African Pacific Islander) Affinity Group aims to build community, create a sense of belonging and celebrate culture in the graduate community at UC Berkeley and beyond.

name: ABA
description:
Founded in 1975, Berkeley ABA is a consulting organization with 5 teams: Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Non-Profit Organization, and Strategy. Our founders set out to provide a bridge between the professional world and the students of the UC Berkeley campus. Over the course of 45+ years of history, ABA has expanded its mission and now represents many diverse majors and cultures:

ABA’s mission as a business organization is to develop well-rounded business leaders who put our skills to work and never compromise our humility, integrity, or passion for each other and the work that we do. As such, we provide our members with opportunities to gain hands on professional experience through various industry-focused projects.

ABA has become a well-respected organization among the campus, the business community, and the business world. With over 500 Alumni, it is the undergraduate business organization on campus with the largest alumni network.
summary: Founded in 1975, Berkeley ABA is a consulting organization with 5 teams: Business Development, Finance, Marketing, Non-Profit Organization, and Strategy. Visit http://www.berkeley-aba.com/ for more information.

name: Abba Modern
description: We are a Christ-centered dance group that aims to spread Christian thought and ideals to the Berkeley community through the art of dance and testimony.
summary: We are a Christ-centered dance group that aims to spread Christian thought and ideals to the Berkeley community through the art of dance and testimony.

name: ABC Sketches
description: While other groups occasionally make sketch comedy videos, none are fully dedicated to this activity. Furthermore, many of the comedy groups on campus are exclusive and/or require an audition process. ABC Sketches is about providing an opportunity to any and all creative and comedic minds to bring their sketch ideas to fruition. We want to meet frequently, film carefully, and produce our videos to perfection. After producing our videos, we hope to post them online to provide any viewers with a laugh. We also hope to submit our videos to appropriate competitions and festivals.
summary: ABC Sketches is about providing an opportunity to any and all creative and comedic minds to bring their sketch ideas to fruition. We want to meet frequently, film carefully, and produce our videos to perfection.

name: Acacia
description:
Acacia Fraternity was founded in 1904 at University of Michigan, Ann Arbor on May 12th. The California chapter was founded 1905, having the distinction of being one of the oldest operating chapters in the National organization.

However, "an organization is not necessarily good because it is old, but old because it is good." There are a lot of great fraternities out there, and only you can decide which one is right for you. Here are a few reasons why Acacia Fraternity should be on your short list.

Acacia Emphasizes Academic Achievement

Academic achievement should be the first and foremost priority of all university students. It is also central to the mission of Acacia Fraternity, whose chapters stress academics above all else. Moreover, the Acacia Fraternity Foundation assists deserving Acacians with cash scholarships — over $250,000 in scholarships and educational grants were awarded by the foundation during the 2007-2008 academic year alone.

Acacia Develops Leaders

Acacia Fraternity is dedicated to building leaders by providing a wealth of leadership opportunities for our members. From social issues to academic, business to philanthropy, the Acacians of today are the leaders of tomorrow. Click here to view a list of prominent Acacians.

Acacians Help Better the Communities in Which We Reside

Our motto is "Human Service," and we take it very seriously. As member of Acacia Fraternity you will have ongoing opportunities, through structured community service programs, to make a difference in the lives of those in need.

Acacians Value Fitness

Members of Acacia are encouraged to participate in intramural sports, a system in which athletes of all caliber find camaraderie and physical challenge. Whatever the sport, and whatever your skill level, as a member of Acacia you will always have a place on the team.

Acacians Know How to Have Fun

Forget the "Animal House" stereotype of reckless partying and irresponsible behavior. Acacia's policy is that each chapter maintains a fun yet responsible social policy that promotes responsible choices and the dignity of every individual as well as zero tolerance for illegal activities.
summary: "An organization is not necessarily good because it is old, but old because it is good."

name: Academic Cultural Enrichment Coaches
description:
ACE Coaches teaches weekly Saturday classes to 3rd grade to 5th grade students at the San Francisco Chinatown YMCA. We not only provide academic support but also create a space in which our young students can maintain a connection to their Chinese heritage. Our club was founded especially to provide academic support to students residing in SF Chinatown's SROs*, or single room occupancy hotels. Coaches help to prepare and lead lessons that engage our students' creativity and critical thinking in the subjects of English, math, science, and cultural enrichment! We also host many fun socials for team bonding.

 

*SF Chinatown's SROs are often only 8'x10' in size, and many of our students reside in a single unit with their entire families. Many of the inhabitants of San Francisco Chinatown's SROs also live below the federal poverty line. The ACE Coaches program provides critical academic support to these students, who might not otherwise have a dedicated space for studying in their life.
summary: ACE Coaches aims to provide academic and cultural enrichment to underserved students living in the Single Resident Occupancy in San Francisco Chinatown, and through this process, establish more community involvement in the SF Chinatown community.

name: acts2fellowship
description: What is acts2fellowship? Acts 2 is a passage in the Bible describing people devoted to studying the Bible, to prayer, and to one another. “Fellowship” is simply another word for friendship—friendships that develop through discovering life together from God’s perspective with its many challenges. Many of us attend the same church and welcome all types of people to do life with us. Whether you’re a Christian eager to grow in your faith with like-minded friends or someone who’s curious to learn more about Christianity, we welcome you!
summary: acts2fellowship (a2f) is a Christian fellowship at Cal. We meet every week to study the Bible, do college together, attend church services, grow in our faith, and build lasting friendships!

name: Adam Smith Society
summary: Bring together students to discuss and debate the contributions of the free market to advancing human flourishing and opportunity for all

name: Adventist Christian Fellowship
description: WELCOME to Adventist Christian Fellowship! ACF fosters a community of both college level students and young professionals in the Bay Area looking for a spiritual family to be apart of. We welcome people from all walks and different backgrounds into a  relationship with Christ and the community. Together, we study the word and try to understand the greater roles we have as modern-day Christians, and how to best practice living the Kingdom of Heaven. ACF is proud of the support system it has created, as well as the open dialogue that it has started between members of our community. We invite you to join us, visit us, talk to us, or simply, come eat with us! Visit our page at www.berkeleyacf.com/
summary: ACF fosters a community of both college level students and young professionals in the Bay Area looking for a spiritual family to be apart of. We welcome people from all walks and different backgrounds into a  relationship with Christ and the community.

name: Aerial and Pole Club at Berkeley
summary: Our mission is to provide a safe, inclusive community for Berkeley students to learn and practice aerial and pole while fostering a culture of acceptance, belonging, and empowerment.

name: Aerospace at Haas
summary: By sharing knowledge and experience in the aerospace industry, our club will encourage our members to explore career opportunities and create an innovative impact on the aerospace industry.

name: Aerospace SAE
description: We spend each year designing, manufacturing, testing, and flying aircraft in preparation for the SAE International Aero Design West competition each Spring. We teach our team the necessary analysis, design, and manufacturing skills necessary for not only the construction of an aircraft, but for the foundations of a career in the broader field of engineering.
summary: We are a student competition team that designs and manufactures fully functional, remote-controlled aircraft to compete in the SAE International Aero Design Competition.

name: African Inclusivity and Solidarity Association (formerly Organization of African Students)
description:
The African Inclusivity an Solidarity Association formally known as Organization of African Students at UC Berkeley is a space to learn, share and engage on the opportunities and challenges of African continent and its diaspora. 

We are committed to:

  • Strengthening relationships among students of African descent and facilitating their academic and professional excellence
  • Maintaining a platform of pertinent discussions about the pressing issues of the African continent, and brainstorming on innovative solutions to address them
  • Supporting students of African descent planning to attend the University of California, Berkeley
  • Challenging the stereotypes about Africa and celebrating the richness and cultural diversity of the African continent on the Berkeley campus

 

We are ASUC Sponsored per SB 121 since 10-31-12.

This group African Inclusivity and Solidarity Association was formerly named Organization of African Students at Berkeley  - [10/27/23] [LL]
summary: We are the African Inclusivity & Solidarity Association or AISA, formerly known as The Organization of African Students at UC Berkeley.

name: AFX Dance
description:
AFX Dance is a dance group founded by Ping Quach, Geoffrey Chen, and Rosemary Hua in Fall 2011 to give dancers an opportunity to learn about and participate in dance culture, continuously build our community, and positively impact those around us through that process. Our name AFX reflects our three pillars—Aspirations, Family, Experience—and our philosophy of creating a family environment for dancers to build up the confidence and support to reach new heights.

 

With a dance “Company” (competitive/advanced) and “General” (introductory/intermediate) membership, we strive to provide our dancers and leaders with new, fulfilling experiences that will empower them to dive deeper into dance culture; pass it on to the greater community along with our philosophies and values of growth, community, and support; and hold each other accountable in uplifting and amplifying the voices, lives, and experiences of those who have made all of these art forms and experiences possible in the first place.
summary: AFX Dance is a dance group founded in Fall 2011 at UC Berkeley. AFX Dance is divided into Company (competitive/advanced) and General (introductory/intermediate). AFX Dance also has a technology team focused on improving the operations of AFX Dance.

name: Aglet Noise Collective
description: At Aglet Noise Collective, we aim to develop and promote musicians, singers and producers part of the UC Berkeley music community or in the nearby area, by hosting events, promoting artists’ releases and helping artists record and release their songs. Aglet Noise Collective is a label and collective by musicians and artists of related fields to create a unique musical experience.
summary: At Aglet Noise Collective, we aim to develop and promote musicians part of the UC Berkeley music community and the nearby area, by hosting events, promoting artists’ releases and helping artists record and release their songs, along with video content.

name: AI Safety at Berkeley
description: This group was formerly named Good Futures at Berkeley - [12/14/23] LL
summary: We are a collective of Berkeley students hoping to help humanity navigate our future. We believe that the development of transformative technology may have an enormous impact on our world, and should be advanced and governed with safety in mind.

name: Aion
description:
Aion interest group is an officially recognized interest group for an Asian Interest Sorority at the University of California, Berkeley. We are striving to bring this Asian-Interest sorority to campus. We want our group to foster long-lasting relationships and build our community through breast cancer and mental health awareness, leadership, scholarship, and Asian awareness. 

Our pillars are:

  • Leadership
  • Scholarship
  • Community
  • Philanthropy (Breast Cancer Awareness, Mental Health Awareness)
  • Asian Awareness
summary: alpha Kappa Delta Phi provides our members with lifelong empowerment, support, and friendships through sisterhood. We strive to live by our core values and advance our pillars - sisterhood, leadership, scholarship, service, and Asian-Awareness.

name: Air Bears - Skydiving Club at Berkeley
description:
ANYONE can skydive! Come hang, come chat, come experience.

Skydiving is safe, fun, and a one of a kind experience. You wont regret it!!!
summary: To foster a diverse and welcoming group of people and to expose UC Berkeley community members' to the incredible, surreal, live-changing, fear-conquering experience of skydiving.

name: Alexander Hamilton Society, The
description: Hamiltonians, a renowned group of students, faculty, national policy leaders, and captains of finance and industry, share a conviction, rooted in the history of the last century, that the world is a better, safer, and more prosperous place when the United States is willing and able to lead. We foster constructive debates on college campuses, critical to the intellectual and professional development of a new generation of American leaders.
summary: The Alexander Hamilton Society (AHS) is a non-partisan, not-for-profit, national organization that inspires and educates students in the importance of American leadership in the world and launches them into careers in the private and public sectors.

name: Alianza Latine for Public Health Action
description:
Alianza Latine for Public Health Action (ALPHA) aims to create a space to empower Latine students in the School of Public Health at UC Berkeley, including first-generation students. ALPHA will serve as a platform for community-building and professional development to cultivate Latine leaders in public health. Our vision is to uplift unique Latine perspectives and experiences, create a strong professional network and contribute to a diverse public health community. 

 

This group [Alianza Latine for Public Health Action] was formerly named [Alianza Latinx for Public Health Action] - [10/14/21] IZ
summary: ALPHA aims to create a space to empower Latine students in the School of Public Health. ALPHA will serve as a platform for community-building and professional development to cultivate Latine leaders in public health.

name: Allergy Network
description: Fill out our interest form!
summary: The purpose of The Allergy Network will be to foster community within members of the UC Berkeley community who currently or formerly have had food allergies, as well as any other students interested in learning about allergies.

name: Alpha Chi Omega
description:
Alpha Chi Omega - Pi Chapter at UC Berkeley 
Real. Strong. Women.

Alpha Chi Omega was founded on October 15, 1885 by seven amazing women at DePauw University in Greencastle, Indiana. Anna Allen, Olive Burnett, Bertha Denison, Amy DuBois, Nellie Gamble, Bessie Grooms, and Estelle Leonard founded Alpha Chi. It was the first, and most likely last, musical fraternity. The group was thus named Alpha, meaning first, and Omega, meaning last, using Chi as a link. The purpose of Alpha Chi Omega was to provide the advancement of the intellectual, social, and moral culture of its members. The Berkeley AXO Pi Chapter was founded on May 7, 1909.

Visit us on social media!

Website

Facebook

Instagram

Tumblr

National Website
summary: Alpha Chi Omega : Pi Chapter at UC Berkeley

name: Alpha Chi Sigma Professional Chemistry Fraternity
description: Alpha Chi Sigma is a co-ed professional fraternity on campus that focuses on various fields of chemistry and engineering. We are a close knit community that develops our members professionally and academically. With events such as tutoring sessions, career panels, and outreach with local schools, AXS is for anyone who enjoys chemistry adjacent sciences.
summary: Alpha Chi Sigma is a co-ed professional chemistry fraternity offering opportunities for both social bonding and professional development.

name: Alpha Delta Phi
description:
====Who We Are====
The Alpha Delta Phi California Chapter has been a mainstay of the University of California ever since we first received our charter in 1908. In addition to the immense social gratification Aqua Delt’s privileged brotherhood provides, there are many academic and character building advantages unique to becoming a part of the Alpha Delta Phi. Our novelty and selective chapter size offer the opportunity to cultivate immediate leadership experience and contribute to a fresh and emerging legacy.

====Notable Alumni====
-Walter Haas Jr: President and CEO of Levi Strauss & Co.
-Allan Sproul: President of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, namesake of Sproul Hall.
-David M. Solomon: Current CEO of Goldman Sachs
-Dr. Frederick Allen: Pioneer of Diabetes Research.
-2 U.S. Presidents: Franklin D. Roosevelt & Theodore Roosevelt
-Francis Julius Bellamy: original author of the Pledge of Allegiance
-7 Supreme Court Justices

====Our Mission====
We seek to develop potential new members through our national founder, Samuel Eells’ original vision statement: "a true philosophical spirit looking to the entire man, so as to develop his whole being - moral, social and intellectual."
summary: We are the California Chapter of the Alpha Delta Phi, one of the oldest fraternities in the country, founded in 1832. We strive to develop our whole being, moral, social, and intellectual. This mindset has created iconic social leaders-see notable alumni

name: Alpha Delta Pi
description:
Keep up with Alpha Delta Pi on our social media pages!

Find us on Instagram @caladpi and on our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/UC-Berkeley-Alpha-Delta-Pi-132391421981/?fref=ts

 

Alpha Delta Pi was founded by Eugenia Tucker in 1851 at the Wesleyan Female College in Macon Georgia. It holds the distinction of being the first secret society for women, and therefore the foundation of the entire sorority system, hence our motto- First, Finest, Forever.

 

Psi Chapter of ADPi was founded in Berkeley in 1913- the 23rd national chapter to be established. In 1931, the chapter purchased our current home, 2400 Piedmont Ave. The house was formerly the summer home of notable Bay Area heiress Phoebe Hearst, and was recognized immediately as the showplace of the campus.
Since then, the mansion has had several modern conveniences added on, but it still retains its original character. It serves as a charming home to almost sixty girls.

 

With its location on Channing circle, Psi chapter of Alpha Delta Pi lies at the very heart of the present-day Greek community.
summary: Alpha Delta Pi was founded by Eugenia Tucker in 1851 at the Wesleyan Female College in Macon Georgia. It holds the distinction of being the first secret society for women, and therefore the foundation of the entire sorority system.

name: Alpha Epsilon Omega
description:
Alpha Epsilon Omega, established at the University of California Berkeley in August 2022, holds a mission centered around uniting students dedicated to fostering cultural stimulation on campus. This dedication aims to kindle interest in the Armenian language, history, and culture, all while upholding rigorous standards of academic excellence. The fraternity's objective revolves around nurturing a community where brothers wholeheartedly embrace their culture and heritage through philanthropic, cultural, and professional events. AEΩ has established and will continue fostering a supportive network for its members, contributing significantly to academic and social success.

Unity of Strength and Knowledge | Գիտության եվ Հզորության Միություն

name: Alpha Epsilon Pi
description: We are the Chi Alpha chapter of Alpha Epsilon Pi at the University of California, Berkeley, founded in 1949 and re-founded in 1985. Since our founding, we have been growing constantly. Several brothers hold executive positions in many organizations on campus, including heavy involvement in the Jewish community: ASUC (UC Berkeley's Student Government), Jewish Student Union,TAMID Group, and many others. Like CalGreeks Family Feud, our philanthropic events raise over thousands of dollars for several charities per semester. Furthering our relations with other houses in the Greek system, we hold several joint social and philanthropic events on a weekly basis.
summary: We are the Chi Alpha chapter of Alpha Epsilon Pi at the University of California, Berkeley, founded in 1949 and re-founded in 1985. Since our founding, we have been growing constantly.

name: Alpha Epsilon Zeta Fraternity, Inc.
description:
Founded in 2003, Alpha Epsilon Zeta (AEZ) is one of Cal's longest-standing student organizations, with over 130 active and alumni members placed at top firms including Apple, Google, Point72, Blackstone, Carlyle, Goldman Sachs, and Lazard as well as elite graduate schools including MIT and Harvard Business School. AEZ is an undergraduate Professional Fraternity that differentiates itself through its multidisciplinary focus, with a proven track record of pushing students to success in whatever field they choose to pursue. With weekly professional development training from university faculty and experts in industry, AEZ members are well-rounded and knowledgeable in a variety of fields. Our current brothers also hold leadership positions in a variety of other clubs on campus including Valley Consulting Group, Berkeley Business Society, Cal Hacks, Consult Your Community, UC Berkeley Model UN, Enable Tech, and more. Joining AEZ gives students the opportunities and network to explore their interests and further pursue them both in their time at Cal and in their careers.

 

As a part of AEZ, brothers also have the opportunity to work in our elite consulting wing, Paradigm Consulting. Paradigm Consulting delivers top-notch, actionable solutions to the C-Suite of Fortune 500 companies.  Past clients include AWS, Johnson & Johnson, eBay, Bose, Roblox, and Juniper Networks.

 

Come join us for our Fall 2023 Rush!
 
All important links here: linktr.ee/aez_
 

RECRUITMENT TIMELINE

 

Tabling | Wednesday 8/24 to Friday 9/2 | Memorial Glade & Upper Sproul

Info Session | Tuesday 8/30, 8 - 9 PM | Haas Courtyard

Coffee Chats | Wednesday 8/31 & Thursday 9/1 | Haas Courtyard

Social Night | Sunday  9/4, 3 - 6 PM | Location TBA

Application Due | Sunday 9/4 | Apply at: tinyurl.com/aezapply

Interviews* | Wednesday 9/7 & Thursday 9/8 | Haas Courtyard

Alumni Mixer* | Saturday 9/11, 3 - 6 PM | Urban Putt SF

*by invite only

 

Any Questions? Please contact ritvikxd@berkeley.edu.
summary: Alpha Epsilon Zeta (AEZ) is an undergraduate, multi-disciplinary Professional Fraternity with over 160 current and alumni members. AEZ members come from a variety of majors, ranging from business and computer science to biology and engineering.

name: Alpha Gamma Omega
description:
Alpha Gamma Omega (ΑΓΩ or "AGO") is a national, Christ-centered fraternity. It was founded in 1927 at UCLA, making it one of the oldest national fraternities in the United States that have retained its Christian values. ΑΓΩ at UC Berkeley was founded in 1938 and is the second oldest chapter of ΑΓΩ. There are currently eleven active chapters. ΑΓΩ maintains a close relationship with its Christian "sister" sorority Alpha Delta Chi.

 

ΑΓΩ exists for the following reasons:

1. To win others to a saving knowledge of Jesus Christ

2. To promote Christian fellowship

3. To present Christian ideals in word and deed

4. To search reverently for the truth

5. To uphold the traditions and ideals of the university

6. And to deepen the spiritual lives of the members.
summary: We are UC Berkeley's only Christ-centered fraternity. We believe that we are to love & serve our university and Greek community as Jesus loved & served us.

name: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc.
description:
Since its founding over a century ago, Alpha Kappa Alpha’s mission has been to cultivate and encourage high scholastic and ethical standards, to promote unity and friendship among college women, to study and help alleviate problems concerning girls and women in order to improve their social stature, to maintain a progressive interest in college life, and to be of “Service to All Mankind.”

Rho Chapter of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated was chartered at the University of California, Berkeley on August 21, 1921 by 6 women under the leadership of Soror Ida Louise Jackson. With the chartering of Rho Chapter, the landmark expansion of the sorority to the West Coast began. Rho women have been striving to fulfill Ida’s dream of nothing short of excellence for the chapter. The women of Rho exemplify the Alpha Kappa Alpha woman through their professional and personal development, community service, sisterhood, and commitment to academic excellence at Cal and beyond.
summary: Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated is an international service organization that was founded at Howard University in Washington, D.C. on January 15, 1908. It is the oldest Greek-lettered organization established by African American college women.

name: Alpha Phi
description:
Hello everyone! 

If you want to know more about our chapter, please visit our Instagram @calalphaphi or feel free to reach out to our Chapter President, Sydney Roberts, at calalphaphipresident@gmail.com!

name: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
description:
Alpha Phi Alpha (ΑΦΑ) is the first Black, inter-collegiate Greek-lettered fraternity. It was founded on December 4, 1906 at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York. Its founders are known as the "Seven Jewels". It employs an icon from Ancient Egypt, the Great Sphinx of Giza, as its symbol. Its aims are "manly deeds, scholarship, and love for all mankind," and its motto is First of All, Servants of All, We Shall Transcend All.

Alpha Phi Alpha evolved into primarily a service organization and provided leadership and service during the Great Depression, World Wars, and Civil Rights Movements. It addresses social issues such as apartheid, AIDS, urban housing, and other economic, cultural, and political issues of interest to people of color. The Martin Luther King, Jr. National Memorial and World Policy Council are programs of Alpha Phi Alpha. It also conducts philanthropic programming initiatives with March of Dimes, Head Start, Boy Scouts of America, and Big Brothers Big Sisters of America.

Members of Alpha Phi Alpha include Jamaican Prime Minister Norman Manley, Nobel Prize winner Martin Luther King, Jr., Olympian Jesse Owens,Justice Thurgood Marshall, United Nations Ambassador Andrew Young, singer Lionel Richie and Atlanta mayor Maynard Jackson.
summary: Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity, Inc. develops leaders, promotes brotherhood and academic excellence, while providing service and advocacy for our communities.

name: Alpha Pi Mu
description: Alpha Pi Mu is the only Industrial Engineering Honor Society recognized by the Association of College Honor Societies. Only the top students each semester are invited to join our Honor Society, which has existed at UC Berkeley since 1957.
summary: Alpha Pi Mu is an industrial engineering honor society seeking to recognize those students who have shown exceptional academic interests and abilities. It strives to unify its members to promote the professional welfare of all.

name: Alpha Rho Chi
description: Alpha Rho Chi (APX) is UC Berkeley’s only professional co-ed fraternity dedicated to architecture and the allied arts. Despite our name, our brothers come from diverse backgrounds with some studying Architecture, and others studying Computer Science, Landscape Architecture, and Mechanical Engineering. Our brotherhood cultivates creative thinking and helps foster academic and professional growth, while our alumni network provides mentorship and extensive networking opportunities.  We host professional and technical workshops, academic lectures on critical topics, and firm tours around the San Francisco Bay area.
summary: National Professional Fraternity for Architecture and the Allied Arts

name: Alpha Sigma Phi
description:
Alpha Sigma Phi was founded on December 6th, 1845 at Yale University, and today stands strong as one of the fastest growing fraternities in the nation. Our fraternity stands on the pillars of Silence, Charity, Purity, Honor, and Patriotism, and our brothers strive to embrace these values in order To Better The Man and become Brothers For Life. If you have any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us!

Sean Collins, Chapter President

Kyle Mak, Chapter Vice President
summary: The home page for the Nu Chapter of Alpha Sigma Phi at UC Berkeley. Our goal as Alpha Sigs is to perpetually Better the Man through our values and actions.

name: Alpha Tau Omega
description:
Established in 1865, Alpha Tau Omega was the first fraternity created after the Civil War. ATO was founded at the Virginia Military Institute by three cadets who sought to create a brotherhood based on eternal and immutable principles to unite men and heal the divisions caused by the war. 

ATO continues to reinforce these principles today, as embodied in the fraternity's creed:

"To bind men together in a brotherhood based upon eternal and immutable principles, with a bond as strong as right itself and as lasting as humanity; to know no North, no South, no East, no West, but to know man as man, to teach that true men the world over should stand together and contend for supremacy of good over evil; to teach, not politics, but morals; to foster, not partisanship, but the recognition of true merit wherever found; to have no narrower limits within which to work together for the elevation of man than the outlines of the world: these were the thoughts and hopes uppermost in the minds of the founders of the Alpha Tau Omega Fraternity."

The Gamma Iota Chapter of Alpha Tau Omega at UC Berkeley has received several awards ranging from academic to athletic successes. We provide an excellent way to delve into a rich life at Berkeley with socials with sororities, brotherhood retreats, philanthropy events, club nights, sporting nights, and a whole lot more. We have consistently successful intramural teams in basketball, football, soccer, softball, and volleyball.

We live in the largest fraternity house on campus, which has been recently renovated and is well taken care of. Our brothers are diverse in their backgrounds and their studies - we are open to all who are charismatic and outgoing.

Our alumni range in successes from former US Ambassador to Libya Chris Stevens, the Vice President of Fox Sports, a major Hollywood talent agent, a world class anesthesiologist, a senior partner at Goldman Sachs (who was named by Haas as the Business Leader of the Year for 2014), and a former California superior court judge. 

One of ATO's most notable contributions to Cal is the original Oski. Oski was a bear cub who lived in the ATO house in 1923 until he grew too large and was moved to the Oakland Zoo.
summary: ...Founded at Berkeley on April 10, 1900, the Gamma Iota Chapter of Alpha Tau Omega strives to build character, academic success, and the ties of brotherhood amongst the men who join us.

name: Alternative Breaks
description:
Since its founding in 2001, Alternative Breaks has offered students opportunities to connect with the greater community through meaningful service, education, and reflection during their academic breaks. Many participants return from their experiences with greater insight on a particular social justice issue and a deeper understanding of what it means to get involved in the community. This year, Alternative Breaks offers seven trips to different locations during the spring break, covering issues such as environmental justice, health care, immigration, and housing insecurity.

These student-led trips travel to different locations in California and Puerto Rico to further their understanding of the community and to bring knowledge gained on-site back to the Berkeley community. Students not only participate in a week-long service trip, but also a spring DeCal course to explore various topics revolving around each social justice issue and engage in reflection both pre- and post-trip.

Our Spring 2024 experiences include:

  • Central Valley - The Unsung Heroes Harvesting Your Tomorrow: Exploitation, Migration and Resilience
  • San Francisco - Economic Justice | No Place Like Home: Housing Inequity 
  • East Bay - Environmental & Food Justice: Heal Your Planet Heal Yourself (HYPHY): Building Sustainable Legacies Rooted in the Town
  • Los Angeles - Striving for Health Equity in Los Angeles
  • Puerto Rico -Bombiando con Puerto Rico
  • San Diego - Immigration Isn’t a Crime: The Fight for Human Rights at the Southern Border

Apply now! Link to Spring 2024 Participant Application!

Priority deadline: Oct 23 at 11:59pm

Final deadline: Oct 26th at 11:59pm
summary: Alternative Breaks offers service-learning trips during academic breaks for UC Berkeley students to explore a social justice issue through education, reflection, and immersion into an impacted community.

name: Alternative Service Trips at Berkeley Law (Formerly known as Boalt on Break)
description:
BLAST is a student-led organization that operates in conjunction with Berkeley Law's Pro Bono Program. We are an alternative service break organization that offers students the opportunity to provide pro bono legal services outside of the Bay Area. Students work in partnership with and to support established grassroots legal services agencies, gaining insight into the ways these organizations adapt their work to the unique challenges and needs of their respective communities. BLAST is a service-learning experience that helps equip students with the tools to understand the complex needs of communities similar to and different from their own, helping foster an active generation of thoughtful community lawyers.

The Org's New Name is: Alternative Service Trips at Berkeley Law (Formerly known as Boalt on Break)
summary: BLAST is Berkeley Law's alternative spring break organization. Students travel for a week of service to provide pro bono legal support in communities outside the Bay Area.

name: American Advertising Federation
description:
Better known as imagiCal, we are UC Berkeley’s award-winning creative strategy agency. Established in 1980, imagiCal is a Haas-sponsored organization, serving as Berkeley's chapter of the American Advertising Federation.

We engage in real-world projects such as the National Student Advertising Competition, consulting projects, professional development events, and case workshops. 

We pride ourselves in our diverse community composed of students from various majors, passions, and backgrounds, allowing us to work cross-functionally across five departments: strategy, creative, public relations, media, and design, to elevate each other's ideas

Interested in learning more? Visit our website here.
summary: Better known as imagiCal, we are UC Berkeley’s award-winning creative strategy agency. Established in 1980, imagiCal is a Haas-sponsored organization, serving as Berkeley's chapter of the American Advertising Federation.

name: American Cancer Society of Berkeley
description:
Colleges Against Cancer: Our main goal is to bring the community together through offering support for anyone who has been affected by cancer in any way. We work with the Berkeley community through events and programs to raise cancer awareness.

Colleges Against Cancer is dedicated to saving lives from cancer. CAC focuses on three pillars: Advocacy, Education, and Survivorship. Through educating UC Berkeley students, as well as the public, we strive to increase advocacy for finding a cure for cancer. We also focus on hosting support groups for those who have been affected by cancer, whether that be personally or through a friend or family member. Whether it is writing letters to Congressmen, organizing community events, or teaching students about preventing cancer, this organization enables college students to battle cancer on their campus.

This group was formerly named Colleges Against Cancer [12/14/23] -LL
summary: Our main goal is to bring the community together by offering support for anyone who has been affected by cancer in any way. We work with the Berkeley community through events and programs to raise cancer awareness.

name: American Chemical Society at Berkeley Student Chapter
description:
ACS at Berkeley is the student chapter of the American Chemical Society here at Berkeley. We provide academic and professional resources for chemistry, chemical engineering, and chemical biology students through info-sessions, workshops, panels, talks, networking events, and mentoring/advising. In addition, we also promote chemistry throughout our local community through our education and outreach efforts at local schools. Through these efforts, we hope to offer a network and community for students interested in chemistry and related fields.

 

Our purpose:
The goal of ACS@Berkeley is to improve the academic and professional development of all undergraduates while fostering a sense of community among its members. By making research and internship opportunities more accessible and providing its members with educational outreach opportunities and career advancement resources, ACS@Berkeley positions its members to be leaders at the forefront of their respective fields.

 

Check out our website for more information! acs.berkeley.edu
summary: Professional Organization bridging the local and national ACS to the College of Chemistry and advancing professional and academic development. Visit our website for more information: acs.berkeley.edu

name: American Constitution Society at Berkeley
description:
ACS About Us

The American Constitution Society (ACS) believes that law should be a force to improve the lives of all people. ACS works for positive change by shaping debate on vitally important legal and constitutional issues through development and promotion of high-impact ideas to opinion leaders and the media; by building networks of lawyers, law students, judges and policymakers dedicated to those ideas; and by countering the activist conservative legal movement that has sought to erode our enduring constitutional values. By bringing together powerful, relevant ideas and passionate, talented people, ACS makes a difference in the constitutional, legal and public policy debates that shape our democracy.

Shaping Debate. The American Constitution Society brings together many of the country’s best legal minds to articulate a progressive vision of our Constitution and laws. Through its public programs (over 1,100 debates, conferences and press briefings across America each year), publications, and active on-line presence, ACS generates “intellectual capital” for ready use by progressive allies and shapes debates on key legal and public policy issues.

The American Constitution Society is also debunking conservative buzzwords such as “originalism” and “strict construction” that use neutral-sounding language but all too often lead to conservative policy outcomes. Using both traditional and new media to communicate with policymakers, judges, lawyers and the public at large, ACS presents a compelling vision of core constitutional values such as genuine equality, liberty, justice and the rule of law.

Building Networks. One of the American Constitution Society’s principal missions is nurturing the next generation of progressive lawyers, judges, policy experts, legislators and academics.

The engine that drives the organization’s work is its rapidly growing nationwide network: nearly 200 student chapters in law schools in 47 states, 34 lawyer chapters in large and small cities in every part of the country, and over 16,000 paying members and thousands of other supporters. ACS chapters offer platforms for debate and discussion about both enduring principles and the issues of the day, as well as provide opportunities for networking, mentoring and organizing around matters of both local and national significance.

Making a Difference. The strength of ACS’s ideas and the scope of its nationwide network enable it to make a difference in legal and public policy debates and ensure that law is a force to improve the lives of all people. Recent examples of ACS initiatives and programs having an impact include an Issue Brief on the constitutionality of the individual mandate in the health care reform legislation, cited during the Senate floor debate and entered into the Congressional Record; Senator Al Franken’s 2010 ACS National Convention speech in which he stated that “Originalism isn’t a pillar of our constitutional history; it’s a talking point;” and a concerted effort by ACS members to promote up-or-down votes on judicial nominations by engaging key decision makers.
summary: The American Constitution Society believes that law should be a force to improve the lives of all people. ACS works for change by shaping debate on important legal and constitutional issues, and by building networks of progressive legal professionals.

name: American Indian Graduate Student Association
description: The American Indian Graduate Student Association (AIGSA) is dedicated to bringing Native and Indigenous identifying graduate students together from across campus. Through academic, social, and outreach events, AIGSA works towards strengthening the Native American/Indigenous student community on-campus and beyond. AIGSA also provides opportunities for Native grad students to connect with other students, staff, and faculty who are Native or work in areas that impact Native peoples.
summary: The American Indian Graduate Student Association (AIGSA) is dedicated to bringing Native grad students together. Through academic, social, and outreach events, AIGSA works towards strengthening the Native student community on-campus and beyond.

name: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics at Berkeley
description: The objective of this organization is to further, within its institution, the purposes and programs of AIAA (the Institute). Additionally, the student branch is established to highlight to their university and local community the value of the aerospace industry and the role played by AIAA. Organizationally, student branches are part of the AIAA Regional Engagement Activities Division (READ).
summary: To provide resources for students interested, and/or pursuing a career in aerospace.

name: American Institute of Architecture Students
description:
The mission of The American Institute of Architecture Students is to promote excellence in architectural education, training, and practice; to foster an appreciation of architecture and related disciplines; to enrich communities in a spirit of collaboration; and to organize students and combine their efforts to advance the interdisciplinary field of architecture.

In the Berkeley chapter, we work in conjunction with the College of Environmental Design (CED) to form a community not just for architecture students but for all students inside and outside of CED.
summary: AIAS is a national, non-profit, student-run organization. The Berkeley chapter is affiliated with the national AIA through AIA East Bay. Through networking events, workshops, panels, and firm tours, we aim to expose students to the field of architecture.

name: American Institute of Chemical Engineers
description:
Our organization has one simple goal: to better the life of a Berkeley Chemical Engineer. We have several new programs such as mentorship to help undergraduate students academically and professionally. We have information and assistance for students looking for internships and on campus research positions. Want to know who the best professors are? AIChE can help. Whether you’re interested in industry or graduate school, AIChE provides the resources you need to succeed as a chemical engineer at Berkeley.

Throughout the year, and especially in the fall semester, Berkeley AIChE hosts a range of infosessions with companies like Chevron, Genentech, Procter and Gamble, Bolt Threads…just to name a few. And these companies are all interested in hiring full-time and interns from Berkeley. Basically – you guys!
summary: Welcome to the UC Berkeley Student Chapter of the American Institute of Chemical Engineers! Please visit our website aiche.berkeley.edu for more information.

name: American Lung Cancer Screening Initiative at Berkeley
description: The American Lung Cancer Screening Initiative (ALCSI) is a nonprofit 501(c)(3) organization consisting of physicians and students from across the country. By working with cities, local and national governments, and other organizations, ALCSI raises awareness for lung cancer and lung cancer screening. High-risk individuals can significantly benefit from lung cancer screening, and ALCSI focuses on promoting screening in this population to save lives.
summary: The American Lung Cancer Screening Initiative (ALCSI) at Berkeley raises awareness for lung cancer and promotes lung cancer screening for high-risk individuals.

name: American Medical Students Association: Berkeley Premedical Chapter
description:
The mission of the American Medical Student Association is to develop professionalism and activism in our members as physicians-in-training. We aim to prepare students for medical school by providing resources, support, and leadership development. As activists, we seek to educate premedical students about public health issues and advocacy, such as health policy, the culture of medicine, global health, and preventative medicine. We believe that comprehensive medical education is necessary for the development of every physician. If you are pre-med or pre-health, please consider joining our community!

Our general meetings and social activities for Fall 2023 will have both in-person and virtual options to accommodate different levels of accessibility. For more information, email us at berkeleyamsa@gmail.com, contact us on social media, or check out our website at amsa.berkeley.edu.
summary: The mission of Premed AMSA is to develop professionalism and activism in our members as physicians-in-training. We aim to prepare students for medical school by providing resources, leadership development, and discussions on social justice and equity.

name: American Medical Women's Association at Berkeley
description:
AMWA at Berkeley is a Premedical division branch of the National American Medical Women's Association. AMWA membership is comprised of physicians, residents, medical students, pre-medical students, health care professionals, and supporters.  AMWA is the oldest multispecialty organization dedicated to advancing women in medicine and improving women’s health.

 

AMWA at Berkeley aims to advance women in medicine, advocate for equity, and ensure excellence in healthcare. We seek to continuously empower and inspire our members through providing a loving and supportive platform for voices to be heard and transform ideas into realities. As a chapter divided into five task force-focused sub-committees (Mental Health, Cancer & Women’s Health, Gender & Sexual Health, Childhood Nutrition Education, Diversity in Medicine), we love to discuss topics that include women in medicine, women’s health, and gender equity. And, as a professional and community service-oriented organization, AMWA Berkeley offers opportunities for mentorship, professional development, volunteering, and support for individuals interested in healthcare careers.

 

We welcome new members at the beginning of every semester but you are welcome to join anytime throughout the school year! We post information about infosessions, events, meetings, and pictures that our members capture on our Instagram, so follow us to stay updated!

 

About AMWA Berkeley!

 

#STEMinist Campaign
summary: AMWA strives to empower those involved in medicine and health-related fields by focusing on women's issues, equality, and intersectionality. It will also promote service in the community and support members' professional and personal development.

name: American Nuclear Society
description:
The American Nuclear Society is a not-for-profit, international, scientific and educational organization.  It was established by a group of individuals who recognized the need to unify the professional activities within the diverse fields of nuclear science and technology.  December 11, 1954, marks the Society’s historic beginning at the National Academy of Sciences in Washington, D.C.  ANS has since developed a multifarious membership composed of approximately 10,500 engineers, scientists, administrators, and educators representing 1,600 plus corporations, educational institutions, and government agencies.  It is governed by three officers and a board of directors elected by the membership.

We, The Student Chapter

The American Nuclear Society (ANS) Student Branch at University of California Berkeley is a subsidiary of the National ANS. The main objectives of the ANS Student Branch is consistent with those of the National ANS, which is to promote the advancement of science and engineering relating to the atomic nucleus and of allied sciences and arts.We are formed and managed by a group of students interested to contribute toward the development of nuclear science and technology at the University of California through activities in which student members and faculty may participate.Most of us are students in the Nuclear Engineering Department but we welcome students from all backgrounds to join us. The only requirements we ask for is a desire to learn and an open-mind for new technology.

We organize events for the benefit of our own members as well as to promote understanding of nuclear technology on campus. The recent focus of this society has been to increase public awareness of the many benefits of nuclear technology and its place in our future. With the increasing threats of nuclear terrorism, our aim is to educate the public on the safety issues and responsibilities related to nuclear power generation as well as the peaceful use of nuclear materials in medical radiation as well as food processing industries.

Our student section has sent many students to the ANS national conferences over the years. In 2002, UC Berkeley-ANS sponsored the National Student Conference for ANS and the conference was a tremendous success in bringing together students from all over the country to present information on latest technology in the field and to foster interaction between like-minded current and future scientists.

Our Mission

The American Nuclear Society serves its members in their efforts to develop and safely apply nuclear science and technology for public benefit through knowledge exchange, professional development, and enhanced public understanding.

 

To receive our periodic emails about upcoming events and opportunities, please subscribe to our mailing list at tinyurl.com/ANS-MailingList and check out our website at https://ans.nuc.berkeley.edu
summary: The American Nuclear Society serves its members in their efforts to develop and safely apply nuclear science and technology for public benefit through knowledge exchange, professional development, and enhanced public understanding.

name: American Optometric Student Association
description: The AOSA is committed to empowering students to thrive as doctors of optometry and strives to be the guiding force that leads students into successful and impactful careers. https://vimeo.com/272671913
summary: The AOSA is committed to empowering students to thrive as doctors of optometry and strives to be the guiding force that leads students into successful and impactful careers.

name: American Physician Scientist Association at Berkeley
description: The mission of APSA at Berkeley (American Physician Scientists Association at Berkeley) is to spread awareness of physician-scientist and MD-PhD programs. It prepares members for training and development as physician-scientists by networking at the local and regional level, provides resources for success in MD-PhD programs, and inspires others to pursue careers as research physicians through community outreach and education. Everyone is welcome!
summary: APSA at Berkeley is dedicated to everyone who is interested in being a physician-scientist or MD-PhD in the future and/or would like to know more about this academic and career path.

name: American Red Cross at Cal
description:
Want to save a life? If so, keep reading!

American Red Cross at Cal is an organization that includes 5 committees: Blood, Health & Safety, Disaster, Community Engagement, and Publicity. We provide opportunities that allow students to volunteer at blood drives, CPR/ First Aid training, and humanitarian relief/youth services. Join our diverse community of students who are making an immediate impact on those who need it most. For more information, use the contact resources listed below- we look forward to meeting you!

Contact email: americanredcrossatcal@gmail.com
Follow our Instagram for regular updates: @arcatcal
Get added to our Newsletter: https://forms.gle/cj1wKoXjGKkeWYEj9
Website: https://redcrossatcal.org/
summary: ARC@Cal has 5 lines of services: Blood, Health & Safety, Disaster, and Community Engagement. Join us to volunteer at blood drives, CPR training, and humanitarian services with our diverse community to make an immediate impact on those who need it most!

name: American Sign Language at Berkeley
description:
ASL at Berkeley aims to discuss and learn ASL, facilitate a community between hearing and Deaf communities, and to bring awareness to ableism and the issues that the Deaf community face. Our goal is to spread resources made by the Deaf and hard of hearing people to amplify their point of views on the issues they face. 

 

If you are interested in bringing awareness to the issues the Deaf community faces, learning basic ASL then join us at one of our meetings. 

Fill out our Membership Form to keep up with meetings and events: https://forms.gle/ZtPQkccWFGWMAQaP6 

Follow us on instagram @aslatberkeley or join our discord (https://discord.gg/kuUqwJDUUQ).
summary: The purpose is to learn and discuss ASL, to facilitate a community between hearing and Deaf communities, and to bring awareness to ableism and the issues facing the Deaf community. We will also host events and activities surrounding ASL and Deaf culture.

name: American Society of Civil Engineers
description: The American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) at Berkeley is a college chapter of the globally recognized community of Civil Engineers pushing the boundaries of the Civil Engineering profession. As an extension of the broader organization, ASCE serves the civil and environmental engineering community on the UC Berkeley campus. We promote the civil engineering profession on a college level by fostering a fun and inclusive community, by offering career preparatory workshops, by hosting professional development events (e.g. company-sponsored infosessions and career fairs), by peer-to-peer mentoring, and overall providing resources to promote the success of our students.
summary: The Berkeley Chapter of American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) contributes to the enrichment of the broad civil engineering profession by serving the civil engineering community at Berkeley through social and professional development opportunities.

name: American Society of Landscape Architects
description:
The UC Berkeley student chapter of the American Society of Landscape Architects(ASLA@Berkeley) is the student group representing all students studying landscape architecture, environmental planning and urban design (serving BLA, MLA, MLA-EP, MUD, and Ph.D students).

ASLA@Berkeley coordinates professional development and skill-building opportunities, organizes social and community service activities, and represents the student’s voice at faculty and curriculum committee meetings, to the ASUC and GA, to the CED Dean’s office and to the regional and national ASLA organizations.
summary: The UC Berkeley student chapter of the American Society of Landscape Architects(ASLA@Berkeley) is the student group representing all students studying landscape architecture, environ. planning + urban design (serving BLA, MLA, MLA-EP, MUD, and Ph.Ds)

name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers
description:
The American Society of Mechanical Engineers is a professional engineering organization dedicated to the professional development of engineering students on the Berkeley campus.

We help students network with corporations, startups, other professional societies, and their fellow engineers. In addition to our numerous professional events, we also sponsor a number of social events throughout the semester in order to better foster a tightly-knit, positive engineering community.
summary: The American Society of Mechanical Engineers is a engineering organization dedicated to the professional development and community of mechanical engineering students on UC Berkeley's campus.

name: America’s ToothFairy at Berkeley
summary:
To: 
1. Provide education about the importance of oral health to children and the Berkeley community
2. Deliver accessible resources to underserved children 
3. Develop social skills and establish positive relationships with members of the community

name: Amores Valientes
description: Amores Valientes is a community of Queer & Trans Latinx students at University of California Berkeley. The purpose of AV is to provide a safe space, to create a social environment for networking and community building for the Queer/Trans Latinx community on campus. AV does this by having programming and collaborating with other organizations on campus following the democratic principles of participation and where respect and confidentiality are fostered. Our meeting times will be on our Instagram linked below, if not @amores_valientes
summary: The purpose of AV is to provide a safe space, to create a social environment for networking and community building for the Queer/Trans Latinx community on campus.

name: Analytics @ Berkeley
summary: To create a registered student organization that enhances the industry exposure for the students of M.Analytics program and provides for networking opportunities both within the cohort  and outside it.

name: Analytics Consulting Organization at Berkeley
summary: ACOrB is a graduate student-led analytics consulting organization in collaboration with UC Berkeley IEOR Analytics that aims to match IEOR Analytics students to work with multiple organizations in the Summer semester.

name: Animal Legal Defense Fund of Berkeley Law
description:
The ALDF is dedicated to providing a forum for education, advocacy, and scholarship aimed at protecting the lives and advancing the interests of animals through the legal system, and raising the profile of the field of animal law.

ALDF aims to: (1) educate the UC Berkeley community about forms of institutionalized animal abuse, and (2) foster awareness about means of combating this abuse through litigation. We hope to provide opportunities, education, and assistance to Berkeley Law students working to promote positive legal protection of animal welfare.
summary: ALDFBL mission is to protect the lives and advance the interests of animals through the legal system.

name: ANova
description:
Berkeley ANova is a student organization that seeks to empower students by providing computer science education and mentorship to under-resourced schools and marginalized communities. Our mentors develop individualized curriculum to teach at each of our middle and high school partner sites with the goal of increasing equitable exposure and accessibility to the tech space.

 

Each ANova member attends weekly sites visits at our partnered schools and volunteers at events like ANova College Mentorship Program (a college-readiness program for high school students) and ANova Hacks (a 24-hour hackathon for high school students with little to no programming experience). 

 

ANova is driven by a tight-knit community of UC Berkeley students, who are passionate about social issues, educational outreach, and computer science mentorship. As part of our committees, members work on various projects such as curriculum building, web development, and event planning.

 

We're excited to welcome new members this semester! No CS experience is required - just a willingness to learn. Please apply at: https://www.berkeleyanova.org/join 

 

For updated information on the recruitment process 

- Follow us on Instagram: @berkeleyanova

- Check this Facebook event
summary: Making access to computer science education and opportunities more equitable, available, and achievable for students of all backgrounds.

name: Anthropology Undergraduate Association
description:
The Anthropology Undergraduate Association is a club for undergraduate students interested in anthropology that provides academic enrichment, professional enhancement, career guidance, and social events. 

 

Please email or contact us on social media for any questions.
summary: The Anthropology Undergraduate Association welcomes Anthropology majors, minors, and other interested students to attend their many informative, academic, collaborative, and social events, which are held throughout the school year.

name: Argentine Tango Club of Berkeley
description:
The Argentine Tango Club of Berkeley offers free weekly beginner tango classes and semesterly social dances for students and Cal affiliates! Community members are welcome to join at $10/class.

Check us out at https://argentinetangoclubofberkeley.weebly.com/ or visit our Facebook group 'Argentine Tango Club of Berkeley'.

Contact info: ucbtango@gmail.com
summary: Welcome to UC Berkeley's Argentine Tango Club, organized by UC Berkeley students and staff, but open to tango dancers everywhere! Tango is an improvisational social dance which originated in Argentina and Uruguay, but is now danced all around the world.

name: Armenian Pre-Health Society
description: This organization is a way for Armenian peers to connect with graduate students in thier intended pre-health fields while allowing them to make connections and enable them to network with others.
summary: As an organization we would like to strengthen the Armenian community specifically those interested in any health related field while forming a series of connections and networks that can be used to help them in the future.

name: Armenian Pre-Law Society
summary: Most Armenian individuals are first-generation college students with no prior knowledge of maintaining their academics and careers. Our organization will be able to provide pre-law students with the knowledge they need to succeed.

name: Armenian Student Association
description:
The Armenian Students Association at the University of California, Berkeley was founded in 1976. Its mission since has been to foster a community where Armenian students can embrace their heritage and cultivate a spirit of appreciation towards Armenian history and culture through social, cultural, philanthropic, and professional events. 

ASA strives to foster and support its members, as well as enhance their college experience at Cal by allowing them to come together and connect with their roots, give back to their community, and celebrate their culture and history without any outside political affiliations and/or religious influence.
summary: Join our group to receive up-to-date news and information about events hosted by the Armenian Students' Association at UC Berkeley.

name: Army ROTC Cadet Club
description: The student organization working to support the Army ROTC battalion in non-government funded activities and to boost member morale and relationships.
summary: The student organization working to support the Army ROTC battalion in non-government funded activities and to boost member morale and relationships.

name: Arnold Air Society
description: The Arnold Air Society is a professional, honorary, service organization advocating the support of aerospace power.
summary: To provides opportunities for U.S. Air Force officer candidates to participate in campus and community service activities, demonstrating the close relationship between civilian and military institutions.

name: Aro/Ace Space at Berkeley
summary: Aro/Ace Space at Berkeley is a safe space for Berkeley students on the asexual and aromantic spectrums. We host social events and gatherings for the asexual and aromantic community at Berkeley, and celebrate Ace Week and Aro Week each year!

name: Art and Mind
description: Art & Mind will meet for general meetings in which any Berkeley student is welcome to join. Our meetings are a combination of art de-stress events (such as painting, collaging, drawing, poetry, etc.), mindfulness activities, and guest speaker meetings with professionals in the art and/or mental health field. Painting materials are provided. The goal is to promote mental health awareness by de-stressing through art.
summary: The Art & Mind Club aims to promote mental health education and provides a safe space for Berkeley students to de-stress through art therapy.

name: Art Law Society
summary: The Organization exists to inspire creativity among law students, foster community between students and art law professionals, and to encourage participation in and access to the arts at Berkeley Law.

name: Artists in Resonance
description:
Artists in Resonance, casually known on campus as AiR, is the premiere indie co-ed a cappella group at the University of California, Berkeley. From our humble beginnings in 1987, we now have sixteen amazing performers and perform a repertoire of self-arranged pieces, with everything from alternative rock and hip-hop to traditional fight songs and Top 40 hits.

During the school year, you can find us singing on Sproul Plaza on Mondays at 1 pm, but don’t be surprised if you also see us performing around the Bay Area (and all throughout California) at a variety of gigs and events! We have made appearances at the Annual Big Sing-Off (UC Berkeley/Stanford), the California A Cappella Festival (UC Los Angeles), the West Coast A Cappella Showcase (UC Berkeley), and the International Championship of Collegiate A Cappella.

Interested in hiring us? Email artistsinresonanceucb@gmail.com

Interested in auditioning? Follow our Instagram @artistsinresonance for information about our auditions process and timeline!
summary: Artists in Resonance, commonly known as AiR, is Berkeley's premiere independent co-ed a cappella group. Our repertoire includes self-arranged pieces, with everything from alternative rock and hip-hop to traditional fight songs and Top 40 hits.

name: Arts and Innovation Representation
summary: Arts and Innovation Representation is a Berkeley Law Student-Initiated Legal Services Project (SLP) that provides opportunities for law students to get engaged in pro bono legal work on behalf of artists in California and abroad.

name: ASCE Sustainable Solutions
description: Sustainable Solutions Competition Team is an American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE) competition team that competes in the annual Mid-Pacific Conference held in April. Throughout the school year, we provide members unique, hands-on experience in a variety of Civil Engineering aspects such as sustainability, design, and construction. Our work really mimics that of the industry as some more specific topics we cover include life cycle assessment, shop fabrication, and sustainable design. We also support our members by providing several resources to build their skills including 3D modeling, leadership, and communication. Nonetheless, we really focus on fostering a supportive and welcoming community! You do not need any experience coming in as we will be sure to give you all the information and resources needed to thrive! Overall, if you are hoping to grow outside of your courses while still having some fun, come join our team!
summary: ASCE Sustainable Solutions Competition Team allows students to apply principles of structural and construction engineering to design and fabricate sustainable structures under real-world scenarios facing the built environment.

name: ASCEND
description:
Ascend is the premier business organization dedicated to enabling its members and the community to leverage the leadership and global business potential of its members.The Ascend Berkeley Chapter focuses on a wide range of business industries; such as, accounting, consulting, finance, investment banking, and marketing.

Our Berkeley student chapter provides a variety of events and learning opportunities that allow our members to strengthen their professional skills, explore career fields, and make long-lasting friendships. 

Find out more about how you can get involved today at http://www.ascendberkeley.org and at our FB page https://www.facebook.com/ascendberkeleychapter.

We welcome students of all majors and years and encourage you to discover what truly makes our organization unique and successful.

Connect. Inspire. Ascend.
summary: Ascend is the premier business organization dedicated to enabling its members and the community to leverage the leadership and global business potential of its members. The Ascend Berkeley Chapter mainly focuses on the accounting and finance industries.

name: Asha for Education, Berkeley
description:
About Us: https://youtu.be/R8Feq7XARtw

Learn more at: berkeley.ashanet.org

Facebook: @ashaberkeley

Instagram: @asha_berkeley
summary: Asha for Education is a nonprofit organization geared towards catalyzing socio-economic change by funding education projects for the underprivileged in India, especially children.

name: Asian American and Pacific Islander Health Research Group
description:
AAPIHRG Video

We are a group of San Francisco Bay Area health professionals and UC Berkeley undergraduates/alumni. On this campus—where 42% of students identified as Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) in 2008—there was not a single academic course devoted to the study of health in AAPI communities. The AAPI Health Research Group (AAPIHRG) was formed in 2008 to fill this void. The purpose of this group is to share our journey and findings in AAPI community health with other students and community professionals who may wish to join us or contribute to the work.

Although the aggregate data for our community paints a picture of a healthy population, we know that good health is not enjoyed by all. Our community is not homogeneous. The diversity of the many ethnic groups that make up the AAPI community presents challenges in obtaining accurate data. Students who come from these diverse backgrounds can be an important conduit in raising our awareness of health problems that exist in these communities. This can foster a deeper understanding of health in the broader AAPI community.

Besides the 4-unit Spring course (ASAMST 190 - "Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander Community Health: Foundational Theories & Contemporary Issues"), we are inviting you to take part in our next steps as we develop as a student organization. We are open to all students interested in community health and specifically the AAPI community. We hope that through this organization, we foster in students a desire to serve the community as well as provide opportunities for leadership development and networking.

We invite your participation in AAPIHRG as a student or as a health professional sharing the following vision and mission:

VISION

A healthy community can only exist within a healthy society. We strive to improve the health of the Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) communities through research and service within the community and through social activism in society.

MISSION

The AAPI Health Research Group was formed in the spring of 2008. The purpose is to encourage students to engage in AAPI community health in the following five areas:

  1. diversity of the AAPI communities
  2. historical perspective
  3. epidemiological perspective
  4. medical perspective
  5. social change
summary: A healthy community can only exist within a healthy society. We strive to improve the health of the Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) communities through research and service within the community and through social activism in society.

name: Asian American Association
description: The purpose of the Asian American Association is to be at the forefront of uniting the Asian American community at Berkeley. AAA seeks to develop proactive and community-oriented leaders through a social, educational awareness, and service network. It enhances the quality of life at Berkeley through its focus on diversity appreciation.
summary: The purpose of the Asian American Association is to be at the forefront of uniting the Asian American community at Berkeley. AAA seeks to develop proactive and community-oriented leaders through a social, educational awareness, and service network.

name: Asian American Christian Fellowship
description:
We are a student-run Christian organization seeking to create a warm, Christ-centered community.

 

Mission: The mission of Asian American Christian Fellowship (AACF) is to reach into the university and collegiate community, primarily those who are Asian Pacific Americans, with the life changing message of Jesus Christ.
