Learn project management, develop your problem-solving skills, and utilize technical knowledge in an impactful way. Connect with like-minded individuals and find your community. All Coding Experience Welcome!
summary: Code For Good works to support non-profit organizations with technology solutions to help bring positive change in our communities. Everyone gets the chance to work on something they are passionate about and push their own talents.

name: Codebase
description:
Codebase is a UC Berkeley student organization which aims to make industry experience more accessible to students and empower students to break into the software industry through semesterly projects with high-growth tech companies. We're a tight-knit community of developers, friends, and mentors who support and uplift each other throughout the college experience.

We're looking for students with little coding experience who want to learn and grow with us by developing a project to service local non-profits, as well as students who may have side project/internship experience but want to find a fun, driven community while working on an industry project together.

Every semester, our members work closely with industry clients to flesh out tailor-made software development projects. Developers work in small groups with their project managers for 13 weeks developing their technical skills and gaining industry experience.

Past non-profit clients include the Berkeley Food Pantry, CoFED (a QTBIPOC-led organization that partners with young folks of color to build food and land co-ops!), and campus orgs such as The Green Initiative Fund, and The Berkeley Project. Past industry clients include Postman, Atlassian, Ginger, Relativity Space, and a range of other small to mid-size companies which can give us a tailored and fulfilling experience.

Interested in joining us? 
Our application for Fall 2022 is coming soon -- keep an eye out on our social media.

For more information:
- Visit our website for more information: codebase.berkeley.edu/
- Like our FB page: www.facebook.com/berkeleycodebase
- Follow us on IG: @berkeleycodebase
- Learn more about us: bit.ly/codebase_about_us
summary: Codebase is a UC Berkeley student community which aims to make industry experience more accessible. We empower students to break into the software industry through semesterly projects with high-growth tech companies and non-profits.

name: Codeology
description:
Whether coding is already your passion or you’ve yet to print your first “Hello World,” Codeology aims to provide a tight-knit community to support you in “finding your fit” in the world of tech. Through projects, professional development, industry events, and social events, we offer opportunities to help you explore different roles in the tech industry and develop technical expertise in your area of interest.

 

Learn More About Us:

Projects: Every semester, we introduce varying personal projects as well as client projects as an opportunity for our members to explore interesting niches in the tech industry and gain experience as developers. Topics can range from AI/ML to data analytics to iOS development and more. Check out what projects we've been working on!

Community: Codeology offers a supportive environment for members to grow within the computer science community whether that be through mentorship, our weekly socials, Tree/Leaf program, or spontaneous trips to SF! We reward kindness and taking action in order to foster an enjoyable and motivated culture that encourages the sharing of ideas. Check out our instagram to see what our members have been up to! 

 

Interested in joining the community? Follow us on social media for Fall 2023 Recruitment updates!

⭐️ Instagram

⭐️ Facebook

⭐️ Website
summary: Codeology aims to help students of all years and majors explore the tech industry. We offer personal projects to develop experience and familiarity of various computer science area. Primarily, we are a community of people who love helping each other.

name: Codify
description: Codify is an organization created by and for the Berkeley computer science community. We strive to provide opportunities for students to find their place in tech, explore their entrepreneurial aspirations, and use their skills to give back to their communities. We are always looking for passionate students to join our ranks, and partner organizations to work with towards our mutual goals.
summary: Codify aims to give students the opportunity to work on impactful technical projects in order to promote the professional growth of its members.

name: Coffee Club at Berkeley (CCB)
description:
At Coffee Club at Berkeley, our main focus is to dive deep into our coffee. In this club, we teach students about the numerous coffee brewing techniques and each student has the opportunity to brew their own cup of coffee, using the equipment, ingredients, and recipes provided. In addition to having indoor workshops, we also host outdoor workshops, try out local coffee shops, and attend various events, like the SF Coffee Festival, to expand our coffee knowledge and palette. At CCB, we strive to create an open and inclusive environment because we believe that coffee should be for everyone. We hope that our members can create a cup of coffee that’ll fill the hearts of their friends, families, and loved ones. We are the first coffee club on campus and we are low commitment; our priority is to provide the best caffeinated experience that tailors to anyone’s needs, likings, and experience level.

To learn more about us and join our club, visit https://linktr.ee/coffeeclubatberkeley!
summary: Coffee Club at Berkeley shares experiences and knowledge to help the Berkeley community better appreciate a nice cup of coffee. It is our mission to create a fun, learning environment for all coffee lovers to experience coffee to the fullest.

name: Cognitive Science Students Association
description:
The Cognitive Science Students Association (CSSA) is an undergraduate student organization at UC Berkeley whose mission is to support and enrich the academic life of students interested in the interdisciplinary field of Cognitive Science. The CSSA strives to build a sense of community among students and provides them with valuable opportunities for personal, academic, and career development. The CSSA regularly coordinates academic events such as guest lectures and information sessions; plans social events like professor-student dinners and movie nights; and advocates for cognitive science students by working with CogSci faculty and university officials. Each year, the CSSA also plans, organizes, and hosts the California Cognitive Science Conference, a large academic conference featuring talks from Cognitive Science researchers from across the state as well as showcasing the exceptional work of undergraduates conducting research in Cognitive Science.

Check out our website: cssa.berkeley.edu

Join our Facebook Group: facebook.com/groups/Cal.CSSA
summary: The Cognitive Science Students Association (CSSA) is an undergraduate student organization at UC Berkeley whose mission is to support and enrich the academic life of students interested in the interdisciplinary field of Cognitive Science.

name: Collaborative Dorms Society
summary: The Collaborative Dorms Society looks to give residents inspiration for building community within dorm halls. Specifically, the society builds a list of common norms, goods, and ideas that will give residents a strong collaborative dorm.

name: College Admissions Mentorship Program (Formerly People's Test Preparation Service)
description:
CAMP (College Admissions Mentorship Program), formerly People's Test Preparation Service (PTPS) was founded in 1995 at the University of California, Berkeley and is a non-profit, student-run organization dedicated to providing volunteer college counseling for underserved communities. We strive to provide free, personalized college counseling services to high school students by guiding our students through selecting colleges to apply to, the essay process, applying for financial aid, and more!

 

This group [College Admissions Mentorship Program] was formerly named [People's Test Preparation Service] - 9/23/21 IZ
summary: An organization dedicated to providing free college admissions mentorship to low-income high school students.

name: Combat Robotics at Berkeley
description:
Combat Robotics at Berkeley started with a singular obsession: make a BattleBot. Through the countless design iterations, late nights working on CAD and backbreaking machining to finish our 250lb BattleBot Glitch, CRB’s become so much more: an awesome way to develop our hands-on engineering, marketing and business skills; an outlet to pour our competitive nature into robotic optimization; and a tight knit community of friends.

 

We’re proud of how much CRB has grown in a year, and have been awestruck competing and connecting with the professional engineers we’ve been watching on BattleBots for years. We’re excited for our three new member teams to develop, and hope we influence students to get involved in robotics.

 

Combat Robotics at Berkeley is a sponsored organization under the ASUC, UC Berkeley’s student association and a 501c3 nonprofit. CRB is entirely student run, with over forty undergraduate students split into four projects and four technical and nontechnical subteams.
summary: At Combat Robotics at Berkeley, our goal is to promote hands-on and theoretical engineering principles while designing a combat robot to compete on the Discovery Channel's show BattleBots.

name: Community Defense Project
description:
Public attention to systemic injustices within the criminal legal system have increased significantly over the past decade. Despite efforts to call out the harm perpetrated by police and prisons, the criminal court process remains a black box. However, judges, prosecutors, and defense attorneys play a huge role in determining whether and how people are sentenced to incarceration after arrest.

For the past three years, a group of court watch volunteers in Alameda County have observed how courts are dealing with rising COVID cases in jails, using money bail versus pretrial alternatives, and treating defendants and their loved ones in hearings. We are looking for volunteers to join us in this effort to uncover what is happening in the criminal courts, share this information with the public, and hold court officials accountable to the communities they are supposed to serve.

The Community Defense Project will also focus on broader community education related to local District Attorneys and the role they play within the criminal legal system, as well as equip community members with necessary support to help combat the system at large. A report published by the Urban Peace Movement and the ACLU can be found here: https://meetyourda.org/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/acda-press-release.pdf(opens in a new tab)

Students will participate in a number of projects depending on Urban Peace Movement’s needs. The main areas of impact are court watching and participatory defense. This will entail: observing court hearings and noteworthy trials in person (and online); writing reports, compiling data, and consolidating court watch observations to present to community organizers; preparing family members from the participatory defense hub to present statements and compile biography packets about their incarcerated loved ones for mitigation purposes; conducting legal research as needed; and generally supporting Urban Peace Movement with ongoing projects and priorities (current focuses include diversion court, resentencing proceedings, and criminal legal system accountability). Students will work in pairs for the participatory defense work. We will also aim to incorporate the ongoing ideas and interests of group members in determining our work.
summary: The Community Defense Project ("CPD”) empowers community members and law students to hold public officials accountable for the injustices they perpetuate within the Alameda County criminal system. CPD observes court proceedings and supports defendants.

name: Community Legal Outreach
description: Community Legal Outreach (CLO) recruits and trains first year law students at Berkeley Law to conduct legal workshops and provide legal services, counseling, and referrals for the benefit of low income individuals in the surrounding community.  The workshops are conducted under the supervision of lawyers from the East Bay Community Law Center.  All of our legal services are completely free.
summary: CLO, aka The Tenants’ Rights Workshop, helps protect the legal rights and remedies of tenants in Oakland, Berkeley, and Alameda. During weekly clinics, students interview clients and then work one-on-one with staff attorneys from EBCLC

name: Community Projects
description: Community Projects (CP) is a registered umbrella organization that supports a coalition of UC Berkeley service organizations in partnership with the Public Service Center.
summary: Our mission is to offer service groups the opportunity to network and collaborate, build coalitions with local organizations and across student groups, receive critical funding, and participate in social justice/leadership training.

name: Comparative Literature Publication Association (formerly known as Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal/ Vagabond)
description:
The Comparative Literature Publication Association runs two biannual publications—the Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal and the Vagabond multilingual magazine. 

The Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal is a peer-reviewed, international journal that showcases undergraduate research in comparative texts and media. Our published articles treat a broad range of topics including, but not limited to, theoretical literary discourse, international trends in literature, and comparisons of at least two national literatures. 

The Vagabond multilingual magazine publishes undergraduate-level creative work in prose, poetry, translation, art criticism, and visual art. Selected pieces showcase an attentiveness to the resonance of multiple languages and the expressive force of varied art forms.
summary: CLPA provides undergraduates around the world the opportunity to share their literary works. The Association runs two top-notch, peer-reviewed undergraduate publications--the Comparative Literature Undergraduate Journal and Vagabond Magazine.

name: Competitive Programming at Berkeley
summary: To host tutorials, competitions, and other events relating to Competitive Programming, and to prepare students for competitions such as Codeforces and the International Collegiate Programming Competition (ICPC)

name: Computer Science Graduate Student Association
summary: The purpose of the CSGSA is to promote the common good and general welfare of the computer science graduate student community at UC Berkeley, the University community, and the wider computer science community.

name: Computer Science Mentors
description: The EECS department has a great support system for current lower division courses. However, as the lower division courses expand to over 1,000 students, the support system needs to scale to meet the demands of the courses. The majority of computer science courses, for instance, is composed of undergraduates, and thus it is necessary to encourage students to continue lab assisting and tutoring in order to better handle the needs of students learning computer science. Through creating a community of computer science mentors and teachers, the system will be better equipped to support those in need it. CSM will be unique from other organizations through its approach to providing support to students taking computer science classes. The organization will strive to create a safe community of EECS educators, mentors, and students, not only to encourage educational theory discussions, but also to provide solid social support for students. Through individualized attention and encouraging general student interaction in addition to academic support, CSM will attempt to lower the barrier to entry to both taking courses and getting help in the EECS department.
summary: CSM offers an open and inclusive community space for students in computer science to receive individualized academic and social support. We coordinate various events, provide supplementary courses, and tutoring opportunities.

name: Computer Science Undergraduate Association
description:
The Computer Science Undergraduate Association supports the undergraduate computer science student body at UC Berkeley and acts as an entry point to industry. The CSUA hosts tech talks, hackathons, info sessions, CS workshops, LAN parties, and more!

Looking for a place to learn more about computer science and meet other students, or want to become a member? If so, come visit us at our office (311 Soda)!

Please check https://www.csua.berkeley.edu/join/ to create an account on our computers and be added to our mailing list, go to csua.org/discord to join our Discord, and go to csua.slack.com to join our Slack channel (our main form of communication).
summary: The Computer Science Undergraduate Association supports the undergraduate computer science student body at UC Berkeley and acts as an entry point to industry. The CSUA hosts tech talks, hackathons, info sessions, CS workshops, LAN parties, and more!

name: Comunidad for Health Equity
description: Comunidad for Health Equity (CHE) is a pre-health/pre-med student-run organization at UC Berkeley that educates, empowers, and advocates for the health of the Latinx community. We are students pursuing a career in the health field (Doctors, Nurses, Dentists, Optometrists, Public Health professionals, etc.) and are interested in health issues that affect the Latinx community. Our goals are to motivate students, instill the desire to help the underserved, create a supportive environment, and provide health resources to empower the communities of Berkeley and Oakland. Our organization's General Meetings feature esteemed Latinx health professionals as guest speakers, conducting informative workshops on crucial topics like healthcare reform, mental health, and diabetes, and participating in the Minorities in Health Conference. We also prioritize community service, networking, and team-building events, while organizing socials and fundraisers like Taco Sales on Sproul. We provide academic support through study hours, 1/2 Unit Decal and offer scholarships for Latinx students, as well as opportunities for leadership development through our Intern Program with Board Officers.
summary: Members of CHE attend weekly general meetings, socials, and health conferences, build familias, volunteer, fundraise, and gain exposure in the health field. Join an outstanding network of students, alumni, and successful leaders in healthcare!

name: Concrete Canoe
description:
From our 2023-24 Project Manager:

https://youtu.be/a2mKx-dINoU

-

Hello! We are Cal Concrete Canoe, UC Berkeley’s first civil engineering competition team. We provide a welcoming community where students can learn, gain hands-on experience, and create something they can be proud of. Concrete canoe competes annually in the ASCE-sponsored concrete canoe competition, where we are challenged to apply knowledge from our courses and experience from our team to a large-scale project.

-

The concrete canoe team is unique from other student organizations because we encompass many disciplines of engineering; participating in our team exposes students to disciplines like construction, materials science, structural analysis, and environmental engineering. In addition, as a competition team, we help individuals grow and build leadership and teamwork skills. Despite being a civil engineering competition team, we welcome students from all majors and backgrounds; this diversity helps bring new ideas and concepts towards our project and competition!

-

Our team is comprised of divisions, each specializing in a subject to allow for our team to function:
• Construction
• Materials Design
• Quality Assurance and Quality Control
• Hull Design and Structural Analysis
• Graphics Design
• Paddling

-

Our team holds a long history of success in our competition, and with our continuous alumni support, we enable students to call upon a large, knowledgeable alumni network. In our team, students have the ability to grow outside of their courses!

-

If you are interested in joining us, please join our discord: https://discord.gg/Vbw2hNhZ

-

Watch a recap video from our 2019 competition:

https://youtu.be/0SlWDh7KXio
summary: We are Cal Concrete Canoe, UC Berkeley’s first civil engineering competition team. We provide a welcoming community where students can learn, gain hands-on experience, and create something they can be proud of.

name: Conscious Living Club at Berkeley
description: The Conscious Living Club at Berkeley is meant for creating a community of students who live a life of higher consciousness keeping God in the center. Moving away from the conception of “I” and “mine”, this club aims to spread the consciousness of being loving, sharing, caring and being compassionate to everyone through the process of self-realization. Activities of the club include studying wisdom texts of the East, mantra-meditation, having soulful Kirtans (special songs and prayers to God) during regular gatherings.
summary: The Conscious Living Club at Berkeley is meant for creating a community of students who live a life of higher consciousness keeping God in the center.

name: Construction Competition Team
description:
The Construction Competition Team provides students the opportunity to learn about construction and project management skills and techniques, with the intent of competing in the Associated Schools of Construction Region 6 and 7 competition.

The team aims to develop the technical, professional, and soft skills of our members, in order to prepare them for success in both the competition and multiple disciplines within the construction industry.
summary: The Construction Competition Team provides students the opportunity to learn about construction and project management skills and techniques, with the intent of competing in the Associated Schools of Construction Region 6 and 7 competition.

name: Consult Your Community (CYC) at Berkeley
description: Consult Your Community is a nationwide, student-run nonprofit organization that empowers America’s top undergraduate students to leverage their knowledge of business with their passion for service. Students engage with small businesses, nonprofits, and startups over the course of a semester through an innovative program in which they are trained to provide business owners with comprehensive consulting services while being advised by business school faculty, graduate student mentors, and experienced professionals from top-tier consulting firms. Through this process, students gain hands-on business experience and develop skills that prepare them for their future careers, while business owners become empowered to foster their own economic independence and secure their future prosperity, both of which contribute directly to our nation’s economic development and long-term sustainability.
summary: Join us in inspiring a generation to empower the 6,000,000 small businesses that drive the success of our nation!

name: Consumer Advocacy and Protection Society
description: https://www.consumer.berkeley.edu
summary: The Consumer Advocacy and Protection Society (CAPS) is a student-run Berkeley Law organization dedicated to the promotion of consumer law and economic justice at Berkeley Law.

name: Consumer Protection Public Policy Order (Formerly Consumer Rights Workshop)
description: This group Consumer Protection Public Policy Order was formerly named Formerly Consumer Rights Workshop- 9/3/20 IZ (PLC)
summary: At Consumer Protection Public Policy Order , law students will hone their legal research and writing skills by drafting reports, white papers, administrative comments, and other projects that tackle widespread inequality.

name: Content Creation at Berkeley
description:
CC@B has three core goals guiding our organization:
1. To foster a community for anyone and everyone interested in content creation (creating
videos and/or live-streaming) to be a part of.
2. To get people interested in and excited about content creation
3. To encourage and support members of the club to make their own videos and/or livestreams.
summary: CC@B provides a space and resources for Berkeley students interested in creating videos and/or live-streaming.

name: Contra Costa Reentry Project
description:
The Contra Costa Reentry Project (CORE) assists the Contra Costa County Office of the Public Defender with its Clean Slate practice, which works to help remove the barriers that a prior arrest or conviction can present to employment, housing, public benefits, and family reunification.

Students will assist attorneys and advocates in the Contra Costa County Office of the Public Defender with expungement, early termination of probation, Proposition 47 reclassification, and factual innocence relief. Students will have the opportunity to:

  • Draft applications and petitions for post-conviction relief
  • Work directly with clients to gather required documentation and guide clients through the post-conviction relief process
  • Attend Contra Costa Clean Slate Intake events and assist with screening clients for relief eligibility, drafting personal statements, and registering voters
  • Research legal topics related to post-conviction relief, including the application of new laws to current practice and discrete client work
  • Observe post-conviction hearings and regularly visit the Contra Costa County Public Defender’s Office
summary: Working with the Contra Costa County Office of the Public Defender's Clean Slate practice to help remove the barriers that a prior conviction can present to employment, housing, public benefits, and family reunification

name: Coordinate
description:
Coordinate exists to bridge the gap between healthcare and populations with poor technological literacy, while aiming to simultaneously provide opportunities for undergraduates to engage in the provision of healthcare services.

The curriculum of the program has been designed to foster an understanding of the changing landscape of healthcare delivery, spurred by the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, and immerses them in the field of Telehealth through a hands-on clinical internship. Following a period of general and clinic-specific training, students will spend 3-4 extracurricular hours per week working with patients and providers to facilitate a smooth telehealth experience, thereby gaining a better understanding of the needs and experiences of both as it relates to telehealth and healthcare. They will gain critical clinical experience and the practical skills necessary to facilitate healthcare delivery, which will be advantageous as they pursue careers in medicine and healthcare.

Applications to the DeCal course are due by Thursday, August 31st: https://tinyurl.com/telehealthFA2023

See our Instagram for more information, and feel free to email telehealthcoordination5@gmail.com with questions!
summary: Coordinate exists to bridge the gap between healthcare and populations with poor technological literacy and aims to simultaneously provide opportunities for undergraduates to engage in the provision of healthcare services.

name: Core Consulting Group
description: CCG aims to grant equal professional development opportunities to students that want to break into the highly competitive field of consulting through teaching members the right tools needed to succeed.
summary: The Core Consulting Group aims to grant equal professional development opportunities to UC Berkeley students, including transfers, that want to pursue a career in consulting.

name: Cre8 Innovations at Berkeley
description:
Mission Statement:
Cre8innovations is a student organization dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive community within the realm of residential real estate. Our mission encompasses three key pillars: inclusivity, reducing the wealth gap, and addressing housing insecurity among students.
 
 
OUR FOCUS:
 
Inclusivity: At Cre8innovations, we believe that innovation thrives in an inclusive environment. We are committed to providing a welcoming space for all students, particularly emphasizing marginalized communities. We aim to empower every student to explore residential real estate and personal finance opportunities, regardless of their background or prior experience.
 
Reducing the Wealth Gap: We recognize the significant wealth disparities that exist in society. Through a series of workshops and educational initiatives, Cre8innovations seeks to equip students with the knowledge and skills to reduce this wealth gap. Our workshops will delve into various aspects of residential real estate, offering practical insights on investment, property management, and wealth-building strategies.
 
Addressing Housing Insecurity: We understand the challenges many students face regarding housing insecurity. Cre8innovations is dedicated to making a positive impact by exploring innovative solutions to provide housing options for students in need. By collaborating with local communities and organizations, we aim to create a support network that addresses housing insecurity issues on our campus.
 
Our Impact:
By joining Cre8innovations and participating in our workshops, students will be well-equipped to successfully navigate various aspects of life, from managing their personal finances to making informed decisions in the world of residential real estate. Our goal is to empower students to build a solid foundation for their future, regardless of their starting point.
 
Personal Finance Focus:
In addition to our work in residential real estate, Cre8innovations also places a strong emphasis on personal finance education. We believe that financial literacy is a cornerstone of success, and our club will offer resources, workshops, and expert insights to help students make informed financial decisions and achieve their financial goals.
 
Join us at Cre8innovations and be part of a vibrant and inclusive community that is dedicated to making a positive impact on the lives of students at UC Berkeley. Together, we'll create innovative solutions, reduce inequalities, and build a better future for all.
summary: Cre8 Innovations aims to economically empower formerly incarcerated students and former foster youth at UC Berkeley.

name: Creative Applications to Life in Origami
description:
Our members strive to learn how to fold simple to advanced origami (no experience required!), to be able to visualize the geometry of origami, and be able to fold diagrams and "read" crease patterns. We also aim to be able to apply the concepts of origami to other use than art (i.e. math, medicine, physics).

Interested in origami? Join us! Sign up to our mailing list to get the latest updates on club meetings, socials, and more: http://tinyurl.com/CALO-email-list
We also have a discord here: https://discord.gg/5g7uwg5JGU
summary: Our members strive to learn how to fold simple to advanced origami (no experience required!), to be able to visualize the geometry of origami, and be able to fold diagrams and "read" crease patterns.

name: Creative Residencies for Emerging Artists Teaching Empowerment
description:
CREATE is an organization supported by the Public Service Center that promotes arts-based services. Through CREATE, Berkeley students design and co-teach a class in dance, theater, visual arts, or creative writing in order to meet the enrichment needs of local schools and community centers. 

CREATE members are provided weekly trainings by our leadership team and are also mentored by professional teaching artists in their specific discipline. Trainings and mentor trainings cover topics such as social justice, curriculum design, positive behavior support, and personal artistry. 

CREATE also hosts guest artist workshops, social events, and community showcases in order to engage with members and the larger campus/Bay Area community.
summary: CREATE is an organization supported by the Public Service Center that gives artists, dancers, actors, writers, and others an opportunity to apply creative skills through public service.

name: Cricket Club of Berkeley
description:
We are a club that seeks to spread awareness of the sport of Cricket and competes in regional and national tournaments. We have been active since 2018, and have a current competitive team roster of around 35 players. We have weekly practices/games over weekends and also host a tennis ball premier league open to the Berkeley community every semester. 

Our competitive team participates as part of the NCCA (National College Cricket Association), which consists of 40+ colleges around the USA. Cal Cricket won the Pacific Regionals in 2021, and the Houston Nationals in 2023.
summary: The first professional and recreational cricket club at UC Berkeley!

name: Crossroads Christian Fellowship: Chinese for Christ Berkeley Church
description:
Crossroads Christian Fellowship is the college fellowship of Vinewood, the English ministry at Chinese for Christ (CFC) Church in Berkeley.

We are a student-led Christian fellowship on the Berkeley campus. We meet together on Friday nights at 7:30pm to worship, study the Word, and fellowship together. We also offer weekly small groups to nurture personal spiritual growth in a more intimate setting. We are a ministry of Vinewood at Chinese for Christ Berkeley.  Our church is located two blocks past Ashby on Prince Street and College Avenue. 

Crossroads exists as an arm of CFC Berkeley to engage college students at UC Berkeley with the Word of God: for the unsaved, to proclaim the gospel unto saving faith; and for the saved, to preach and teach the Word unto maturity of faith.
summary: Crossroads Christian Fellowship is the college fellowship of Vinewood at Chinese for Christ (CFC) Church in Berkeley. Our vision is to seek and raise up believers and to nurture a maturity amongst them that will transcend their college years.

name: Cru
description: The purpose of the Chapter is to build movements of people who are transformed by Jesus Christ. The student-led movement seeks to introduce students to Christ, help them to grow in faith, encourage them to passionately live life in a manner consistent with belief in the God of the Bible, and inspire commitment to advancing the purposes of God in the world.
summary: A multi-cultural community who follows Jesus Christ and takes His gospel to the world.

name: CS KickStart
description:
CS KickStart is a one week introductory class in computer science designed for incoming freshman women at UC Berkeley.  Participants learn how to program, learn about the different areas of computer  science, and meet other computer science students and professionals. The program targets those who are interested in math, science, and/or engineering but have little experience in computer science. We aim to give them a hands-on experience that will reveal the creativity and power of computer science.

visit: the CSKickStart website to learn more
summary: CS KickStart is a one week introductory class in computer science designed for incoming freshman women at UC Berkeley. Participants learn how to program, learn about the different areas of computer science, and meet other computer science students.

name: Cub Support
description:
Enjoy tutoring and working with kids? Want to give back to those in need?

 

Cub Support was formed in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic to aid in the transition to virtual learning grade-school students. The shift from the traditional classroom to remote learning can exacerbate educational disparities—especially for students who are from low-income families and underserved communities. Cub Support strives to help close the gap by providing free, virtual academic support to K-12 students. With the closure of schools and the shift to remote learning, we wanted to provide as much support as possible.

 

While schools have and continue to reopen, Cub Support's passionate cohort of tutors continues to provide free educational services to those in need. Members hold remote tutoring sessions with K-12 students anywhere in the nation. Tutors match themselves to their students to ensure they can best support them for their desired academic subject and grade level.

 

Be one of the amazing Volunteers who make this program possible!

 

We are always seeking out new, motivated people to help with tutoring. If you are interested or would like to get involved, feel free to email us (ucbears4cubs@gmail.com) for more information on the application process. Become a part of a passionate team while helping younger students thrive in their education through tutoring and mentorship!

 

Come to our Info Sessions to learn more about Cub Support! 

Apply to be a Tutor here: https://www.cubsupport.org/volunteer

 

Website: www.cubsupport.org

Email: ucbears4cubs@gmail.com

 

https://youtu.be/ks04JFglrsM
summary: Cub Support strives to provide academic support for students from the comfort of their own homes. We want to help close educational disparities by providing free, virtual academic support to K-12 students in under-served communities.

name: DAES’ Black Film Collective
description: We strive to provide a space for Black students to create films, watch films made by Black creators, and to learn about the process of filmmaking. We also aim to give Black students the chance to build their portfolios for future careers in entertainment
summary: We strive to provide a space for Black students to create films, watch films made by Black creators, and to learn about the process of filmmaking. We also aim to give Black students the chance to build their portfolios for future careers in entertainment.

name: Daily Californian
description:
The Daily Californian is an independent, student-run newspaper published by the Independent Berkeley Students Publishing Company, Inc. The Daily Californian covers both the UC Berkeley campus and the city of Berkeley.

The newspaper publishes every Thursday during the academic year and the summer. Established in 1871, The Daily Californian is one of the oldest newspapers on the West Coast and one of the oldest college newspapers in the country.

The Daily Cal is run entirely by current or recently-graduated UC Berkeley students, and the majority of the business division of the newspaper is student-operated as well.

One of the few campus newspapers in the country that is completely independent from the university it covers, the Daily Cal supports itself through advertising revenue and does receive funding from the INK Initiative, which requires all UC Berkeley students to pay $2.50 per semester.

The Daily Cal earned its independence in 1971 and publishes with the name “The Daily Californian” pursuant to a licensing agreement with the UC Board of Regents.

The move toward independence was initiated after the university administration attempted to fire three editors because of a controversial editorial regarding People’s Park, a university-owned lot in the Southside neighborhood of Berkeley that became an unplanned park for locals.
summary: The Daily Californian serves the campus and local community by producing and distributing a daily newspaper and promoting ideals of excellence in journalism by providing a training ground for students. Apply at apply.dailycal.org.

name: Dance Board of Berkeley Dance Community
description:
Dance Board for Berkeley Dance Community, generally referred to as “Dance Board” or “BDC Board,” serves to conduct monthly meetings with all dance group coordinators to insure that BDC runs as smoothly and efficiently as possible, as well as making sure BDC not only creates an environment worth dancing in, but also exists in one of the same caliber.

As a collective group of leaders in BDC, we hope to:

  • Form partnerships outside the Berkeley Dance Community including (but not limited to) groups such as Cal Taiko, Cal Athletics, and Cal Performances.
  • Take part in outreach organized through BDC's "Dance the Bay" charity group
  • Establish positive interactions between internal groups by eliminating cliques, purported stereotypes and hierarchies.
  • Organize and execute a fair system for scheduling the use of practice venues for every performance group (not just limited to dance groups), especially in regards to Eshleman Hall and the new Lower Sproul area.
  • Create a huge support system within the community, especially one that is culturally sensitive to other communities on campus.
  • Address issues including (but not limited to) cultural appropriation, diversity, inclusivity, sexism, masculinity v. femininity, and allyship.
  • Revitalize the loyalty and love for a passion that the BDC provides its dancers.
summary: Dance Board ensures that the Berkeley Dance Community (BDC) runs as smoothly and efficiently as possible, as well as makes sure BDC not only creates an environment worth dancing in, but also exists in one of the same caliber.

name: Dance Creation
description: Dance Creation hopes to foster a community of strong dancers that will share their choreography creations with each other. Any level of dancer is welcome, and each person will be put into a level group that will be the most beneficial for the dancer to grow in their dancing, improvisation, and choreography making. The primary style of dance will be contemporary, but any style is welcome. Dance Creation club members will be able to choose the style of dance they want to work, create, and learn with, and eventually teach it to their level group. In addition, a super unique style of dance will be introduced to the members: pole dance. If members are interested in learning about pole dance, there will be info sessions on what pole dance is, how to start, and opportunities to go to pole dance classes.
summary: We hope to introduce students to the process of creating dance choreography and teaching it to fellow club members, as well as giving the opportunity for students to learn more about the different styles of dance; particularly pole dance.

name: Dance Games at Berkeley
description: Dance Games at Berkeley exists to foster a community around and through arcade style dance games like Dance Dance Revolution, Pump It Up, and In the Groove. The club also owns and operates the Dance Dance Revolution machine in Eshleman 312
summary: A club for the community around and through arcade style dance games like Dance Dance Revolution, Pump It Up, and In the Groove at UC Berkeley.

name: Dance Marathon
description:
An entirely non-profit, student-run enterprise, the Children’s Miracle Network’s Dance Marathon has raised upwards of $350,000,000 for children’s hospitals nationwide since its founding in 1991. Consisting of hours of dancing, live entertainment, educational activities and speakers, themed activities, food, and exciting contests and prizes, Dance Marathon is unlike any other event on campus. In our first year holding Dance Marathon starting in the 2022-23 academic year, we raised $33,125 and won Best New Dance Marathon in the Country at the Children’s Miracle Network Dance Marathon Leadership Conference. Coupling a lively social event with a highly relevant and worthy cause, Dance Marathon continues to attract a growing number of students. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g8xMbvAu5W0
summary: Dance Marathon is a yearlong fundraising campaign that unites the Berkeley community by hosting events and raising awareness and funds for the UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital as part of the Children’s Miracle Network.

name: Dance the Bay
description: Dance the Bay seeks to uplift individuals and community through the medium of dance. Dance the Bay (DtB), formerly known as Everybody Dance Now! Berkeley, strives to make dance accessible for all audiences by providing dance classes for preschool and after school programs, in addition to hospitals and senior homes. We teach all genres of movement, emphasizing dance as an outlet for creativity and self-expression, and a means of learning discipline, cooperation, and confidence. For older audiences, it provides a means for promoting physical wellbeing and socialization through movement. We also host community workshops on campus to share dance with everyone.
summary: Dance the Bay (DtB) strives to spread dance to the community by making dance accessible for youth by providing dance at preschool and after school programs, teaching at senior homes, and hosting community dance workshops on campus.

name: Danceworx
description:
Danceworx was founded in 1988 and is the oldest student-run dance group on the UC Berkeley campus. For over 30 years, we have been providing students with a creative outlet to choreograph, dance, and perform in a fun and supportive environment.

Dancers are selected at the beginning of each semester and practice routines in various styles: Jazz/Contemporary, Urban and Tap. Throughout the semester, we host social events such as Pizza Nights, Mentorship Activities and our End of the Semester Banquet so our dancers can get to know each other better.

Each semester culminates in three performances: two outdoor showcases on the UC Berkeley campus and an evening showcase in a local theater venue. Our showcases attract over 400 attendees each semester and also feature guest performances from campus and local community groups to foster unity and promote diversity among UC Berkeley’s performing arts community.

Danceworx also performs at campus and local events. If you would like Danceworx to perform at one of your events, please contact our Outreach Chair (dwxoutreach@gmail.com).

Like us on Facebook! facebook.com/danceworx

Follow us on Instagram! https://www.instagram.com/dwxberkeley/

For more information, please visit: dwx.berkeley.edu
summary: The purpose of Danceworx is to provide an outlet for dancers to perform, as well as an opportunity for dancers to learn and improve technique in a fun and supportive environment!

name: Data Science Society at Berkeley
description: Welcome to Data Science Society at Berkeley! Founded in early 2016, we are UC Berkeley’s first undergraduate student organization focused on Data Science. Established on the pillars of education, professional development, community, social good, and consulting, Data Science Society has a long-standing record of helping students build their Data Science skills through learning opportunities and cultivating an academic environment by connecting students with industry leaders and researchers.
summary: DSS @ Berkeley is a group of undergraduate students at UC Berkeley focused on helping promote Data Science on campus. Our mission is to foster a data science community through educational workshops, professional events, and analytics projects.

name: DataGood at Berkeley
description:
DataGood at Berkeley is UC Berkeley’s first student-run organization dedicated to tackling socio-economic issues with data science. It was established with the understanding that there is a need to make data science accessible for organizations in the social good sector — the ones that need it the most. We are a passionate group of undergraduate students conscious about wielding our skills for progress and inciting action.

 

We are focused on creating an outlet for students to learn and utilize their data science and software development skills in meaningful impact driven sectors. Our members are able to learn data science techniques and principles through Education branch and apply these skills through our Projects branch.
summary: DataGood at Berkeley is Berkeley's first organization dedicated to tackling socioeconomic issues with data science. We are focused on creating an outlet for students to learn and utilize their data science skills in meaningful impact driven sectors.

name: DataStory
description: Welcome to DataStory, a premier student-run organization dedicated to providing top-notch consulting services in the fields of data science and software development. Our club is committed to helping businesses and organizations harness the power of data to make informed decisions and drive meaningful results. We also provide our members with multiple sources of professional development and opportunities, through workshops, case competitions, and speaker panels. Our Spring 2024 Application Information will be released in early January.
summary: As data science emerges as one of the most in-demand professions today, DataStory provides an environment for students to get a taste of what a future in the industry would look like.

name: Datong Society of China Studies at Berkeley
description: Datong Society of China Studies at Berkeley is a student group that aims to facilitate events and discussions on historical and social issues of China and connect students with these interests. We organize seminars, film screenings, and reading sessions to discuss and analyze popular and controversial topics in China studies. We strive to utilize the knowledge and resources on campus and beyond to help the Cal community have a better understanding of the culture, politics, and history of China.
summary: Datong Society of China Studies at Berkeley is a student group that aims to facilitate events and discussions on historical and social issues of China and connect students with these interests.

name: Debate Society of Berkeley
description: The largest academic debate organization at the University of California, Berkeley. We compete internationally in the British Parliamentary format, an event featuring four teams of two persons that engage each other through a series of seven-minute speeches interspersed with questions. On the national level, our team competes within the American Parliamentary Debate Association—the oldest intercollegiate debating association in the United States. Our teams consistently compete in the national and world championships, traveling to the Netherlands, Mexico, and South Africa. At home, we coach and judge for local high schools, support Bay Area tournaments, and organize two competitions of our own.
summary: The premier parliamentary debate organization at the University of California, Berkeley. We compete in the American Parliamentary (APDA) and British Parliamentary (BP) formats.

name: DeCadence
description: DeCadence ("deh-KAY-dence") is a student-run, all-inclusive a cappella group at the University of California, Berkeley. We perform in several public concerts each semester and are available for private events. Wanna check us out? You can find us singing under Sather Gate every Wednesday at noon!
summary: DeCadence ("deh-KAY-dence") is a student-run, co-ed a cappella group at UC Berkeley that loves to add some music and fun to your day. We sing indie, pop, jazz, and any other genre that comes our way. Find us singing under Sather Gate Wednesdays at noon!

name: DECrim at Berkeley
description: The purpose of DECrim is to research, identify, and advocate against procedural and substantive barriers in the criminal legal system that contribute to the increased criminalization of drug use across the United States.
summary: The purpose of DECrim is to research, identify, and advocate against procedural and substantive barriers in the criminal legal system that contribute to the increased criminalization of drug use across the United States.

name: Deewani
summary: The primary mission of Deewani is female empowerment through competitive dance and to perform high energy dances combining many different styles of Indian dance with an emphasis on Bollywood dance in a fusion style.

name: Defenders at Berkeley (Formerly Criminal Defense Society)
description:
Founded in February 2018, this is Berkeley Law's hub for students interested in public defense. We help foster Berkeley's public defender community through community-wide events, networking opportunities, and peer-to-peer support.

 

This group Defenders at Berkeley was formerly named Criminal Defense Society- 9/3/20 IZ (PLC)
summary: Founded in February 2018, this is Berkeley Law's hub for students interested in public defense. We help foster Berkeley's public defender community through community-wide events, networking opportunities, and peer-to-peer support.

name: Delta Consulting
description: Delta Consulting was created based on an understanding that an organization that is able to bridge students’ technical coursework and skills with an educational passion does not yet exist. Under this shared passion, our organization brings students from diverse backgrounds, from history and urban studies to EECS majors, together in a space where they can bridge classroom technical knowledge with real-life applications in the education sector. We recognize that there is already an abundance of consulting organizations present on our campus, however, our organization is the only consulting organization focused solely on the education sector. We consult for a wide array of educational organizations, from Educational Technology platforms to non-profit organizations and school districts. Through this niche focus on education and our commitment to inclusion, we believe that our organization can create unique contributions to the Berkeley Student Organization space.
summary: Delta Consulting's mission is to help organizations build the future of equitable, accessible, and empowering educational platforms by crafting innovative solutions for long-term impact.

name: Delta Delta Delta
description:
Our founders envisioned a women’s fraternity that would inspire the ideals of truth, self-sacrifice and friendship. Tri Delta’s Purpose keeps those values alive with our members today.

LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT

Whether serving as officers or participating in a chapter’s educational programming, our members are offered the support and opportunity to grow as leaders. There are four areas of growth that Tri Delta’s leadership education focuses on: organizational growth, intrapersonal growth, interpersonal growth and professional growth. Throughout the collegiate experience, Tri Delta’s members will attain core competencies and skill development in each of these areas.

SCHOLARSHIP

Tri Delta understands that its members are college women first, and part of Tri Delta’s Purpose is to broaden the moral and intellectual lives of members. Whether by providing scholarship funds through the Foundation to assist with educational costs, or by promoting academic success through a chapter’s Academic Excellence Initiative, Tri Delta offers encouragement and support to collegiate members as they pursue academic achievement.

PHILANTHROPY

Members of Tri Delta have a long history of supporting children’s cancer charities at the local level with local children’s hospitals and at the national level with our philanthropic partner, St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. The Fraternity and its chapters also consistently provide opportunities to raise funds to support the Tri Delta Foundation. This emphasis on philanthropy and service allows our members to develop qualities of unselfish leadership and assume the highest responsibilities of college women.

MEMBER DEVELOPMENT

As part of the collegiate chapter experience, Tri Delta members will participate in multi-dimensional – “3D” – educational and leadership programs designed to inspire them to Live, Learn and Lead in accordance with Tri Delta’s Purpose. Over the course of the collegiate experience, Tri Deltas enjoy a host of opportunities for personal growth and development while building lifelong friendships.
summary: Tri Delta is a perpetual bond of friendship that promises lifelong sisterhood and a network of support. Through our innovative educational and leadership programs, Tri Delta provides its members with personal, professional and leadership development.

name: Delta Epsilon Mu Inc. (Alpha Psi Chapter)
description:
Delta Epsilon Mu is the nation's premier Professional Pre-Health Co-Ed Fraternity! Our organization works with pre-health students across medicine, dentistry, nursing, psychology, and veterinary studies. As a unique asset to prestigious universities across the United States, we strive to employ our principles of dedication, loyalty, friendship and support in all of our efforts.

From educational programs to fundraising, to community service, members of Delta Epsilon Mu participate in a diverse set of activities. Our network is comprised of individuals of all backgrounds to produce a strong community of well-rounded students and professionals. This national organization provides students and the community with a non-judgmental, inclusive resource for uniting professionals across the health fields and "Helping People Together."
summary: Delta Epsilon Mu is a Pre-Health Co-Ed Fraternity. We focus on diversity and work with students who are interested in various pre-health professional tracks. We strive to uphold our four pillars of loyalty, dedication, friendship, and support.

name: Delta Gamma
description:
Delta Gamma offers women of all ages a rich heritage baded upon the ideals of personal integrity, philanthropy, intellectual honesty and above all, Doing Good. Our primary purpose is to foster ideals of friendship, promote educational and cultural interests, create a true sense of social responsibility, and develop the finest qualities of character.

Through our membership, we have all made close and lasting friendships, gained a widespread support system, and found a second home. DG offers a study buddy, a friend with whom to go on any adventure, and a confidant. As DGs, we applaud each other's successes, and help each other through individual struggles. Our chapter is made up of women of diverse individual talents, goals, and achievements brought together by a commitment to unwavering and unconditional friendship

The Delta Gamma Foundation fosters lifetime enrichment for members, promotes Service for Sight, and partners with the Fraternity to ensure the future of our sisterhood.

Service for Sight has been at the heart of Delta Gamma’s philanthropic mission since 1936. The Delta Gamma Foundation has given over $2,800,000 in Service for Sight grants to organizations and schools that share the Foundation’s mission: to promote sight preservation and assistance to children and adults who are blind or visually impaired.

Service for Sight supports the four schools founded by Delta Gammas for the visually impaired and other North American organizations that promote sight preservation and provide assistance to children and adults who are blind or visually impaired. This philanthropy has been at the heart of the Delta Gamma mission since 1936 when a member who was blind, Ruth Billow, Eta-Akron, petitioned members to adopt "Aid to the Blind" as our official philanthropy.
summary: Delta Gamma

name: Delta Kappa Alpha
description:
Established March 16, 1936, Delta Kappa Alpha is a National, Gender-Inclusive, Professional Cinema Fraternity for cinematic arts students of character. As a National organization with over 75 years of history and alumni, our members are connected to the top cinema students from top cinema schools at universities such as Cornell, USC, NYU, UCLA, Chapman University, UT Austin, Columbia University, and many others.

 

DKA is grounded in timeless personal and professional values and principles, and as an organization, our vision is to be recognized as the premier institute of upstanding entertainment industry leaders.

 

Not exclusive to film studies majors, DKA welcomes all gender identities, undergraduates and graduates, who are dedicated to fostering lifelong character, collaborative and creative storytelling, ethical and productive business practices, philanthropic action, and fraternal bonds by and between students of the cinematic arts.
summary: The mission of Delta Kappa Alpha is to foster lifelong character, collaborative and creative storytelling, ethical and productive business practices, philanthropic action, and fraternal bonds by and between students of the cinematic arts.

name: Delta Phi Epsilon Co-ed Professional Foreign Service Fraternity
description:
Delta Phi Epsilon is UC Berkeley’s Premier Professional Foreign Service and International Relations fraternity. Our membership is gender-inclusive and comprises of individuals with a diverse array of personal backgrounds, lived experiences, academic interests, and career trajectories. What unites us is our shared passion towards international affairs, our commitment to serve the international community, and our efforts to pursue international careers. 

Our Motto: Latreuo (I serve). 

Our Mission:

  1. To build an extensive network of members across all disciplines and backgrounds
  2. To explore and prepare for all types of careers concerning international affairs and engagement with complex global issues
  3. To become educated and informed students of international relations by studying, sharing, and debating current events
  4. To engage in the international community through charity and service


What We Do:

  • Host a bimonthly professional speaker series
  • Offer intimate networking opportunities
  • Provide academic and career advising to our members
  • Conduct professional development workshops
  • Facilitate debates among students
  • Organize campus-wide events
  • Reach out to the local community by arranging philanthropic events
  • Engage with our extensive network of alumni and active members at other top tier universities around the country

 

Learn more at dpe.berkeley.edu
summary: Cal's Only Foreign Service and International Affairs Co-ed Fraternity

name: Delta Sigma
description:
While our name is novel, this sorority maintains the strong sisterhood of Sigma chapter that has been at the University for over one hundred years. In its founding, the members of Delta Sigma have shown devotion to our values and each other, and have created an organization that embraces change. The compassion and drive of Delta Sigmas extends far beyond our home at 2311 Prospect Street. Delta Sigmas are leaders on campus and in the UC Berkeley Greek community.

From Cal’s cheerleading team, to Berkeley’s Society of Women Engineers, to the Berkeley Business Society, to Cal’s Campus Ambassador program, you can find our members in leadership positions in over 100 campus organizations. As a chapter, we’ve achieved one of the highest G.P.A. ranks, exceeding the all-campus average, all-women average, and the all-PHC-Greek average. In addition to supporting our sisters in their diverse extracurricular involvements, we love going out together for football games and pep rallies, hosting philanthropy fundraisers, and attending formal social events in San Francisco! You can spot us having Friday morning brunch on our deck enjoying the beautiful place we call home!

Check out our website, Facebook page, Instagram, and Tumblr in the links provided on this Callink page.
summary: Welcome to Delta Sigma at the University of California Berkeley! Delta Sigma Sorority is a local sorority at UC Berkeley that stands for women’s empowerment, for diversity, for inclusivity, and for courage.

name: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc.
description:
Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Incorporated founded on January 13th, 1913 on the campus of Howard University, is a public service organization based on the principles of sisterhood, scholarship, and service; committed to the constructive development of its members and to service of the Black community.

Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Inc., Kappa Chapter was chartered on the campus of the University of California, Berkeley on February 21, 1921. It is the first historically Black Greek Letter Organization at the University of California, Berkeley, and the first historically Black sorority chartered west of the Rocky Mountains. For more than 100 years, this public service organization has served this campus, the Bay Area, and the state of California.
summary: Delta Sigma Theta Sorority Incorporated is a public service organization based on the principles of sisterhood, scholarship, and service.

name: Delta Upsilon
description:
Delta Upsilon Fraternity was founded in 1834 upon the basis of non-secrecy, meaning we hold nothing secret: all of our rituals, initiations, and principles are open to the public.  

We now stand as the oldest and largest non-secret fraternity, and have grown into an organization that focuses on providing our men with a unique college experience, one grounded in our four founding principles of the Promotion of Friendship, Development of Character, Diffusion of Liberal Culture, and the Advancement of Justice.  We accomplish this through a variety of educational programming opportunities, including our Leadership Institute, held annually in a different city across the country; the Winter Educational Conference held every January in Indianapolis; the Global Service Initiative, which sends a group of our undergraduate men to Jamaica where they spend a week doing service work; and staff- and volunteer-run Regional Leadership Seminars.
summary: Delta Upsilon is the premier men's fraternity committed to Building Better Men for a global society through service, leadership development and lifelong personal growth of our diverse membership. Berkeley Chapter founded in 1896. Rush DU!

name: Delta Xi Phi Multicultural Sorority
description: Delta Xi Phi Multicultural Sorority, Incorporated is a national multicultural sorority based upon five pillars – increasing multicultural awareness, the advancement of women through higher education, community service, friendship, and sisterhood. Our sisterhood was founded in 1994 at the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign, was a chartering member of the National Multicultural Greek Council, and has become one of the largest and fastest growing multicultural Greek letter organizations in the country with 23 chapters nationwide.
summary: Delta Xi Phi Multicultural Sorority, Incorporated is a national multicultural sorority based upon five pillars – increasing multicultural awareness, the advancement of women through higher education, community service, friendship, and sisterhood.

name: Dermatological at Berkeley
summary: Dermatological aims to provide comprehensive and accessible education about skincare and skin diseases to all, regardless of race, religion, ethnicity, gender expression, or other diverse backgrounds one may possess.

name: Design at Berkeley
description: We believe anyone can be a designer, and thus those who want to understand, practice, and be exposed to design will be welcomed by a group of students who will support, teach, and guide them. Our mission is to help any student interested in any form of design explore the Berkeley design community and grow. Check out our website for more resources at designatberkeley.com and follow our Instagram (@designatberk) for information on our upcoming events!
summary: Our mission is to make design more accessible. Design at Berkeley has fostered a growing and welcoming community of anyone interested in design through workshops, events, and resources.

name: DeTrash@Berkeley
summary: The purpose of our organization is to clean up the campus and its surrounding environment by organizing regular trash cleanup events, to help achieve Berkeley’s zero-waste goals, and unite like-minded students.

name: Diaspora Magazine
description: DIASPORA is an Afrocentric arts, style & culture magazine made for and by Black UC Berkeley students. We aspire to curate a safe and expressive space for Black creatives to share their artwork, interests, and genius with each other and the greater campus community in digital and print formats.
summary: Diaspora Magazine serves to provide a safe space for Black students to express creativity through journalism and art. We aim to amplify Black voices and share those perspectives with the broader campus community.

name: Digital Illustration and Concept Art at Berkeley
description: DICA @Cal is club for UC Berkeley students who are interested in Digital Art and Illustration. Whether you are an experienced digital artist or have yet to start your digital art journey, our purpose is to build a community of passionate creators and digital art enthusiasts that will allow artists of all levels to explore their interests in digital illustration and concept art.
summary: Our purpose is to build a community of passionate creators and digital art enthusiasts that will allow artists of all levels to explore their interests specifically in digital illustration and concept art.

name: Digital Rights Project
summary: The Digital Rights Project gives Berkeley Law students an avenue to explore and understand the intersection between social justice, law, and technology while conducting pro bono work for non-profit organizations in the digital rights space.

name: Dil Se
description: Dil Se is UC Berkeley's premier south-Asian acapella group. Our unique music combines the melody-based raagas of Hindi film music with the depth and harmony that drive western music to create a fresh perspective on the tradition of a cappella. The group consists of a diverse group of accomplished singers, from years of Hindustani and Carnatic music, to Western Classical and Jazz Choirs. Dil Se has toured across California, and established themselves as one of the best Indian-fusion a cappella groups in the state. Each song entertains audiences with a well-rounded performance that emanates Dil Se -- "from the heart."
summary: UC Berkeley's Premier South Asian Acapella Team

name: Disability Rights Project
description: For the 2023-2024 school year, the Disability Rights Project (DRP) is partnered with Disability Rights California (DRC), a nonprofit organization founded in 1978 that is dedicated to defending, advancing, and strengthening the rights and opportunities of people with disabilities. Students participating in the Disability Rights Project will work with DRC’s Youth Practice Group and other law students from UC Irvine to provide advocacy support for youth with disabilities and families across the state.  Students will be able to utilize and develop legal research and writing skills by conducting educational record reviews, drafting demand letters, writing policy memorandums, and drafting and filing California Department of Education Compliance Complaints. Additionally, students have the opportunity to prepare for and attend Individual Education Program (IEP) meetings. Training will be provided and students will be well prepared to assist families. We will be working remotely for the Fall Semester with potential opportunities for working in-person in some form in the Spring. Prior experience with disability rights-related work is not required!
summary: The Disability Rights Project (DRP) at Berkeley Law aims to provide advocacy for people with disabilities.

name: Disney Club at Berkeley
description: The Official UC Berkeley organization for all things Disney! We hold special events and host speakers to learn more about Disney. Meet other students and experience the joy and magic of Disney by joining the happiest club on campus!
summary: Welcome to the official club for all things Disney! We hold special events and host speakers to learn more about Disney. Meet other students and experience the joy and magic of Disney by joining the happiest club on campus! Like us on Facebook.

name: DiversaTech
description: DiversaTech is a student-run consultancy that works with companies such as Airbnb, Adidas, PayPal, and Snackpass on impactful projects. From developing content strategy for edtech startups to ideating new features for popular social media apps, our members continuously explore new skill sets and industry challenges. At DiversaTech, we see tech differently - we believe that the most innovative solutions arise from diversity of thought, and strongly encourage people of all majors and backgrounds to apply. No prior technical or consulting experience is required!
summary:
DiversaTech is a student-led tech consulting organization at UC Berkeley. We form
interdisciplinary teams of dedicated undergraduates to deliver innovative, practical,
and actionable recommendations addressing our clients’ most pressing needs.

name: Diverse Business Society
description: We are the premier developer of underrepresented business leaders, providing mentorship and professional development to the Berkeley community. To expand on this, we are building a network of successful African American, Latine, Middle Eastern, Native American, LGBTQ+ professionals, along with other historically underrepresented minorities.
summary: Our mission is to mentor and develop underrepresented students and instill the skills to pursue careers in consulting, finance, technology, and more.

name: Diverse Iranian Students' Collective
description: DISC is dedicated to empowering the Iranian community at Berkeley Law. DISC works in solidarity with other organizations in pursuit of students’ academic and professional development as well as to provide a social forum and address challenges our broader community faces. DISC works to promote diversity in Berkeley Law, the legal profession, and beyond.
summary: DISC is dedicated to empowering the Iranian community at Berkeley Law.

name: Diversity and Inclusion in Real Estate
description: The primary mission of DAIRE is to provide a unique hands-on experience for undergraduate Underrepresented Minorities to learn about the field of real estate through both our education series and junior member education series which teaches students how to evaluate REITs.
summary: DAIRE's mission is to provide a unique hands-on experience for Underrepresented Minorities to learn about real estate through both our education series and junior member education series in which it teaches students how to evaluate REITs.

name: Down Syndrome Community Outreach at Berkeley
description: The purpose of our organization is to assist the Down Syndrome Clinic at UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital by volunteering in clinic, compiling resources, and creating a community for patients and their families through various projects. We also aim to educate the public and raise awareness about Down Syndrome.
summary: The purpose of our organization is to assist the Down Syndrome Clinic at UCSF Benioff Children's Hospital by volunteering in clinic, compiling resources, and creating a community for patients and their families through various projects.

name: Drawn to Scale
description: Drawn to Scale (casually known as DtS) is a co-ed a cappella group at UC Berkeley. Founded in 2008, the group is now celebrating its 15th anniversary as part of the musical community on campus. DtS boasts an ever expanding student-arranged repertoire spanning from contemporary pop to musical theater to R&B to indie rock. They have appeared at various showcases, local performances across the Bay Area, ICCA, and, of course, weekly performances every Friday at Noon under Sather Gate. Check them out at drawntoscale.berkeley.edu or facebook.com/dtsacappella for information regarding auditions, performances, and more!
summary: We are a co-ed a cappella group that focuses on a diverse range of musical pieces and arrangements, performing at service and community events in and around UC Berkeley. We love to sing!

name: DREAM Campus Ministry
description:
D.R.E.A.M Campus Ministry serves to reach out to the members/students of the Berkeley Community who seek to enrich and grow in their personal beliefs, understanding and knowledge of the Bible. 

We conduct weekly 30-minute Bible Talks to discuss various issues and topics that we encounter in our present-day society. 

We also offer free, personal Bible studies that cover the fundamentals of the Christian faith.

The college experience is rich with different life lessons, hardships and victories! It is a time of refinement where students truly come into themselves as the next generation of contributing members to society. We seek to cultivate the bonds and friendships that will help UC Berkeley's students during such a crucial and valuable time in their lives.
summary:
"My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends. You are my friends.."

John 15:12-14a

name: Dutch Student Association at Berkeley
description: The aim of the Dutch Student Association at Berkeley shall be to create an organization for the appreciation of Dutch heritage and culture through cultural functions and social events. Further, it will be to create a space where people with an interest in Dutch language can come together, without any outside political affiliations and/or influence.
summary: The aim of the Dutch Student Association at Berkeley shall be to create an organization for the appreciation of Dutch heritage and culture through cultural functions and social events.

name: Earthquake Engineering Research Institute at Berkeley
description:
The EERI Berkeley Student Chapter is promoting students' education regarding earthquake risk reduction through organized seminars with various invited lecturers from the fields of earthquake engineering, including professionals and researchers.

The chapter promotes minimizing the gap between the community’s understanding of the impacts of earthquakes and the profession's assumptions on the acceptable losses after a seismic event. This is done through community outreach programs for children and the general population.

The Chapter is also proud to include the undergraduate seismic design competition group that represents UC Berkeley in the annual EERI seismic design competition.
summary: The EERI Berkeley Student Chapter is promoting earthquake engineering research and devotes itself to improving the community’s understanding of the impacts of earthquakes on society.

name: East Asian Caucus
description:
East Asian Caucus is a space composed of selected student facilitators, liaisons of East Asian serving registered student organizations (RSOs), and members of the East Asian community at the University of California, Berkeley.

The mission of the East Asian Caucus at UC Berkeley is to create a unified coalition among the greater East Asian community in which we collectively make positive impacts, strengthen communications within and across the East Asian community,  improve community representation, and work to identify and meet community members’ needs. This Caucus aims to collaborate with East Asian-serving RSOs, campus departments, and individual community members to ensure fair representation of the diverse identities, experiences, and needs that dwell within the umbrella of “East Asian”. This Caucus will serve as a safe space for East Asian community members and, thus, will not tolerate any form of hate, aggression, xenophobia, or discrimination.
summary: East Asian Caucus at UC Berkeley aims to create a unified coalition among the greater East Asian community to make positive impacts, strengthen communications within the East Asian community, improve representation, and meet community members’ needs.

name: East Asian Culinary Club
description:
As a general member, you'll have access to participate in all our events ranging from educational workshops to cooking competitions and everything in between!
