name: GAG!
summary: GAG! is a creative publication exploring all mediums of expression. GAG! will foster a strong and welcoming community of creatives as they tackle individual and collective projects and be the platform in which they can see their work get published.

name: Game Design and Development at Berkeley
description:
Game Design and Development at Berkeley is a club to help those interested in game design understand common tools and work environments that other indie and major industry developers work in. We encourage students from all backgrounds to come and join, as game design has many facets that people can be involved in; development, art, music, writing, and project management.

Our three goals as an organization are:

  1. Creating a space to foster a community for those interested in game design and development
  2. Getting more people interested in game design and development
  3. Providing support for a pipeline that will enable everyone to work on their own games, including industry events, workshops, and game jams 

(This organization was formerly known as "GameCraft")
summary: Game Design and Development at Berkeley seeks to foster a community for everyone and anyone interested in game design and development. Furthermore, we aim to provide students with the path and all the resources they may need to create their own games.

name: Gaming at Berkeley
description:
Gaming @ Berkeley is an umbrella organization that fosters a community of gamers and provides opportunities to hang out, play games and meet irl. Whether you are new to gaming or a seasoned vet, our social, competitive, and casual events allow students who love video games meet with other passionate students to join a community of thousands of other gamers at Berkeley.

 

Alongside Cal Esports, the university program, our goal is to create a space where students can come together to meet other gamers, channel their passion into a career, and provide resources for students to locate or establish communities associated with their game(s) of choice.

 

(Gaming at Berkeley was formerly known as eSports at Berkeley and Collegiate Star League at Berkeley.)
summary: Gaming @ Berkeley is an organization designed to provide an outlet for students to chase their passion for video games, whether that be socially, academically, or professionally.

name: Gamma Phi Beta (Gamma Phi)
description:
Gamma Phi Beta is an International Sorority dedicated to helping women realize their full potential. Of course, you will make lifelong friends here – and in the future after college. But it’s here you will have the opportunity for individual growth through academic excellence, leadership development, social enrichment and philanthropic involvement that will take you wherever you want to go with your life. 

We believe that the result of contribution to community, developing moral and ethical integrity in all aspects of life, and striving for excellence in all levels of your endeavors are elements that one learns as a part of sorority life. Being part of a social organization is also an important "fun" aspect of college life. 

Becoming self-reliant, looking inward toward sisterhood for support and celebrating your individualism are benefits not found in many other organizations.

Every member is selected to life membership. This choice of membership does not relate simply to one college campus or community, for every member belongs to the International Sorority and enjoys a member’s rights, privileges and responsibilities wherever she may live, study, work or travel. As a member, you have the opportunity to be a part of a sisterhood that has blossomed from Four Founders to over 140,000 members with 114 collegiate chapters and 156 alumnae chapters.
summary: Welcome to Gamma Phi Beta at UC Berkeley! Here you'll find a lifetime of sisterhood, friendship, alumnae connections, and memories of the best years of your life with the best women you'll ever meet. Feel free to contact us with any questions. Go Bears!

name: Gamma Rho Lambda
description:
Welcome to the Lambda Chapter of Gamma Rho Lambda at UC Berkeley!

 

Gamma Rho Lambda (ΓΡΛ) is the first national, college-based, Queer and Ally social greek organization. We aim to provide a safe space and support system for queer and allied individuals. We center and prioritize people of color, folks of marginalized identities, undocumented folks, trans and GNC individuals, low-income, and queer!

 

Interested in joining Spring 2023? Please fill out this google form to receive updates about our recruitment week! 

You can also find us on ig @grlberkeley and learn more about us on our website https://grlberkeley.wordpress.com/
summary:
Gamma Rho Lambda is both a traditional sorority and a queer organization – providing queer individuals and their allies a safe space in the Greek community.

Check out our website for info on our upcoming recruitment! https://grlberkeley.wordpress.com

name: Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc.
description: Established in 1992 at the University of California, Berkeley (founded nationally in 1987 at Chico State University), Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc. is a Latino interest fraternity dedicated to three principles: Academic Excellence, Community Service, and the maintenance of the Latino culture through Brotherhood. All brothers of this fraternity strongly abide by these values in their everyday lives and demonstrate this strength through performing a number of community building activities. Community service is perhaps one of our largest emphases, as we strive to return a small portion of what our families and upbringings have provided to us in our quest for success. The strong bond that we possess among our chapters statewide makes the brotherhood experience unlike any other Greek organization on campus.
summary: Established in 1992 at the University of California-Berkeley, Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc. is a Latino interest fraternity dedicated to three principles: academic excellence, community service, and brotherhood. We were established nationally in 1987

name: Garak
summary: Our organization has its purpose to let students interested in music collaborate with others through jam sessions and have opportunities to perform in front of audiences, fostering a community of student musicians.

name: Garb
description:
Garb aims to consistently publish interesting, humorous Berkeley relevant articles relating to fashion through an online blog platform. This online publication will cater to those who have a passion for fashion as well as those who seek to get into fashion world. Our blog will serve as a platform for community building based on a mutual interest in style.

Articles will cover topics including but not limited to “how to wear” guides, garment history, "Berkeley" style, outfit and style inspiration, fashion news, the fashion industry, fashion trend analyses, beauty, and lifestyle. Through these articles, we aim to provide value to our readers by discussing and explicating fashion related subject matters.

Note: Garb was formerly known as Fashion Editorial of Berkeley. Name change effective 2018-19 Academic Year
summary: Garb is an online blog aimed at consistently publishing fashion related articles that are relatable and relevant to Berkeley students.

name: Garuda Capital
summary: Garuda Capital strives to provide an environment for members to learn and engage in investment research and a platform for members to trade assets. GC will also open-source its research to provide free high-quality investment education to students.

name: Gender Equity in Mathematics at Berkeley
description: This organization is a safe place where UC Berkeley students interested in the field of Mathematics foster relationships and pursue academic success among like-minded individuals with an emphasis on women and other underrepresented gender groups. Through professional and social events, we create and empower a strong community within the Math Department.
summary: This organization is a safe place where UC Berkeley students interested in the field of Mathematics foster relationships and pursue academic success among like-minded individuals with an emphasis on females and other underrepresented gender groups.

name: Generative AI at Berkeley
description: Generative AI at Berkeley is the first and largest Generative AI focused student organization on campus. We welcome all majors, technical skill levels, backgrounds, and fully embrace the multidisciplinary nature of Generative AI. Members collaborate on projects that combine technical and creative work: applying technologies like Stable Diffusion and LLMs to real problems, as well as attending workshops and talks given by professors and industry experts, and working with startups and companies.
summary: Generative AI at Berkeley explores the field of Generative AI and its transformative applications. Members collaborate on projects that combine technical and creative work: applying technologies like Stable Diffusion and LLMs to real problems.

name: GeneTech at Berkeley
summary: Our purpose is to bring together UC Berkeley undergraduate minds who want to explore the possibilities at the convergence of genetics and technology.

name: Genshin at Berkeley
description:
We currently have a Discord community of over 1000 people!
Join our Discord server for info on how to join, future events, other announcements, and Genshin discussion!(https://discord.gg/XwGc7eWDF6)

 

Please fill out this Google Form to request to be a club member: https://forms.gle/McrQbTUaEUTdfGnNA
summary: We're an official club of Genshin gamers at Berkeley. Our goal is to create a fun and supportive community where members can find belonging by playing and discussing Genshin.

name: GENup Collegiate at Berkeley
description: GENup Collegiate at Berkeley is a student-activist coalition that strives to advocate for educational issues through the power of youth voices and to provide a strong structural framework for progressive activism. Our goal is to bring all student-based stakeholders in the Californian community together into one large-body and utilize its centralized power to advocate for educational issues and causes. We seek to build an expansive network of student-leaders, innovators, activists, and organizations who work together to fight for a united and powerful front on issues relating to education. We strive to mobilize the youth in all manners of educational activism whether that be through social media advocacy, legislative lobbying, or grassroots level field-work of canvassing and phone banking. GENup Collegiate at Berkeley seeks to expand its network into the collegiate environment to advocate for legislative educational reform, which is where Berkeley students come in to take the lead.
summary: GENup Collegiate at Berkeley advocates for educational issues through the power of youth voices in key policy efforts on the California education system and unites diverse student activists in a “Generation Upward” movement.

name: GeoEngineering Graduate Student Association at Berkeley
description:
The main objective of the GeoEngineering Graduate Student Association at Berkeley is to provide GeoSystems graduate students, postdoctoral and visiting researchers with 1) an executive/steering committee to coordinate the activities of the abovementioned students, 2)  a forum to share technical details of ongoing research, 3) a platform for constructive peer review and support, and 4) to promote student collaboration, outreach, and social interaction. 

See more on our Website.
summary: The objective of the GeoEngineering Graduate Student Association at Berkeley is to provide academic, professional, and administrative support to GeoSystems graduate students, postdoctoral, and visiting researchers.

name: Geological Association at Berkeley
description:
Our mission is to inspire involvement in the geological and Earth sciences by providing a physical space for Berkeley undergraduates interested in science to form communities outside of a traditional academic environment.

We meet once a week to talk about current events, hear presentations from students about Earth science research or related interests, and play an intense game of geopardy.

Any and everyone is welcome to stop by for a night or join us weekly for the year! We welcome students of all majors and experience levels. We go on occasional day trips and a semesterly multi-day camping trip in addition to collaborating with the EPS department to host academic events. If you're looking for course advice or pizza or even a group of people to go hiking in Tilden with, we're your crew!

For more info or to get involved contact our current president Nico: nicolasv03@berkeley.edu

We meet every Thursday from 6:30-7:30 in McCone 325

Instagram: @gab_berkeley
summary: GAB is a geoscience-focused club where students discuss and appreciate the natural world, particularly as it relates to Earth science.

name: GeoWall at Berkeley
description: GeoWall at Berkeley is a Civil Engineering Competition team that competes in the Mid-Pacific Conference organized by the American Society of Civil Engineers (ASCE). Our goal is to build a materially stabilized earth wall and compete against other schools. Our team offers hands on activities that students would normally not be able to obtain in a traditional class setting and apply knowledge they do learn in class. The team also offers leadership positions which allow students to build leadership skills and communicattion skills as well, as there is an oral section to the competition.
summary: GeoWall is a competition team that is part of a larger organization called ASCE. The team allows students to learn about geotechnical engineering and apply classroom knowledge and compete against other schools in the annual Mid-Pacific conference.

name: Ghibli Graduate Guild
description:
Welcome to the magical world of the Ghibli Grad Club! Whether you're a die-hard Ghibli fan or just discovering the enchanting films, we invite you to be a part of our vibrant community at UC Berkeley!

How to Get Involved:

Follow Us on Social Media: Connect with us on Instagram, @ghibli.graduate.guild. It's the best way to stay updated on our events, share your Ghibli love, and connect with fellow fans.

 

Attend Our Events: Keep an eye on our event calendar for Ghibli-themed gatherings, movie nights, crafting events, and more. Everyone is welcome, so bring your friends and let's make some Ghibli magic together!

 

Volunteer and Join Committees: Want to play a more active role? Volunteer for our events or join one of our committees. Whether you love event planning, social media, or crafting, there's a place for you in our Ghibli family.

 

Spread the Word: Help us grow! Share your Ghibli Grad Club experiences with friends, classmates, and Ghibli enthusiasts. The more, the merrier!
summary: We are united by our deep appreciation for the enchanting world of Studio Ghibli. Our purpose is to celebrate the creativity, wonder, and artistry that define the films of this legendary animation studio.

name: Gia Magazine
description: Gia Magazine is a student-run publication that centers the voices of queer and trans students of color in order to celebrate the community’s creative power. Lovingly named after one of the most impactful queer/trans advocates in Berkeley history, Gia Magazine honors the legacy of Juniperangelica “Gia” Cordova. During her time at UC Berkeley, Gia served as an ASUC senator as well as an activist who created policy supporting the wellness of students, established commissions overseeing the impact of campus security on marginalized communities, and built coalitions of students as a community organizer. Since graduating from the university, Gia has continued to advocate for the lives and wellbeing of queer/trans folks and womxn of color on a regional and national level. In paying homage to Gia, this publication strives to institutionalize and forever uphold her vital legacy of courage, activism, and unapologetic authenticity.
summary: Gia Magazine is an arts publication that centers the voices of queer and trans students of color.

name: Giddha at Berkeley- Soohi Phulkariyan
summary: The purpose of this team is to foster a fun, welcoming environment for students around the Berkeley Region who are interested in getting closer to their culture and community through Giddha. This team is open to individuals at all experience levels.

name: Girl Up
summary: Girl Up is an innovative campaign of the United Nations Foundation to raise awareness and funds for the United Nations programs that help some of the world’s hardest-to- reach adolescent girls.

name: Girls Who Code @ Berkeley
description:
Girls Who Code is an international non-profit organization working to close the gender gap in technology and change the image of what a programmer looks like and does. 

While our mission is to inspire self-identifying female students, we welcome all who support Girls Who Code at Berkeley's mission. Through organized seminars, technical workshops, and networking events, Girls Who Code at Berkeley aims to provide a supportive community for all majors, genders, sexual orientations, and backgrounds to create meaningful connections with like-minded people.
summary: Our goal is to close the gender gap in tech. We are not only trying to inspire girls to build their confidence and technical skills at an early age, but also young women who may have never been exposed to technology before college.

name: Glamity at Berkeley
description:
Founded in Spring 2023 by Minh To and Alexis Kim, Glamity is an all femme, open-style dance team that explores many genres of femme dance- including voguing, waacking, twerk, heels, and more.

Glamity strives to provide a platform for underrepresented styles and dancers who originate from the LGBTQIA+ and POC communities, or enjoy hyper-feminine styles. We welcome dancers from all backgrounds and strive to create a fun, safe space for dancers to express their authentic selves, grow as dancers, and find community.
summary: Glamity is a femme open-style dance team that explores many genres of femme dance- including voguing, waacking, twerk, heels, and more. We strive to create a fun, safe space for underrepresented dancers to express themselves and find community.

name: Global Investors at Berkeley
description: Global Investors at Berkeley (GIB) is UC Berkeley's only student-run organization that focuses on global financial markets. We strive to educate our members about real-life investment strategies in various financial markets around the world. What differentiates us from other investment clubs on campus is that we provide our members with a platform to learn directly about the global equities, allowing them to acquire knowledge about major stock exchanges around the world. We are planning to cover six economies as of now and have an equal exposure of developed and emerging countries, namely, Brazil, India, United States, United Kingdom, Hong Kong, and Canada. Furthermore, members may have a choice to participate in investment strategies, focusing on these six countries.
summary: Global Investors at Berkeley focuses on global financial markets. We strive to educate our members about real-life investment strategies in various financial markets around the world.

name: Global Leadership Organization at Berkeley
description: Global Leadership Organization enhances the world by empowering passionate individuals with the skills they need to create change. We believe that with the right attitude and skills, people can drive tangible results and leave legacies that transcend our individual lives.
summary: GLO is the hub and go-to for all Berkeley leaders, regardless of their major, background, or ambitions. GLO Berkeley is the home that the most daring, steadfast, and most ambitious leaders come to learn, grow, & influence.

name: Global Medical Missions Alliance at Berkeley
description:
GMMA aims to...

Leave a positive and profound impact for Christ by guiding and equipping students with training and networking opportunities so they may serve as effective healers and ministers of Christ’s love. 

Foster a unique community and fellowship among peers and mentors committed to medical missions and healing ministry.

Become the next generation of trained and like-minded healthcare professionals.

Understand what it means to live a missional life and humbly serve in a way that exemplifies Christ, both locally and abroad.

 

Join us for our bi-weekly General Meetings!

Date: Every other Monday

Location: Dwinelle

Time: 7:00-8:30pm PST

 

Check out our Facebook page and website for more information about upcoming events and mission trips! :)
summary: Leave a positive and profound impact for Christ by guiding and equipping students with training and networking opportunities so they may serve as effective healers and ministers of Christ’s love.

name: Global Medical Training
description: Global Medical Training (GMT) is an organization that is focused entirely on our motto, "LEARN BY DOING." It gives students a unique chance to participate in more "hands-on" diagnoses and treatments of patients in Latin America under the supervision and training of medical professionals. Students will not only have time to learn more about health-related professions in the near future but also become more socially aware and culturally competent. UC Berkeley students will be given a chance to expand their understanding of medicine as well as health-related hardships of living in third-world countries while increasing awareness of the lack of healthcare in such countries by providing care and information for the betterment of the nation. GMT services are also not limited to our national partners but are provided to our community. We will offer our students the opportunity to volunteer in multiple service events focused on serving the underprivileged community of Berkeley and beyond.
summary: Global Medical Training is an international, non-profit, and humanitarian organization focused on addressing the healthcare needs of developing countries in Latin America through providing free medical and dental care services.

name: Global Research and Consulting Group at Berkeley
description:
Global Research and Consulting (GRC) Group is an internationally-oriented educational non-profit with an expansive network of students from universities all over the world. Our mission is to drive global social impact change and empower students to become responsible future leaders, and we have completed over 60 projects with past clients including UNESCO, World Bank, Wikipedia, Oxfam, WWF, and many more.

As a member of GRC, you become part of a powerful and growing network of current students and alumni who have gone on to work at McKinsey, BCG, and Bain in the consulting sphere, Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley in the financial services industry, Silverlake, Bain Capital, and Point72 on the buy-side, as well as at the United Nations and various social impact nonprofits.
summary: The purpose of Global Research and Consulting Group at Berkeley is to advance global social impact through consulting and doing research for global non-profit organizations.

name: Global Student Association at Berkeley Law
summary: The purpose of the organization is twofold: first, to make it easier for current and future international students to navigate various career paths; and second, to build a vibrant network of legal professionals, practitioners, and academics.

name: GlobalHope 365
description: Global Hope 365 is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of women and girls, locally, nationally, and worldwide through raising awareness, education, collaboration, and prevention. Our focus is on ending harmful practices toward women and girls such as Child Marriage, Human Trafficking, and other forms of gender-based violence.
summary: GlobalHope 365 is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the lives of women and girls worldwide, by advocating for their safety through raising awareness, education, and empowerment.

name: GlobeMed at Berkeley
description: GlobeMed at Berkeley is a student-led organization dedicated to addressing global health and social justice issues. We support movements created within and managed by local community members working to improve their community’s health conditions. We work with the Department of Community Programs within Dhulikhel Hospital in Nepal and have helped create projects promoting pesticide-use awareness among farmers in Baluwa, Nepal and water sanitation, hygiene, nutrition, and menstrual health for children at schools in Bolde, Nepal. Through partnership, discussion, activism, and education, we disband social hierarchies and systems of oppression with the goal of addressing health disparities in our local community and worldwide.
summary: GlobeMed at Berkeley is the central organization for global health at UC Berkeley. We focus on social justice in a global context by dismantling systems of oppression through activism, education, and a partnership with a low-income community abroad.

name: Go Club at Berkeley
summary: Go Club at Berkeley aims to bring Go, a Chinese intellectual sport, onto an international level. We crave to bring in students of diverse backgrounds and nationalities to learn understand more about the techniques and culture of Go.

name: Gold Key International Optometric Honor Society at Berkeley
description: To recognize upperclassmen who demonstrate outstanding professional and ethical attitude through leadership and service to their school and optometric profession. Our society organizes optometric events to inspire leadership within the profession.
summary: Recognize upperclassmen who demonstrate outstanding professional and ethical attitude through leadership and service to their school and optometric profession. Our society organizes optometric events to inspire leadership within the profession.

name: Golden Records
description:
Golden Records strives to connect passionate students with the music industry and foster a welcoming community of like-minded individuals with the goal of preparing them for music industry related jobs. Recently, we have transitioned into a music producer focused organization open to those with little or lots of experience to participate. This organization will aim to establish events for the student community where members will be able to showcase their inspirations and gain invaluable experience performing live as well as bringing in established professionals to talk about their experiences.

One of the biggest challenges of the music industry is finding the right people and this organization addresses this by giving members great networks.

By nature, it also serves those interested in the nuanced fields of the music industry including but not limited to personal and business managers, publicists, entertainment attorneys, graphic designers, booking agents, and promoters.

Also, Golden Records commits to helping the development of its active members.

 

JOIN OUR DISCORD FOR ALL ANNOUNCEMENTS: https://discord.gg/MVR8QNWrGF

ALL ARE WELCOME!

 

If you have any questions, please ask in the Discord!!!

#beatmaking #music production #producers #music industry #DAW
summary: Golden Records fosters a community of Music Industry driven students. For beat makers, EDM producers, artists, DJs, and students just looking to get their foot in the music industry.

name: Google Developer Student Club at Berkeley
summary: Our goal is for students who are interested in Google developer technologies to grow their knowledge in a peer-to-peer learning environment and build solutions for local businesses and their community.

name: Graduate Architecture Student Union
description: The Graduate Architecture Student Union is a resource for Graduate Architecture students in the College of Environmental Design. We seek to unite the student body and facilitate communication between students and the department in order for students’ opinions, values, and concerns to be heard.
summary: A resource for Graduate Architecture students in the College of Environmental Design.

name: Graduate Assembly Governance Workgroup (GA GWG)
summary: GA Governance Workgroup

name: Graduate Assembly of Students in Psychology
description: GASP represents a consolidated voice of the student body in the Psychology Department. Your GASP representatives are your liaisons among the faculty, they keep you in the loop about events and opportunities in our departments and others, and make sure we all stay connected across our different areas of study. We do this through social events, a mentorship program, advocating for higher wages, and maintaining communication through twitter, a graduate-student blog, and a departmental newsletter.
summary: GASP is an organization of and for Psychology PhD students, helping to connect students and assist in navigating the challenges of graduate school life.

name: Graduate Association of Latinx Students (GALS)(FORMERLY known as Graduate Students de la Raza)
description:
Graduate Association of Latinx Students (GALS) seeks to address the social, political, academic, cultural, and educational issues and concerns that affect the Latinx graduate and professional community at UC Berkeley. 

Graduate Association of Latinx Students (GALS) will:

• Serve as a cross-departmental bridge for the Latinx graduate and professional student body to build community and networks. 

• Engage in the academic and professional development of graduate and professional students.

• Coordinate support and mentorship to Latinx undergraduate students.

• Create a safe space for intercultural, cross cultural and diverse communities to collaborate and build relationships for transformative action.
summary: Graduate Association of Latinx Students (GALS) is a graduate student organization that seeks to increase the representation of the Latinx graduate community by serving as a bridge unifying LATINX grads.

name: Graduate Computational Mathematics Group
summary: Develop a community for graduate students from all disciplines interested in computational mathematics to meet and collaborate.

name: Graduate Economics Association
summary: A student association that organizes educational and social activities for graduate students in the Economics department.

name: Graduate Geographers of Berkeley
summary: Group for all graduate student geographers or those interested in the impact of geographic thought at Berkeley.

name: Graduate Global Development
summary: Graduate Global Development

name: Graduate Minority Outreach Recruitment and Retention
summary: To be entered

name: Graduate Minority Student Project
summary: To be entered

name: Graduate Outdoor Pals for Equity
summary: The Graduate Outdoor Pals for Equity (GOPE) is a community of graduate students that wants to make supportive, healing spaces accessible for graduate students from underrepresented backgrounds through outdoor recreation.

name: Graduate School of Education Research Day Organizational Committee
description: This student run group puts on a fun, engaging and thought-provoking annual conference that nourishes the Graduate School of Education community and allows us to link with other schools of education and educational researchers
summary: This student run group puts on a fun, engaging and thought-provoking annual conference that nourishes the Graduate School of Education community and allows us to link with other schools of education and educational researchers

name: Graduate Social Club
summary: The Graduate Social Club's mission is  to facilitate social interaction between members of the graduate population by organizing a variety of social events that bring together graduate students from diverse academic interest

name: Graduate Student Journal of the School of Education
description: Published online and edited by students from the Graduate School of Education at the University of California, Berkeley, the GSJSE encourages submissions on research and theory from senior and emerging scholars, practitioners, and policy-makers.
summary: The Graduate Student Journal of the School of Education is a peer-reviewed interdisciplinary journal that engages issues of educational diversity and equity within diverse cognitive, developmental, sociohistorical, linguistic, and cultural contexts.

name: Graduate Student Parent Advocacy
summary: GA GSPA

name: Graduate Student Wellness Project
summary: To be entered

name: Graduate Students in Agricultural Economics
description: GSARE is a student association that organizes educational and social activities for all graduate students in the department of Agricultural and Resource Economics. GSARE helps build a community for graduate students in the department and provides resources to help students get the most out of the department's offerings. GSARE also engages with other departments through interdisciplinary connections across campus.
summary: GSARE organizes educational and social activities for all graduate students in the department of Agricultural and Resource Economics.

name: Graduate Women of Engineering
description:
The Graduate Women of Engineering is a group of graduate engineering students from all engineering disciplines at the University of California, Berkeley. Our primary purpose is to support all graduate engineering women (in body, spirit or identity — past, present, future, and fluid) in all their engineering endeavors.

Throughout the year a number of informal events are held to allow women engineers (and those who support women in engineering) to welcome new students, network and grow professionally, share experiences, develop study groups, discuss issues and just socialize. We are always looking for new faces to join us and welcome any suggestions for new events. Our events are advertised throughout the year via email and on the events page. If you want to be notified of our future events please sign up for the GWE mailing list or contact gradswe@berkeley.edu.
summary: GWE is a group of graduate engineering students from all disciplines at the Cal. Our primary purpose is to support all women (in body, spirit or identity — past, present, future, and fluid) in all their engineering endeavors.

name: Graduate Women's Project
description: The Graduate Womxn’s Project (GWP) is devoted solely to addressing the personal, social, political, and academic needs of graduate womxn.
summary: To be entered

name: Gravity Group Investment Club at Berkeley
description:
When have you heard of stocks? In a family meeting where your parents talked about how Uncle Bob lost his entire life savings overnight in options? From your friend who said the market is rigged against you? While investing seem incredibly daunting, just like performing surgeries or building circuits, it's easy if you know what you are doing.



The stock market is very accessible to everyone and even to teenagers. This accessibility inevitably leads to a mountain of "investors" who quote Warren Buffet out of context to justify the massively idiotic trade they are executing with their Grandma's social security payout. Like any job that pays a salary, the stock market requires a painful learning process that could be shortened dramatically through the guidance of our senior members. Our senior members lost money in egregiously overvalued hype stocks so you don't have to; you can cut the "painful lesson" part and jump right into the "making money" part.



Statistically, the S&P 500 returns 9% over long periods of time. Many ETFs that track the S&P 500 pay a dividend of 2%. While this return is fantastic, the S&P 500 includes the top 500 largest publicly traded companies. This method could be more efficient because there are both big winners and losers in the 500 companies chosen, creating plenty of drag. Gravity Group's club members believe that through financial education and experience, we could pick the winners and beat the 9% return through a streamlined investment process.



As a community, we guide each other using our collective expertise. Even though losing money is inevitable, our members will eventually learn the process and build a secure financial future. Gravity Group focuses on the value investment philosophy of Warren Buffet, Peter Lynch, and Mohnish Pabrai while shunning the philosophy of Jim Cramer and Cathie Woods.



Gravity Group welcomes all skill levels and all types of investors and traders. Many clubs on campus have rigorous application processes, monetary and time commitments, or are simply inflexible to Berkeley's academic coursework. Gravity Group seeks to mediate all those issues by being a low-commitment and accessible club with an emphasis on making investing more than crunching numbers on an Excel sheet. Please check out our club website and Discord server!
summary: Investment clubs on campus are often demanding on time and resources. This club seeks to tackle the issue and create a community of investors/traders of all experience levels. We don't have an application process, you could join or leave anytime!

name: Greeks Against Sexual Assault at Berkeley (GASA)
description: Greeks Against Sexual Assault (GASA) is a peer-education based organization that works with members of the Berkeley community, especially with the CalGreeks Community and the LEAD Center. Our mission is to educate members of our community on SVSH, reform our current culture to be more inclusive and aware of issues facing SVSH, and to advocate for those who are survivors in our campus community. This education may come in the form of workshops, roundtables, meetings, or other settings. This includes but is not limited to education about: consent, consent talks, privilege, power dynamics, bystander intervention, and national and local policies. GASA is committed to advocating for survivors of sexual violence and creating a survivor-centric CalGreeks and greater campus community.
summary: GASA is a peer-education based organization whose goals center around education, reform, and advocacy. GASA aims to educate members of the campus and CalGreeks community about issues related to sexual violence and sexual harrassment (SVSH).

name: Greening the Greeks
description: Our mission is to create a sustained dialogue that fosters change around sustainability and environmental justice in all Greek Councils through education and community created solutions.
summary: Greening the Greeks is a student organization consisting of Cal Greek members that promote environmental awareness and sustainability within the fraternity and sorority community, especially in housing facilities and at Greek-sponsored events.

name: Growth Equity Club at Berkeley
description: We are an undergraduate club seeking to provide students at UC Berkeley with an environment to pursue their interests in investment banking, private equity, and venture capital. We will host social events, career development workshops, and speaker events. We highly encourage students interested in learning about start-up investing and/or early stage deal advisory to reach out to us!
summary: We seek to provide current students at UC Berkeley an environment to pursue their interests in growth equity as it pertains to investment banking, private equity, and venture capital.

name: Guided Resource and Education Program in Machine Learning
description: Our program is designed to give newcomers a guided introduction into the world of ML. We hope to provide members with a platform to understand where to start and what to work on, while building a community throughout. This includes getting matched with a mentor and provided with comprehensive resources for further ML education and opportunities. This program is not designed to be an introduction to Machine Learning theory, but aims to provide members with a framework for getting started in ML.
summary: GREP in ML is a program designed to give newcomers an introduction to the Machine Learning sphere. We hope to provide members with a platform to understand where to start and what to work on, while building a community throughout.

name: Gun Violence Prevention Project
description: GVPP supports the efforts of Global Action on Gun Violence to keep communities safe through legal research in both the advocacy and impact litigation spaces.
summary: GVPP supports the efforts of Global Action on Gun Violence, a non-profit committed to preventing gun violence around the world. Through GVPP, Berkeley Law students are vested with a voice to end gun violence.

name: Gymnastics Club of California
description:
As a Registered Student Organization, the Gymnastics Club of California provides a community for enthusiasts of all backgrounds to engage with each other with a common interest in the sport of gymnastics. It will create an open and inclusive space for athletes, coaches, and enthusiasts to connect and create a community where the spirit of gymnastics can thrive in the face of dying interest. We offer many opportunities for members to socialize and form bonds, and we educate our members on maintaining a healthy lifestyle grounded in gymnastics based activities.

Join our discord all of our information is there: https://discord.gg/HpRvDUanpP
summary: We provide a community for enthusiasts of all backgrounds to engage in facets of gymnastics. We create an inclusive space for athletes, coaches, and enthusiasts to unite and form a community where gymnastics can thrive in the face of dying interest.

name: Haas Africa Business Club
description: The Haas Africa Business Club is the student-led body of Haas students of African descent and others interested in the African continent. Our goal is to connect Africa to the Bay Area for accelerated development and realization of the continent's potential.
summary: To be completed by student leader upon registration

name: Haas AI and Data Science Club
description:
Our mission is to empower future leaders to make data-driven decisions and prepare them for success in an increasingly data-driven world as responsible & ethical tech leaders.

The Data Science Club is focused on hosting events that educate MBAs about artificial intelligence & data analytics. This year’s agenda is to be more out there and recognized as Data+AI club in Berkeley & beyond. 



We aim to make data science inclusive for all backgrounds, offering events for all levels that can provide continued career development for data science professionals and spark interest for amateurs.
summary: To be completed by student leader upon registration

name: Haas Asia Business Club
description: Haas Asia Business Club is an organization aimed to foster the social, cultural, and business ties among MBA students from Asia.
summary: Haas Asia Business Club is a student led club to introduce Asian culture in Haas and also provide a platform for Asian students for stronger sense of belonging.

name: Haas Blockchain Club
description: Budding from Haas School of Business, we focus on the business aspect of blockchain / crypto. The club’s mission is to create an open forum to understand and discuss blockchain technology in the UC Berkeley Haas and graduate communities. To foster student-driven blockchain innovation and networking through web3 employment opportunities, novel startups, and crypto VCs.

name: Haas Entrepreneurs Association
description:
The Berkeley Entrepreneurs Association (BEA) holds a distinguished position as the largest and oldest student association dedicated to entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley. At the core of our mission is the commitment to foster and support the entrepreneurial spirit among students and founders within the UC Berkeley community.

With a rich history and extensive network, BEA has become a thriving ecosystem that nurtures over 1,000 aspiring entrepreneurs. Our members come from diverse academic backgrounds, representing a wide range of disciplines including business, data science, computer science, and multiple hard sciences.

BEA takes pride in providing a dynamic platform where students can connect, collaborate, and learn from one another. Through a variety of initiatives, events, and resources, we aim to empower our members with the knowledge, skills, and networks essential for entrepreneurial success.

One of the key pillars of BEA's activities is our robust support system. We offer mentorship programs, workshops, and expert-led seminars that equip aspiring entrepreneurs with practical insights and guidance. Furthermore, our extensive network of alumni and industry professionals enables us to facilitate meaningful connections and valuable partnerships.

BEA's impact extends beyond the boundaries of the UC Berkeley campus. We actively engage with the local startup ecosystem, forging connections with investors, industry leaders, and other entrepreneurial organizations. This collaborative approach allows us to create opportunities for our members to showcase their ventures, gain exposure, and secure funding.

In essence, the Berkeley Entrepreneurs Association serves as a catalyst for innovation and entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley. By fostering an inclusive and supportive environment, we empower aspiring entrepreneurs to turn their ideas into reality, contribute to society, and shape the future of innovation.
summary: As the largest & oldest student association for entrepreneurship at UC Berkeley, our club fosters & supports entrepreneurship & founders, serving 1,000+ aspiring entrepreneurs across diverse academic disciplines.

Through a blend of educational workshops, speaker series, networking events, and practical training sessions, the club aims to provide a holistic view of various finance domains including investment banking, asset management, and corporate finance. The club fosters a collaborative environment, where students can not only learn from industry experts through guest lectures but also from their peers, thereby enhancing their skill set and expanding their professional network. Membership in the Haas Finance Club is an essential stepping stone for MBA students looking to break into or advance in the competitive world of finance.
summary: The Haas Finance Club at Berkeley's MBA Program is a hub for aspiring finance professionals. It offers workshops, speaker series, and networking events to help students advance in areas like investment banking, asset management, and corporate finance.

name: Haas Women in Leadership
description:
WiL's mission is to serve the entire Haas community through a series of professional,educational, and social events designed to enhance the understanding and appreciation ofwomen's roles in business while equipping WiL members for success.

 

We organize around four main pillars to help foster an inclusive and engaging experience for our club members.

01.– 

Community: We have several events that run throughout the year. The most relevant one beingWednesdays with WiL, an open table for members to come together and connect with the WiL community. Another highlight is our Members Retreat each fall.

 

02.–

Professional: To provide professional support, we collaborate with the Haas CareerManagement Group and our Alumni club (WiLA). Our flagship professional event is our AnnualSpring Conference, the longest running conference at Haas.

 

03.–

Social: We spend a lot of time building community! Our members and allies are always invitedto our WiL happy hours and mixers. We also work directly with Haas Admissions to host social,recruiting, and informational events for prospective students.

 

04.–

Educational: We host workshops on boundaries, allyship, and women's health, just to name afew. Our Manbassadors (male allyship group) spearhead much of this work. We alsocollaborate with and mentor the Berkeley Undergraduate Women in Business club.
summary: WiL's mission is to serve the entire Haas community through a series of professional,educational, and social events designed to enhance the understanding and appreciation ofwomen's roles in business while equipping WiL members for success.

name: Health and Medical Apprenticeship Program
description: The Health and Medical Apprenticeship Program (HMAP) was created in 1984 by four UC Berkeley undergraduates with the goal to introduce Berkeley students to ethical issues and philosophical dilemmas related to the fields of health and medicine. The results of their efforts are three subprograms: the course Public Health 116 (PH 116), the Field Study Internship (FSI), and the Health Service Internship (HSI). An entirely student-run organization, HMAP continues to expose students to a broad spectrum of experiences and opportunities, covering many facets of health and medicine while emphasizing participatory learning.
summary: HMAP, an entirely student-run organization, is the umbrella program for three programs that influence over a thousand students every semester: the class Public Health 116 (PH116), the Field Study Internship (FSI), and the Health Service Internship (HSI).

description:
Are you interested in healthcare consulting? Do you want to gain business insights into the healthcare industry? Come join us at Healthcare Consulting Group!
We work with a wide range of U.S. and international healthcare startups to solve various complex issues in launching a healthcare business. HCG consists of an analyst training team and two or more project teams each semester. In Fall 2023, we are recruiting analysts and consultants!
Linktree: https://linktr.ee/berkeleyhcg
------------------------------------------------
Analysts will attend our semester-long weekly training program where our experienced mentors will guide you through important consulting concepts and skills. You will then work as a team to tackle a project at the end of the semester and become a consultant in future semesters.
------------------------------------------------
Come to our info sessions and case workshop to meet HCG members and learn more about the open positions and application process!
HCG Fall 2023 Recruitment Timeline:
Info Session 1 | 8/28, 8-10 PM Social Sciences 20
Info Session 2 | 8/29, 8:30-10 PM Moffitt 103
Case Workshop | 8/30, 8-10 PM Latimer 120
Application Deadline | 8.31, 5PM HBOA app; link on our website & Instagram
Group Interviews | 9/2 Invite Only
Social Night | 9/2 Invite Only
Individual Interviews | 9/3 Invite Only
------------------------------------------------
For recruitment inquiries, please email recruitment@hcg.berkeley.edu.

Members of this organization will learn about and discuss upcoming legislation in healthcare, email/call legislators to demand change in the healthcare system, spread awareness about upcoming legislation, and address disparities in the healthcare system among other like-minded peers.

description:
Helix Medical invites high school students from all over the Bay Area to a free, four-week summer program that exposes them to careers in healthcare and medicine. As UC Berkeley undergrads, we design the Helix educational experience such that students explore different fields of health, meet and network with local healthcare professionals, rotate through clinical and biological skills labs, and explore avenues for futures in health-oriented careers. Following the summer program, Helix alumni take part in unique semesterly workshops and are individually matched to a mentor in their healthcare field of interest. Ultimately, we hope to contribute towards a diverse health provider population that represents and advocates for the communities they serve.

 

Fall 2023 Interest Form: tinyurl.com/helixfall23interest

For more information: thehelixgroup.org

The Hellenic Student Association at Berkeley is not affiliated with any political parties.

name: Her Campus of Berkeley
description:
Written entirely by the world's top college journalists – with 12,000+ contributors and counting – HerCampus.com features national Style, Beauty, Health, Love, Life, Career, Entertainment, News, DIY, LGBTQ+, High School, and After College content supplemented by local content from 420+ campus chapters around the world.

Her Campus serves as a career launching point for its team of college journalists. Since joining the Her Campus team, members have been offered jobs and internships with Glamour, Vogue, Buzzfeed, Vanity Fair, Seventeen, Marie Claire, Harper’s Bazaar, People, The Huffington Post, Teen Vogue, InStyle, Esquire, O magazine, MTV, The Washington Post, Digitas, Ogilvy, and many more.

Her Campus of Berkeley is an Elite Level chapter of the global online publication, which means we’re in the top 5% of over 420 campus chapters worldwide. Not only are we a highly-ranked organization, but we’re also a strong community of creative college students. Our goal is to empower UC Berkeley students by proving a welcoming, positive creative outlet. If you’re interested in writing, design, marketing, photography, or another creative field, Her Campus is the place for you.
summary: Her Campus of Berkeley is an Elite Level chapter of the global online publication Her Campus. Our teams include writing, design, and marketing. We strive to create a welcoming, positive creative outlet in which members of all genders can learn and grow.

name: Herbicide Free at Berkeley
description: ReWild at Berkeley utilizes student input and direct interactions with groundskeepers to create change on campus to transition away from synthetic herbicides. UC Berkeley has used herbicides on its campus for years but this organization directly addresses the issues and health impacts that come with that. By creating relationships with staff, forming campus plans, and personally going out throughout campus to hand-weed the greenery, we can continue to create a movement that will keep everyone on campus safe. This issue goes beyond our campus, so by taking these steps to show how feasible it is to make a campus Herbicide Free, we can inspire outside communities to do the same.
summary: Herbicide Free Berkeley utilizes student input and direct interactions with groundskeepers to create change on UC Berkeley's campus to transition away from synthetic herbicides.

As a member of HRI, you will contribute to the following: 

  • brainstorm and plan projects for various villages in Armenia
  • hold various fundraisers for university scholarships
  • create scholarship applications for village students entering their first year of university
  • read applications and choosing scholarship recipients 
  • create lesson plans for students for our annual summer camps
  • have the chance to intern as a teacher, counselor, and mentor in Armenian villages during the summer
  • make a positive impact by providing educational opportunities and resources to students looking to pursue their interests

name: Hindu Shishya Association
description:
The Hindu Shishya Association at UC Berkeley provides a safe space on campus to learn about, practice, and discuss sanatana dharma. We host fun social events and facilitate general body meetings about the relevance of Hinduism to modern societal issues.

This group, Hindu Shishya Association, was formerly names Hindu Students Council [10/27/23] - LL
summary: The Hindu Shishya Association at UC Berkeley provides a safe space on campus to learn about, practice, and discuss sanatana dharma. We host fun social events and facilitate general body meetings about the relevance of Hinduism to modern societal issues.

name: Hindu YUVA-Youth for Unity, Virtues and Action
description: The purpose of UC Berkeley’s Hindu YUVA organization is to bring together both Hindu and non-Hindu students to raise awareness about what Hinduism is. As Hinduism is one of the largest and oldest religions in the world, we believe it is necessary for there to exist an organization on campus to represent the interests of the Hindu community. We hope to create a comfortable atmosphere where students can come and celebrate their culture. We hope to achieve these goals by having team-building games, yoga and meditation, lively debates, and exciting debates and presentations at our weekly meetings. All in all, we want to build a small Hindu community within UC Berkeley so that students can come and discover a home away from home.
summary: The purpose of UC Berkeley’s Hindu YUVA organization is to bring together both Hindu and non-Hindu students to raise awareness about what Hinduism is.

name: Hispanic Engineers and Scientists
description:
Mission

Hispanic Engineers and Scientists of the University of California, Berkeley is an organization meant to be a resource for underrepresented Latinx students in STEM as they navigate their professional/academic endeavors and achieve holistic wellness. We work towards diversifying the STEM workforce and academia through professional development workshops, networking opportunities, and community outreach.

 

History
HES is a student organization established in 1974 bringing together all Latinx student engineers and scientists to promote the advancement of education among underrepresented minority students and to create a support system within Berkeley academia. HES is open to all students of the UC Berkeley campus who share our devotion to the recruitment and retention of Latinx students into higher education. Throughout the year, HES engages in activities that help both members of our organization and people in our community. The unwavering dedication of our members has made our numerous outreach, recruitment, and retention programs continued successes.
summary: The Hispanic Engineers and Scientists of the University of California, Berkeley are determined to increase the number of culturally responsible engineers and scientists who succeed academically, lead professionally, & contribute passionately to society.

name: Historical Fencing Club of Berkeley
description:
Welcome to The Historical Fencing Club of Berkeley, where we practice swordsmanship using realistically constructed and fully weighted sword replicas, protective equipment, and manuscripts written by fencing masters of old. We aim to reconstruct historical techniques and fighting systems for a wide array of weapons, including but not limited to the longsword, cavalry saber, and rapier. Our meetings involve both guided practice to learn skills and free sparring to put those skills to the test. Come try us out if you’d like to engage in combat in a safe and welcoming environment or just have fun handling a sword!

 

We teach from a list of manuals, some of which are Keith Farrell's German Longsword Manual for longsword (adapted from the teachings of Johannes Liechtenaur), Fiore de’i Liberi’s Il Fior di Battaglia(c. 1400) for longsword and dagger, and Charles Roworth’s Art of Defence on Foot(1798) for cavalry saber. There is no independent study required for members(though you might find it valuable to read the source for something you’re confused about) and our instructors will give you all the information you need.

 

We have no club dues, application, need for prior experience, and you don’t need to buy any gear. The club will provide everything you need to participate. While our instructors teach lessons that build upon each other, we welcome new members throughout the year and will be more than happy to get you up to speed on anything you’ve missed!

 

You might have heard fencing associated with the Olympics and some of our members have backgrounds in sport fencing. In contrast to modern/sport/Olympic fencing, which trains to the rules of the sport in question, historical fencing and other Historical European Martial Arts(HEMA) train in practical swordsmanship for self-defense, dueling, or military contexts of the past. Look no further if you’d like to learn more about swordsmanship and its historical usage!

 

Come join us on Memorial Glade next to Evans Hall every Saturday from 2:30-5:00 PM if you’d like to get involved!

 

Join our discord for further information: https://discord.gg/J6Wzu3PCSY
summary: The Historical Fencing Club of Berkeley is a community dedicated to the study and practice of Historical European Martial Arts, especially historical fencing.

name: History Graduate Association
description: The History Graduate Association serves to represent all graduate students of UC Berkeley’s Department of History and their interests, actively foster a professional, inclusive, and supportive graduate community, act as a liaison between the Department’s graduate students, faculty and staff, as well as the the wider UC Berkeley community, and coordinate graduate community events and workshops.
summary: The HGA serves to represent all graduate students of UC Berkeley’s Department of History and their interests, act as a liaison between the Department’s graduate students, faculty and staff, and coordinate graduate community events and workshops.

name: Hmong Student Association at Berkeley

HSAB provides academic and social support to current and prospective students at Berkeley through the implementation of educational discussions, social activities, and outreach services. Established in 2008, HSAB continues to represent a voice for the Hmong student community at University of California, Berkeley.
summary: The Hmong Student Association at Berkeley (HSAB) is a student-initiated service group with the mission to promote higher education and cultural understanding of the Hmong community.

name: Home of Students Christian Fellowship
description:
Welcome to Home of Students (HOS)! We are a Mandarin-speaking Christian student organization that has been a home away from home for thousands of students in the past fifteen years. Every week, we organize fun and meaningful activities to make new friends, share our lives together, and learn about Jesus. We invite you to join us and make HOS your home at Berkeley :)

 

We meet weekly on:

1) Friday Fellowship @ 2601 Durant Ave (6:15-9pm)

2) Sunday Worship Service @ 2715 Prince Street (11am-12:30pm or 5-7pm)

summary: Welcome to Home of Students (HOS)! We are a Chinese-speaking Christian student organization that has been a home away from home for thousands of students in the past ten years.

name: Homelessness Service Project
description:
The issues that the unhoused population faces have persisted through the COVID-19 pandemic. There are well over 5,000 homeless people in Alameda County, with over half residing in Oakland. The Homelessness Service Project (HSP) strives to provide as much assistance to the unhoused population as possible. HSP provides legal assistance to the homeless and low-income community in the East Bay Area. HSP is not limited to issues of homelessness, but covers any type of legal issues that people of the homeless and low income-community encounter.

 

Homelessness Service Project (HSP) pairs Berkeley students and local lawyers to provide legal assistance to the homeless and low income community in the Bay Area. Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, our primary project was at The Suitcase Clinic in Berkeley, providing legal counseling and referral services to homeless individuals who come for healthcare and housing services. In light of the current global situation, our work will center on remote client work and research. Students will have an opportunity to work with clients remotely by helping class members of the recent CalTrans case fill out and submit settlement claims forms. Students will also have an opportunity to work closely with attorneys from Homeless Action Center (HAC), Western Regional Advocacy Project (WRAP), and Lawyers Committee for Civil Rights (LCCR). Our work will include several research projects on issues of homelessness, ranging from policy research on bias in the courts to the effects business improvement districts (BIDs) have on the unhoused population.
summary: HSP work is not limited to issues of homelessness, but covers any type of legal issues that people of the homeless and low income community encounter.

name: Hong Kong Affairs Association of Berkeley
description:
We are a group of students at the University of California, Berkeley who are concerned about the political situation in Hong Kong. We have devoted ourselves to the founding of the Hong Kong Affairs Association of Berkeley (HKAAB), with the following objectives: 

1)    Raising awareness among students and the general public for issues related to democracy and human rights in Hong Kong; 

2)    Providing a platform for intellectual and cultural exchange upon Hong Kong affairs; 

3)    Connecting with other relevant advocacy and student organizations.

 

Note: We use our facebook page (fb.com\hkaaberk) and email (hkaaberk@gmail.com) as the main channels of communication.
summary: This association seeks to group together Berkeley students who are interested or concerned about Hong Kong public affairs and promote awareness regarding issues of Hong Kong in Berkeley and the US.

name: Hong Kong Student Association
description:
Hong Kong Student Association

Email: berkeleyhksa@gmail.com

Website: http://berkeleyhksa.weebly.com/

Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/ucb.hksa/

Instagram Page: https://www.instagram.com/cal.hksa/


Subscribe to our mailing list:http://www.berkeleyhksa.org/contact-us.html

Tabling Hours:
Mon - Fri 11 a.m. - 2 p.m., Upper Sproul

 

What is HKSA?

Hong Kong Student Association (HKSA) is a Registered Student Organization (RSO) at UC Berkeley. Sponsored by Associated Students of University of California (ASUC), we avidly champion the culturally rich blend of the traditional Cantonese legacy and fast-paced modernity, with the objectives of building up an intimate Cantonese community on campus and facilitating cultural exchanges.

Every semester, we organize a wide variety of activities, such as BBQ socials, campus tours, family events, detective games, Chinese New Year and Valentine's Day parties, karaoke contests, and senior banquets. As a member club of East Asian Union (EAU), we also collaborate with other member clubs, such as Chinese Student Association, Taiwanese Student Association, and Singapore Malaysia Student Association on organizing events, such as the EAU Night Market, Halloween parties, et cetera. Our club is open to anyone and everyone who is interested in Hong Kong culture and further build their community here at Cal.
summary: HKSA avidly champions the culturally rich blend of the traditional Cantonese legacy and fast-paced modernity, with the objectives of building up an intimate Cantonese community on campus and facilitating cultural exchanges.

name: HOSA Future Health Professionals of Berkeley
summary: HOSA FHP of Berkeley serves to inspire and support pre-health students at UCB. As a National HOSA chapter, this club involves volunteering, educational symposiums and conferences, competitive & recognition events, and leadership opportunities.

name: Human Powered Vehicle
description:
Students involved in our group will be part of a small team of students from all backgrounds. Members apply concepts learned in the classroom to building a human powered vehicle. Skills developed include machining, CAD, and working with composite materials. No prior skills are required, just enthusiasm and hard work!

Students interested in joining should send an email to hpv-me@berkeley.edu or fill out our interest form here: https://forms.gle/WtgsSrVpUoosgqpa9
summary: Engineering project team that builds prototype bicycles and participates in the World Human Powered Speed Challenge, where bikes set international speed records.

name: I-Clicker Rental Program
summary: 2015-16 Senator Karthik Prasad's initiative program

name: I.C.E.D D.I.C.E (Inclusion, Community, Equity, Diversity / Deconstruction, Intent, Competence, Empowerment)
description: The purpose of this organization is to build a community of individuals from different backgrounds, identities, and lived experiences. A safe and brave space for members to gain self empowerment and empower, through empathy and competence. A space where members can step away from the academic rigors and socially constrained settings that prevent one from being their true self and finding their purpose.
summary: The purpose of this organization is to build a community of individuals from different backgrounds, identities, and experiences. A safe/brave space where members will gain skills to become self empowered and empowering, through empathy and competence.

name: IDEA Factory
description: IDEA Factory is a creative consulting agency run by students of UC Berkeley. We provide insightful marketing and advertising solutions through compelling strategy, interactive concepts, and unique insights to our clients varying from local start-ups to international businesses.
summary: IDEA Factory is a creative consulting agency run by students of UC Berkeley and Academy of Arts University. We provide insightful marketing and advertising solutions through compelling strategy, interactive concept, and unique production to our clients.

name: Ideas on Consciousness
description: Ideas on Consciousness is a student organization focused on providing spaces for students of different disciplines and backgrounds to cross paths, share ideas, and explore questions relating to the nature of consciousness. Ideas on Consciousness hosts weekly “cafe hours” and social events, while also facilitating a two-unit DeCal class that students are encouraged, but not required, to enroll in.
summary: Ideas on Consciousness is a student organization focused on providing spaces for students of different disciplines and backgrounds to cross paths, share ideas, and explore questions relating to the nature of consciousness.

name: IEEE Power and Energy at Berkeley
description: The goal of this community is to promote the technical knowledge in the areas of power and energy research. We aim to provide a space for students, both graduate and undergraduate, to further their technical knowledge, presentation and discussion skills. This community works to aid in the transfer of knowledge and cooperation of its members and affiliates. In addition, this community aims to provide the necessary resources for students, connecting them with industry members in the Bay Area and globally. We host members of the power and energy community as part of our seminar series, to inform our members on technical advancements outside the university. We represent a student branch of the IEEE PELS/PES/IAS chapters.
summary: The goal of this community is to promote the technical knowledge in the areas of power and energy research.

name: IEEE Student Branch
description: The University of California, Berkeley IEEE Student Branch connects engineering students with opportunities in electrical engineering and computer science.
summary: Connecting engineering students with opportunities in electrical engineering and computer science.

name: IEOR Graduate Student Group (formerly Student INFORMS)
summary: The purpose of this organization is to enhance sharing, communication and collaboration among graduate students on academic research and professional development in the IEOR Department.

name: If/When/How: Lawyering for Reproductive Justice at Berkeley
description: If/When/How is a national nonprofit that trains, networks, and mobilizes law students and legal professionals to work within and beyond the legal system to champion reproductive justice. If/When/How: Lawyering for Reproductive Justice at Berkeley educates, organizes, and supports law students to ensure that a new generation of advocates will be prepared to protect and expand reproductive rights.
summary: If/When/How: Lawyering for Reproductive Justice at Berkeley educates, organizes, and supports law students to ensure that a new generation of advocates will be prepared to protect and expand reproductive rights.

name: iGEM at Berkeley
description:
About us:

iGEM at Berkeley is a “by students for students” synthetic biology lab space. Over time, students can receive hands-on and virtual training to fully participate in experimentation in either our wetlab, or compbio team.  These students can then take on leadership roles as officers who both manage experimentation and provide the members with a well-maintained hackerspace through various critical administrative roles.  Progression through the club is based on contribution and not on previous experiences.  All majors and years are welcome.  

 

Recruitment for the Fall semester has officially started!

Our last infosession is Thursday, 8/31 from 8-9 pm in Dwinelle 179.
 
General Membership form: fill out this brief form if you're interested in being a general member, training team member, or outreach team member. As a general member, you get access to all of our training resources and professional development events, with the flexibility of completing everything on your own schedule. As a training team member, you can get a more guided introduction to synthetic and computational biology in a group-learning setting. No previous biology research experience is required or expected.
 
Application Forms: check out our applications if you're interested in joining one of our computational or wetlab experimental teams, ideation teams, DeCals, or admin teams. As an experimental team member, you will join a specific project and design experiments to research a specific question. We have 7 experimental teams that are recruiting this semester and 2 ideation teams. A brief description of each project is listed in the form, but come to one of our infosessions to learn about each project in more depth.

 

Students in an experimental project team (Wetlab or CompBio) will:

  • Design, implement, and analyze wet and computational projects with an application to synthetic biology.  This will develop their problem solving abilities by trouble-shooting research projects, and push them to think creatively to design new experiments and protocols and adapt them to evolving data and feedback.  
  • Learn genetic engineering techniques, and via project brainstorming sessions, become literate in analysis of scientific publications.  Students will be pushed to read primary literature and evaluate the contemporary problems of their research topics, in order to produce plausible solutions in the form of project ideas.  Via training modules, students will also receive hands-on skills to enter the wetlab space and to perform data analysis with computational tools.  
  • Develop their abilities to communicate and accomplish goals with their peers.  Our students will gain a sense of ownership of their research project, and play important roles in running and maintaining a simple BSL-1 lab space.  Our effort is entirely student driven, and it will take a diverse set of students of different interests and backgrounds to keep our hacker-space thriving.

 

All information about our club including all of our applications can be found on igem.berkeley.edu.
summary: Our mission is to provide undergraduates the unique opportunity to perform original, student-led genetic engineering research projects. We seek to increase accessibility of the synthetic biology community to students at Cal.

name: Imago Dei Clinic
description:
Imago Dei Clinic is a Christian nonprofit committed to saving lives and empowering the homeless community by providing harm-reduction services and sharing Biblical truth. ​​​​​​​Our vision is to bring God's light into the darkness of addiction. Imago Dei originates from the Greek, "Image of God." We recognize the God-given worth of every individual by meeting with our neighbors where they are at and building those mutually-beneficial relationships.

 

We hold weekly outreaches at different locations around the Bay Area. Currently we serve People's Park, Martin Luther King Jr. Civic Center Park, and West Oakland. Our volunteers are taught the history of the opioid epidemic and how it has negatively impacted our communities. Prior to outreach, volunteers are trained to know what health supplies we pass out, how to engage with the homeless population, and the steps needed to help someone currently overdosing. Outreach leaders and their groups then venture out to carry the mission of Imago Dei. 

 

If this interests you, please fill out our application form. We are always open to new ideas and accept all volunteers! If you would like to serve remotely, feel free to reach out by email or through any of our social medias.
summary: Imago Dei Clinic is a Christian nonprofit committed to saving lives and empowering the homeless community by providing harm-reduction services and sharing Biblical truth.

name: Improv4Charity
description: Improv4Charity is a short-form improvisational comedy team that donates 100% of their show proceeds to charity! We have performed on campus, local fundraisers, and even UCSF Children's Hospital. We put on various improv shows throughout the semester as well as workshops that help the community's improv and comedy skills in various fashions.
summary: Improv4Charity is a short-form improvisational comedy team that donates 100% of their show proceeds to charity! We have performed on campus, local fundraisers, and even UCSF Children's Hospital.

name: In Transcription at Berkeley
description: We are the Berkeley Chapter of In Transcription, a community for life science students, researchers, and entrepreneurs. Founded in 2021, In Transcription has chapters across universities in the U.S. We hope that through forming small communities, undergraduates would feel a sense of security and belonging in this group of like-minded fellows.
summary: In Transcription@Berkeley aims to bring undergraduate students with a common interest in life science together to explore opportunities in academia, industry, and business.

name: Indian Students Association
description:
Indian Students Association at Berkeley is an on-campus student organization conceived with the objective of representing the South Asian Diaspora and the Indo-American community on the UC Berkeley campus. 

 

 

The council is composed of ~30 individuals dedicated to designing, marketing, financing, and coordinating events spreading and celebrating South Asian culture with the Berkeley community. Our grandest events include the largest "Green" Holi on the West coast, Diwali and Raas-Garba. These events are highly anticipated by the Berkeley community and receive upwards of 2,000 people in total.

 

 

Apart from these events, we host “cross-cultural conversations” via mixers with Sikh Student Association, Nigerian Student Association, Pakistani Student Association and more so that members are able to make connections and learn about the wide range of cultures at Berkeley. We also recognize the power of our voice on campus and host panels, social justice events, and speakers with a diverse range of backgrounds to speak on issues that affect the South Asian experience globally. Diversity and inclusion is a staple of ISA and something that we strive toward with our events and actions.

 

 

Check out our social media/website to either join the council or join our general member program with exclusive access to our events & a community that awaits you!
summary: ISA is an on-campus student organization dedicated to representing the South Asian Diaspora and the Indo-American community to the UC Berkeley campus and the Bay Area in general through meetings, events, and media.

name: Indus
description:
To achieve this aim, Indus shall:

1. organize educational and cultural activities meant to educate the campus population at-large about classical and modern South Asian culture;
