  • work together to fill the gaps in social work education while looking into the community needs and bringing forth advocacy for the diverse needs of Latinx graduate students.
  • empower Latinx students to find avenues for change within the community.
  • create partnerships with faculty, students, and social work professionals to bring Latinx voices into the classrooms and curriculum.
  • enrich the educational experience of Latinx students’ who are committed to serving the Latinx community.
summary: The purpose of the Latinx Social Work Caucus (LSWC) is to build connections to ensure students and faculty in the School of Social Welfare feel a sense of belonging and community.

name: Latiné Caucus
description: Latiné Caucus is a collective Latiné advocacy organization that branches out of the Chicanx Latiné Student Development Office (CLSD). Liaisons and leaders from Latiné organizations come together to inform and support each other.
summary: Latiné Caucus is a collective Latiné advocacy organization that branches out of the Chicanx Latiné Student Development Office (CLSD). Liaisons and leaders from Latiné organizations come together to inform and support each other.

name: Launchpad
description:
*** Our application can be found here: https://launchpad.berkeley.edu/apply ***

We are a project based organization that implements cutting edge research in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and data science into useful open source projects. Not only do we develop our members internally with hack nights and tech tutorials, but we also hold external talks, technical workshops, and info sessions to help the general Berkeley CS community. Our vision is to turn the theory we learn from intelligent software classes into real applications that our teams can take ownership of.
summary: We are a community of passionate engineers who tackle real-world problems using machine learning and artificial intelligence.

name: Laundry Love
summary: To provide a means for the homeless and the low-income to do their laundry through financial and material subsidies while building gospel-centered relationships with those who are on the fringes of society and the Berkeley community.

name: Lavender Alliance at Berkeley
description: This organization aims to represent LGBTQ+ Chinese international students at Berkeley while advancing equal access to resources on campus for everyone who identifies as part of the community, and serves as a hub for transnational LGBTQ+ grassroot organizing among this community and allies
summary: This organization aims to create a platform to support LGBTQ+ community from Greater China Area or of Chinese descent, and serve as a networking platform for students, faculties, alumni and staff who such identify and/or are allies of this community.

name: Law and Political Economy Society of Berkeley
description:
The Law and Political Economy Society (LPE Soc) of Berkeley offers a community through which Berkeley Law students can build creative thinking, dissent, and systemic critique into their study and practice. 

LPE Soc is a student-run organization dedicated to fostering interest and discussion in the emerging LPE movement, which seeks to expose how legal rules concentrate economic and political power among dominant social groups, and simultaneously build and expand modes of legal thinking which embed the economy in social life. By revealing the artificial divide between law, politics, and economics, we seek to help students exercise their power to reimagine the social order.
summary: A community of students and faculty members interested in how law shapes politics and the economy through roundtable discussions, reading groups, and scholarly presentations

name: Law and Society Graduate Association
description:
Our purpose is to provide networking, professional development, and social opportunities for graduate students in Jurisprudence & Social Policy and the field of Law & Society.

The 2023-2024 Executive Board is as follows:

  • President: 
  • Events Coordinator: Molly Culhane
  • Gateway Organizers: Will Darwall
  • SABL Rep: 
  • Undergrad Curriculum Committee: Laura Ramirez
  • Diversity & Inclusion Rep: Rubi Gonzales
  • JSP Admissions Rep: Mitzia Martinez
  • Union Steward: Cheri Kruse
summary: Our purpose is to provide networking, professional development, and social opportunities for graduate students in Jurisprudence & Social Policy and the field of Law & Society.

name: Lawn Review at Berkeley Law
description: The California Lawn Review is the preeminent student-run landscaping publication at Berkeley Law. The California Lawn Review publishes important legal scholarship on botany, landscaping, budtending, hydroponics, and mowing techniques. We publish articles reviewing the best and worst lawns around campus and greater Berkeley and host an annual symposium in mid-April. We consider submissions from all students in all forms, including open letters, satire, creative writing, artwork, and beyond.
summary: Lawn Review at Berkeley Law is the preeminent horticultural publication at Berkeley Law. The California Lawn Review publishes articles reviewing the best and worst lawns around campus and hosts an annual symposium in mid-April.

name: Laya of Berkeley
description: The purpose of Laya is to draw together individuals who have a passion for music. Although the primary focus is classical Indian music, the goal is to blend and fuse other genres of music from around the world to create a unique performing group. The group will focus on cultivating and rehearsing these fusions through regular practices. Along with performing, the group hosts concerts and lecture demonstrations to foster an environment of musical learning. The primary focus of the group is to grow interest in classical Indian music as well as inspire individuals to expand their musical creativity.
summary: A performing group with an aim to bring the intricacies and flows of Carnatic and Hindustani classical music to the diverse, cosmopolitan environment of Cal and the larger Bay Area. We also host concerts and lec-dems to foster musical learning.

name: Le Cercle Français of Berkeley
description:
In this group, you can share your passion for the French language among like-minded peers, whether you're a novice or a native speaker! 

 

We meet weekly to socialize in French, discussing topics and issues that go beyond the strictly academic discourse you might find in a traditional French class.  

 

We also host cultural events, such as French film screenings and potlucks with French food, to promote appreciation and awareness of French culture. Not to mention our academic events featuring French professors, helping members expand their professional network. Plus, we can't forget to mention our fantastic food from authentic La Fournée croissants to crêpe get-togethers at La Crêpe à Moi.

 

For updates, follow us on FB @lecerclefrancaisUCB and instagram @lecerclefrancais.ucb or message Gigi Porter (gi.p02@berkeley.edu) to be added to the mailing list! Merci :)
summary: Le Cercle Français of UC Berkeley assembles francophone students of all levels and cultural backgrounds to engage in informal French conversation and camaraderie outside of the classroom setting.

name: Lean On Me At Berkeley
description: Lean On Me at Berkeley is a support text hotline that aims to better the mental health landscape at UC Berkeley and reduce the stigmas around mental health by removing the barriers to emotional support resources and providing accessible and anonymous peer support.
summary: Lean On Me at Berkeley aims to better the mental health landscape at Berkeley and reduce the stigmas around mental health by providing students with an accessible and anonymous peer support resource.

name: Legal Obstacles Veterans Encounter
description:
The Bay Area counties account for the largest homeless veteran population in the nation. Berkeley Law will address the current situation through our student advocacy and integration of our legal network to improve a systemic community problem.

L.O.V.E.’s purpose is to provide support for veterans to overcome legal obstacles. This objective covers a wide variety of legal areas governed by several different entities, namely the Department of Veterans Affairs, the Department of Defense, and state and local agencies.

L.O.V.E. provides legal assistance to U.S. military veterans through research projects and client advocacy to secure earned medical, housing, and compensatory benefits.
summary: L.O.V.E.’s purpose is to provide support for veterans to overcome legal obstacles.

name: Liberty in North Korea at Berkeley
description:
LiNK Berkeley is a student chapter of Liberty in North Korea (LiNK), the largest and only grassroots non-profit organization to actively aid in the rescue and rehabilitation of North Korean defectors. As one of 297 rescue teams worldwide, our mission is to raise awareness of the North Korean human rights crisis and fundraise to provide emergency relief and resettlement funds for North Korean refugees.

For more infomation see: link.berkeley.edu.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/linkberkeleychapter?fref=ts

If you are interested, contact us at linkbayarea@gmail.com.
summary: LiNK at Berkeley is a student chapter of LiNK, a human rights NGO based in Long Beach, California. Our mission is to raise awareness of the North Korean human rights crisis and fundraise to provide relief and resettlement funds for North Korean refugees.

name: LIFE Campus Ministry
summary: This student organization aims to deliver high-impact, transformational projects, and programs that provide relief and care to the poor and needy around the Bay Area, particularly our local city of Berkeley and the surrounding communities.

name: Lifters at Berkeley
description: Lifters at Berkeley is a student club for those who are passionate about lifting sports, particularly powerlifting and bodybuilding. We seek to build a tight-knit gym family that supports every member through every aspect of their lifting journey.
summary: Lifters at Berkeley is a student club for those who are passionate about lifting sports, particularly powerlifting and bodybuilding. We seek to build a tight-knit gym family that supports every member through every aspect of their lifting journey.

name: Likelion at Berkeley
description: Likelion at Berkeley is a student-run Tech Entrepreneurship Community that helps students solve real-world problems and develop their ideas into competitive products using programming. With our beginner-friendly program, learn to code, build experiences, and connect with a network of diverse individuals to achieve your goals.
summary: To provide full stack development education, to help students start a startup, and to provide various events including networking with other Likelion branches in California (not restricted to UCs, but includes Community Colleges).

name: Lindy On Sproul
description: Lindy on Sproul is the organization responsible for Lindy on Sproul, the free weekly DJ'd dance event; SwingCal, the one-unit decal; and Lindy at Night, the once monthly social dance on Upper Sproul. Our main goal is to bring swing dancing to the Berkeley community.
summary: Lindy on Sproul is a free outdoor DJ'ed swing dance event on the UC Berkeley campus.  We meet every Saturday from 12:00pm-2:30pm on Upper Sproul Plaza. No partner or experience is necessary.  For more information, find us on facebook!

name: Literary Society of Berkeley, The (Formerly The Book Club of Berkeley)
description:
The Literary Society of Berkeley offers students a space in which they may engage in recreational reading and literary discussion with their peers. The Literary Society also seeks to spread the joy of reading to the community through book drives and other events. We also provide writing, editing, and publishing support to our creative writer peers.

We are a small community of readers and writers who hang out and talk about our current reads. Contact our Facebook page to find out what we’re up to this week. 

This group The Literary Society of Berkeley was formerly named The Book Club of Berkeley - 9/9/20 IZ (PLC)
summary: The Literary Society of Berkeley provides a space for students to engage in recreational reading and literary discussion with their peers and the Berkeley community. We also provide writing, editing, and publishing support to our creative writer peers.

name: Literature of the Ancient Near East
summary: To bring together different perspectives in a collective reading of the literature of the ancient Near East.

name: Live Poets Society
description:
LPS meets to share original works of poetry and prose written by our members and works by current and historical writers selected by members. For each work, we hold an in-depth discussion covering the differing interpretations of the work, the context of the piece in relation to its author, and constructive critiques of the piece. 

LPS holds events such as workshops and monthly open-mics for poetry and original songs. We hope to create an open, encouraging community for poets and readers of all backgrounds and identities. Through comparing our interpretations of poetry, we also aim to understand ourselves as creative writers.
summary: LPS meets to read and discuss original works of poetry and prose as well as works by current and historical writers selected by our members. Together, we hope to develop an understanding of the history of poetry as well as ourselves as creative writers.

name: Logging Sports Team
description: Our logging sports team focuses on learning and teaching old-time logging techniques while simultaneously building connections with professionals in the forestry field. Our practices are generally on the weekends, and no experience is necessary to join. Our team competes in timber sport competitions throughout California. We invite members from all majors, not just forestry, to join. We hope to create a community of Bucking Bears committed to learning and enhancing their skills while also having fun!
summary: Logging Sports is a logging sports team on the west coast that teaches team members old-time logging techniques, such as chopping and crosscut sawing, and networks team members with professionals in the forestry or related fields.

name: Logically Organized Students
summary: ŁOS encourages academic discourse and social interaction between the student members of the logic community at the University of California, Berkeley.

name: Love of Laughter at Berkeley
summary: We hope to give young aspiring artists a platform to practice their performance combined with a chance to serve the community. We want to give comedians and musicians an opportunity to earn volunteer hours by performing in nursing homes.

name: Love Stories Book Club
description: The purpose of Love Stories Book Club is to provide a space for readers to connect with their peers through a love of reading romance novels while engaging in literary discussions to de-stigmatize romance novels and empower readers identities and sexualities.
summary: A space for readers to connect with their peers through a love of reading romance novels while engaging in literary discussions to de-stigmatize romance novels and empower readers identities and sexualities.

name: Lower Sproul Referendum
summary: TBD

name: LSBE Student Board
shortName: Robinson Life Sciences, Business, and Entrepreneurship Student Board
summary: The purpose of our organization is to provide student representation for members both in an interested in the Robinson Life Sciences, Business and Entrepreneurship program.

name: LUXX
summary: LUXX is a beginner friendly k-pop dance team at UC Berkeley with no auditions necessary! We are a UC Berkeley K-POP dance team that showcases each members' unique abilities and talents.

name: Machine Learning at Berkeley
description: Machine Learning at Berkeley fosters an environment for passionate students to explore ML through projects, events, and education. Internally or externally, industry clients or research groups we provide many avenues to actively engage with the field. For more information see ml.berkeley.edu
summary: Machine Learning at Berkeley fosters an environment for passionate students to explore ML through projects, events, and education. Internally or externally, industry clients or research groups we provide many  avenues to actively engage with the field.

name: maganda magazine
description:
{m}aganda magazine is a student-run academic publication based at the University of California, Berkeley. Founded in 1989, it has evolved from its beginnings as a bi-annual magazine and is now a diverse anthology of submitted work that is published once a year.

{m}aganda aims to foster critical dialogue within and across our communities through arts, literature, and education. We come from a heritage of Pilipinx- American artists, writers, and cultural historians, but we extend our hands and voices to any and all who own truths that need to be spoken.

We believe in the necessity of art as a means of influencing social change. We attempt to accomplish this by providing integral spaces and opportunities for all of us to develop ourselves as creatively conscious individuals in our communities.

{m}aganda provides a means for:

Creative cultivation: through spaces like our annually published {m]aganda magazine, workshops, and open mics, we provide forums for collective dialogue to take place, and opportunities for individuals to begin to explore their own creativity.

Community consciousness: through educational workshops, partnerships with community organizations, and spaces that promote discussion, we aim to stir our communities into a critical consciousness of our socio-political, intellectual, and cultural circumstances today.

Growing artists: through the resources and experience we provide, for artists, writers, journalists, poets, playwrights, musicians, photographers, and other creative explorers, we connect you to spaces that promote artistic growth, offer our support to you in your creative endeavors, and we aim to cultivate professional artists throughout our communities.
summary: {m}aganda aims to foster critical dialogue within and across our communities through arts, literature, and education. We come from a heritage of Pilipinx-American artists, writers, and cultural historians.

name: MAHIWAGA A Cappella
summary: Our a cappella group showcases the Philippines' cultural richness through diverse OPM (Original Pilipino Music) genres. We aim to be musical ambassadors, uniting communities through our enigmatic and soulful tunes, from Kundiman to pop music.

name: Mahjong Club
description: At UC Berkeley, there are clubs for Go, Chess, and many other board/card games, but Mahjong is a completely different type of game. It has its roots in ancient China and requires four players to play, so having a Mahjong club will assist players in finding others to play.
summary: Mahjong is a 4 player tile game where players aim to win as many points as possible. The Mahjong Club hopes to both teach new players how to play the game as well as create a place for experienced players to find others to play with.

name: Main Stacks Dance Team
description:
Founded in 2008 by Vivian Peng and May Matsuo, Main Stacks is a competitive dance team that uses dance as a medium for developing its members and its community. As a family, we seek to continue creating an environment of inclusivity through our pillars of Growth, Humility, and Community.

Main Stacks focuses on providing opportunities for personal Growth through education, dance training, competition, and social action. We aim to be a family that supports our diverse dancers and alumni under a unified love and passion for dance. 

True growth and inclusivity is unattainable without Humility. For us, that means understanding our place as guests in the house of hip-hop, learning its history, and respecting Black culture. We take pride in what we do, while embodying the “student for life” mindset.

Through sharing our knowledge and resources, we aim to foster relationships between dancers and teams in order to uplift the Community. As the proud host of Prelude Norcal Dance Competition, Main Stacks strives to push the envelope and build connections both internally and externally. 


Main Stacks is committed to upholding these values as we dance to grow, dance to build.
summary: Founded in 2008 by Cal students May Matsuo and Vivian Peng, Main Stacks was meant to provide the growing Berkeley dance community with an opportunity to dance competitively. Now, the team consists of about 50 UC Berkeley students, alumni, & friends!

name: Malaysian Student Association at Berkeley
summary: We aim to provide a forum for socialization, cultural interaction, recreational and professional activities for the Malaysian community in University of California, Berkeley or those who wish to partake in Malaysian culture.

name: Management Consulting Club at Berkeley
description: The Management Consulting Club at Berkeley (MCCB) was established in 2011 by a passionate and dedicated group of UC Berkeley students aspiring to pursue careers in the business field. As a non-profit, student-led management consulting organization, our primary objective is to offer consulting services to companies both within the Bay Area and beyond. Each semester, we engage in multiple impact-driven strategy consulting projects catering to a diverse clientele representing various industries and sectors. Our team formulates dynamic business strategies to tackle clients' challenges while also organizing workshops focused on enhancing our members' knowledge in areas such as consulting, finance, and technology.
summary: Management Consulting Club at Berkeley is America's first Korean consulting club in pursuit of excellence in management consulting and strategic management.

name: Management, Entrepreneurship & Technology Student Board
description: The M.E.T. Student Board will serve as the premier representative organization for the student body of UC Berkeley’s Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology Program by fostering social integration, professional development, academic excellence, and outreach. The student board will be comprised of the following executive members: President, VP External Relations, VP Student Resources, VPs Social Integration, and VP Admissions & Marketing, along with their coinciding committees. Membership is available to any student accepted into the Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology Program at UC Berkeley.
summary: The M.E.T. Student Board serves as the premier representative organization for the student body of UC Berkeley’s Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology Program by fostering social integration, professional development, and academic excellence.

name: Mariachi Luz de Oro
description:
Mariachi Luz de Oro de Berkeley is a musical student-run group that performs traditional and modern mariachi music. We aspire to promote musical and cultural diversity by increasing exposure to the Mexican art form of mariachi. We aim to establish and maintain a performing group to inspire the lives of the community and its members. 

We are looking for passionate and motivated students! Students interested can contact ucbmariachi@gmail.com with their name, year, instrument(s) they play, major, and any previous experience they have had either performing or playing mariachi music.

Website: mlo.berkeley.edu

Email: ucbmariachi@gmail.com 

Instagram: @ucbmlo
summary: Mariachi Luz de Oro de Berkeley is a musical student-run group that performs traditional and modern mariachi music. We aspire to promote musical and cultural diversity by increasing exposure to the Mexican art form of mariachi.

name: Mass Media at Berkeley Law
description: Mass Media at Berkeley Law (MMaBL) is a group for law students interested in the intersection of Media Law and Journalism. We are interested in building a community for students with previous media industry experience while also exploring ways that journalism and digital media can work in service of progressive legal goals and break down barriers to make the legal field more accessible.
summary: Helping Berkeley Law students become more media literate, making legal media more accessible, and raising awareness about opportunities in journalism.

name: Materials Science and Engineering Association
description:
The Materials Science and Engineering Association is the official undergraduate student organization for the Materials Science and Engineering (MSE) Department at UC Berkeley. We host a number of social events and professional development opportunities for students. We also participate in outreach to elementary and high school students.

MSEA plans a number of department-wide as well as undergraduate-only events throughout the year such as general meetings, peer advising, major-wide socials, and an overnight host program for prospective students. We also organize Dinners of the Month where we arrange for faculty members to join students for a casual dinner at a local restaurant, and Big Feast, an end-of-the year banquet. MSEA also works with industry representatives to host company information sessions, alumni tech talks, and company tours for students.
summary: MSEA is the official undergraduate student organization for the MSE Department. We organize a number of social events and professional development opportunities for students in and interested in MSE, as well as participate in outreach to local students.

name: Materials Science and Engineering Graduate Student Council
description: The Materials Science and Engineering Graduate Student Council (MSE GSC) strives to create a cohesive, inclusive, & safe community among MSE graduate students that fosters growth and a positive department culture.
summary: The Materials Science and Engineering Graduate Student Council (MSE GSC) strives to create a cohesive, inclusive, & safe community among MSE graduate students that fosters growth and a positive department culture.

name: Maternal, Child and Adolescent Health Student Interest Group
summary: The purpose of the MCAH SIG is to build a local peer network of students with a shared interest in Maternal, Child and Adolescent Health. The MCAH SIG will offer opportunities and events to engage in student-led dialogue, learning, and skill building.

name: Math Tournament at Berkeley
description:
Welcome to the Berkeley Math Tournament (BMT)! 

Since 2011, BMT, now a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit, has grown into one of the largest student-run math competitions and is internationally renowned for our flagship in-person tournaments: BMT (2000+ high school contestants) and B(mini)MT (2000+ middle school contestants). We also run asynchronous, online versions of each contest as well as a handful of international satellites (China, Toronto, Singapore, and more) every year. Historically, we've hosted a mini-math festival after each big competition with activities like integration bees and estimation games, coding/art contests, and guest speakers including Grant Sanderson (3Blue1Brown), Po Shen Loh (USIMO Coach), Steve Chow (BlackPenRedPen), Richard Rusczyk (AoPS Founder), and Cliff Stoll (Acme Klein bottles) to share their experiences with math throughout their lives. 

---

FALL 2023 & RECRUITING: 

---

There is no need for any prior contest experience or even a formal mathematics background to be a valued contributor to our organization! Running large events like ours requires a lot of diverse skill sets, and we'll more than likely have tasks suited for anyone interested in joining. Anyone with interests and passions in math, STEM, education, event planning, or running day-to-day operations of a nonprofit is highly encouraged to join! If interested, please join our discord: BMT Discord. Please verify your Cal-affiliated email to gain access to channels.

---

We are currently recruiting new problem-writers as well as logistics organizers -- activities, design, DEI (diversity, equity, and inclusion), finance/sponsorships, marketing, operations, satellites/asynchronous, and tech! We believe everyone can contribute something valuable, and resultantly we strive to remove as many barriers to entry for a student organization as possible. If you're interested in problem writing, all you need is to join the discord server, verify yourself, select the 'problem writing' role and you can start attending meetings (dates/times announced in the server). Those interested in logistics will need to verify themselves in the discord and fill out a brief Google form; we'll then organize a low-stakes brief coffee chat just to get to know a little bit about you and your specific interests. The interest form will be posted on our discord server. If you have any questions, please feel free to email us at questions@bmt.berkeley.edu. 

---
summary: BMT hosts multiple math competitions each year with a mission to design holistic, high-quality tournaments, providing engaging/challenging new experiences to over 4000 middle/high-school contestants, and is focused on improving educational outcomes.

name: Mathematics Graduate Students Association
description: The MGSA's purpose is to foster a cohesive graduate student community and represent graduate student interests in the Mathematics Department at the University of California, Berkeley.
summary: The MGSA's purpose is to foster a cohesive graduate student community and represent graduate student interests in the Mathematics Department at the University of California, Berkeley.

name: Mathematics Undergraduate Student Association
description:
MUSA is the Mathematics Undergraduate Student Association at the University of California, Berkeley. We provide multiple weekly events for undergraduate students interested in pure or applied mathematics. We focus on bolstering our community and providing members with access to a variety of informational sessions: academic advising, professional development, and undergraduate lectures, as well as social outings: board game nights, math conference trips, and volunteer opportunities. We also have an office that serves as a collaborative and inclusive space.

Joining MUSA is an excellent way to connect with other math enthusiasts. You can learn about the many opportunities for math students, and many of our members are happy to be a part of our thriving community. If you want to participate, we encourage you to join our mailing list and Discord, and check out our website. If any of the links are broken, see here for a list of regularly updated links.
summary: The two objectives of MUSA are: (1) to bring together the community of undergraduates interested in math, and (2) to represent intended and declared math and applied math majors to the Berkeley math department.

name: Matriculate
description:
Matriculate seeks to empower high-achieving, low-income high school students to apply to the nation's top selective schools; college advisors work one-on-one with high school students to mentor them through the college application process.

Matriculate is a non-profit organization that exists on campuses across the nation. Matriculate holds a full team of professional staff in New York that oversee curriculum and training of undergraduates within its advising cohort, specifically to target low-income, high-achieving high school students to support college application logistics.
summary:
Matriculate seeks to empower high-achieving, low-income high school students to apply to
the nation's top selective schools; college advisors work one-on-one with high school
students to virtually mentor them through the college application process.

name: Maya at Berkeley
summary: Maya is UC Berkeley's Indian Classical Dance Fusion team. Our mission is to inspire young dancers to innovate fusion dance from existing classical forms to foster creativity and gain awareness of different cultures.

name: MBA Association
description: MBAA responsibilities span many areas including academics, admissions, and career services. The MBAA funds activities such as social events, community events, conferences, and student club activities. The organization advocates for its Full-Time MBA students, works alongside faculty, and integrates DEI into the MBA student experience.
summary: The MBA Association is the student government organization for the full time MBA program.

name: Mechanical Engineering Graduate Student Council
description: We serve to host developmental and social activities to foster a sense of community among graduate students in the Mechanical Engineering department. We address specific problems and concerns regarding academic- and research-related policies and overall quality of life issues, as well as interface with the faculty and administration to promote change and improvement for students.
summary: To promote community among all graduate students in the department of Mechanical Engineering.

name: Medical Reallocation Initiative
description:
MRI aims to support underserved communities abroad by facilitating the reallocation of unused medical supplies from clinics and hospitals in the US. While other organizations may provide service to communities abroad by visiting different countries and joining frontline work, our organization offers members an opportunity to make an equally substantial impact from Berkeley, primarily through resource allocation. Through our weekly fundraising events and service events with local partners, we constantly provide members with a variety of opportunities to make an impact.

Apply now at https://mri.berkeley.edu!
summary: The Medical Reallocation Initiative facilitates the shipment of surplus medical supplies from the United States to underserved hospitals and clinics abroad and helps its members develop a greater understanding of global health inequalities.

name: Medical Research Club
description: We aim to provide students the opportunity to learn about medical related research through speaker events and student presentations. Encourage students to pursue research through hands-on projects that UC Berkeley faculty need assistance for.
summary: We aim to provide students the opportunity to learn about medical related research through speaker events and student presentations. Encourage students to pursue research through hands-on projects that UC Berkeley faculty need assistance for.

name: Medical Technology at Berkeley
description:
This organization is founded to promote education and innovation in the field of medical technology in various fields through software and engineering projects, technical workshops, and professional development.

More info at this website: https://mtab.berkeley.edu
summary: This organization is founded to promote education and innovation in the field of medical technology in various fields   through software and engineering projects, technical workshops, and professional development.

name: Medical Volunteering Association at Berkeley
description: We are partnered with Comfort Homesake and affiliated with the Arthritis Foundation and Highland Hospital to provide medical volunteering experiences to students at UC Berkeley. We believe that clinical experience is a valuable indication of whether you would like to go into the field, and we want to provide as many opportunities as we can. Please fill out this interest form for more information!
summary: Our purpose is to make a difference to those in need of assistance and to create opportunities for students to develop new skills and experiences.

name: Medicine Through Art & Performance
description:
Fall 2023 Club Application Form: Club Application Form

Fall 2023 Officer Application Form: Officer Application Form

Both forms are due Friday, September 22nd, 2023, if past deadline, contact lunarubymsk@gmail.com

Whether you're a prehealth student or someone interested in medical topics, all of our live have been affected by physical and mental health, whether it's been directly or from people we are close with. We hope through this club, we can express and highlight our individual perspectives regarding topics of healthcare/medicine.

 

As someone who considers myself a passionate artist who composes music and creates oil paintings, I, and, (I strongly believe) many others, understand the power that the artistic brush wields to express feelings and even stories that are often so hard to explain, simply with just words. Of course, this “artistic brush” can take shape in any form (i.e. different art mediums, poetry, music, dance..etc), and the artistic form only requires the creativity and emotion of the artist themselves. 

 

And moreover, as someone who is passionate in not only sharing my story/ideas, but also listening to and discovering others’ stories, and their medical inspirations, I thought, what better way to share them than by expressing it through an artistic form?*

 

And so here I am, eager to present, “Medicine Through Art & Performances”, an organization that I have created in hopes of building a community of students who are able to express their stories/medical passions and find more inspiration through conversations and interactions with artwork about medical health.

 

Further, MTAP aims to communicate medical stories and issues through art and performing arts through a collaborative community of medicine/health interested individuals. Through events, we hope to not only highlight different perspectives of medicine through art, but also fundraise to donate to relevant health nonprofits.
summary: To create safespace for conversations on medical stories/issues through art & performance and build an inspiring medical community. Through artistic events, we aim to highlight diverse health perspectives and fundraise for relevant health nonprofits.

name: MEDLIFE
description:
MEDLIFE (Medicine, Education, and Development for Low-Income Families Everywhere) is an organization dedicated to helping families achieve greater freedom from the constraints of poverty, empowering them to live healthier lives.

To bring the mission of our acronym to the people in need, we work globally through our DeCal which focuses on global health issues, including topics such as the cultural and historical contexts of health disparities in Peru, where we are based. We also work locally with our club, where we will discuss the systematic causes of homelessness and what actions we can take to help. Our club will also feature global health professionals who will speak on topics in relation to health equity.

Join our fight to systematically eradicate poverty through public health efforts and community development!

DeCal application due September 1, 2023 @ 11:59 PM PST:{https://forms.gle/w5aCFkEB1SJQb6Qu8} 

Club Interest Form: https://forms.gle/QN8LLwapHrJmCu3q7 

Contact us at ucbmedlife@gmail.com with any questions!
summary: MEDLIFE is a non-profit that partners with low-income communities to improve their access to medicine, education, and community development. Our students volunteer on Service Learning Trips abroad and empower underserved communities in the Bay Area.

name: Mexican Association of Students at Berkeley
description:
The Mexican Association of Students at Berkeley's (MEXASB) mission is to provide a network for students who share an interest in Mexico. In particular, it aims to:

  1. Actively promote communication and collaboration of the UC Berkeley Community who share a common cultural interest in Mexico, Mexican-Americans, and US-Mexico Relations.
  2. Recognize issues of interest to the Mexican community in the University and act as a platform to address those issues effectively.
  3. Encourage and promote communications between the MEXASB community and  Berkeley Alumni in Mexico.
  4. Support incoming Mexican students in the often tough transition to life in their new academic home, as well as in a new city (and often country).
  5. Serve as a platform helping to connect Mexican students with scholars, employers, and organizations working on issues related to Mexico. 
  6. Promote cultural activities traditionally important to the community of Mexican, Mexican-American, and Chicanx students or those otherwise interested in Mexican heritage and culture.
  7. Provide a space for academic discussion on issues related to Mexico and US-Mexico relations, as well as for the dissemination of academic work done by the community of Mexican students (broadly construed) at UC Berkeley.
  8. Support prospective Mexican students interested in attending UC Berkeley by connecting them to current members and alumni that may provide suggestions and guidance.
summary: The Mexican Association of Students at Berkeley's (MEXASB) mission is to provide an academic, professional and social network for students who share an interest in Mexico.

name: MI2 @ Berkeley
description:
Hello fellow Bears!


Are you pre-med, pre-health, or studying data science or engineering? Are you interested in medical innovation and artificial intelligence? Do you like getting creative and brainstorming innovative solutions for issues in healthcare?

Apply to MI2 at Berkeley!!!

MI2 (Medical Intelligence and Innovation) at Berkeley is a club associated with chapters at NYU, UCLA, and TCU. We stem from a summer internship at the Children’s Hospital of Orange County’s Medical Intelligence and Innovation Institute (CHOC MI3). As a member of this club, we will explore several emerging areas that are relevant to the future practice of medicine:
* genomic medicine and personalized medicine
* regenerative medicine and stem cells
* nanomedicine
* robotics and robotic surgery
* artificial intelligence and big data
* medical devices and mobile technology
* innovations in healthcare delivery


We will also expand further to include innovation and artificial intelligence as it applies to fields other than medicine.
In addition to doing pre-health/pre-med activities, we will provide members with opportunities to learn from industry professionals, including CEOs, Investors, and Physicians, as well as opportunities to develop and eventually present their own abstracts for possible products/solutions at conferences or to their peers. We are hoping to create a collaborative environment between various majors, and as a club focus on innovation and artificial intelligence in various fields.

We have various opportunities for leadership positions for members of any age/year and are looking for students with various backgrounds and interests to bring their unique perspectives to our club!

LinkTree: https://linktr.ee/mi2atberkeley
summary: MI2 @ Berkeley stems from Children’s Hospital of Orange County’s Medical Intelligence and Innovation Institute. Our focus is learning about innovative advances in emerging areas such as artificial intelligence, robotics, and, nanotechnology.

name: Microbial Biology Graduate Student Group
description:
The purpose of this organization is to provide a context for professional development, community involvement, networking opportunities, and social interactions to foster intellectual exchange within the field of microbiology. This is accomplished primarily through our annual Microbiology Student Symposium held in the Spring.

The Symposium is open to everyone, both on and off campus.  Presentations and posters are solicited primarily from microbiology graduate students in California and, to a lesser extent, from undergraduates and post-doctoral researchers.  Graduate students also nominate and vote to recruit two keynote speakers.  Keynote speakers are research group leaders, typically professors, from around the world.  

This organization also functions to support graduate students both academically and emotionally on their path through graduate school. We believe that these goals are crucial for career development and for stimulating collaborative research efforts.
summary: This organization provides opportunities for professional development,  networking opportunities, and intellectual exchange for microbiology graduate students,  primarily through our annual Microbiology Student Symposium which is open to everyone.

name: Microfinance at Berkeley
description: Founded in 2012, Microfinance at Berkeley is a student-run, non-profit business organization that supports small businesses and entrepreneurship in the Bay Area. We are a team of diverse and driven UC Berkeley undergraduates who are passionate about helping the local business community innovate and thrive. Microfinance at Berkeley offers pro-bono services for Bay Area business owners: microloans, consulting, and marketplaces.
summary: MFB is a student-run nonprofit group with a mission to support Bay Area small business owners. Since 2012, MFB has facilitated local entrepreneurship through 3 pro-bono services - microfinance, strategy consulting, and marketplace.

name: Middle Eastern Business Association
description:
Established in 2020, the Middle Eastern Business Association (MEBA) is the first UC Berkeley business organization focused on harnessing the Middle Eastern/North African community with the resources needed to excel in the workplace.

MEBA was founded with the intention of increasing representation in the workforce by fostering an inclusive community and providing professional development resources for the Middle Eastern student population
summary: MEBA strives for an organization that provides Middle Eastern students with opportunities to grow and establish connections in the business sector.

name: Military and Veterans at Berkeley Law
description: Military and Veterans at Berkeley Law's mission is to create a community where veterans can help veterans succeed in law school and beyond. This means, first and foremost, promoting social cohesion among veterans and military service members at the school. Additionally, we seek to develop veteran-specific professional opportunities for our members, as well as host events geared toward educating the wider student body on military-related topics in the law.
summary: Military and Veterans at Berkeley Law is a group of former, current, and prospective members of the military services who seek mutual support and fellowship.

name: Mindful Masters
summary: Mindful Masters members and leaders prioritize community building, self-reflection, and mindfulness strategies in order to reduce stress and promote relaxation for graduate students in the School of Social Welfare at UC Berkeley.

name: Mindfulness at Berkeley
description:
Mindfulness at Berkeley aims to provide a forum for learning mindfulness meditation: a practice with its origins in the early Theravada Buddhist tradition. Together, we hope to create a supportive environment for both beginners and dedicated practitioners to collectively deepen our understanding and share about practice.  

 

The following is a guide to meditation technique and the Buddha's teachings. If you'd like to learn more, this is a valuable resource: 

https://callink.berkeley.edu/organization/MindfulnessAtBerkeley/documents/view/1845815
summary: MAB provides an instructional platform for students to learn mindfulness meditation. Meditation practice teaches us to watch our own minds with acceptance and curiosity. This culminates in freedom from stress and awakening to our own deepest nature.

name: Minorities in Health Conference
description: Hosted by the Black Students in Health Association (BSHA), the Chicanos/Latinos in Health Education (CHE), the Pilipino Association for Health Careers (PAHC), the Asian American Pacific Islander Health Research Group (AAPIHRG), and Cal Undergraduate Public Health Coalition (Cal UPHC), this free conference aims to educate students on health disparities that affect our communities and find ways to decrease these disparities by encouraging and inspiring both high school and undergraduate students to strive toward higher education and ultimately careers in health. Students will have the opportunity to network and interact with a variety of health professionals, medical students, and graduate students from schools throughout the Bay Area such as UCSF and UC Berkeley, attend beneficial workshops, participate in public health discussions, and better equip themselves for their journeys in these competitive career tracks. Additionally, students may have special access to free or greatly reduced MCAT and GRE Prep class by attending the conference and will have access to the UC Berkeley Health Careers Opportunity Program Manager for career and graduate education advising sessions after the conference.
summary: MIHC aims to educate students on community health disparities and decrease these disparities by encouraging and inspiring high school and undergraduate students to strive toward higher education and ultimately careers in health.

name: Mobile Developers of Berkeley
description: MDB is a vibrant, open community of developers seeking to drive change within and outside of Berkeley. Our community fosters a passion for first-class development, innovative ideas, and continued learning within an inclusive and supportive environment. MDB is a defining part of our Berkeley experience and continues to impact the lives of our members beyond the walls of the university. We strive to be at the forefront of the tech community, providing exceptional services to our clients and cultivating an excitement for technical development at large.
summary: MDB is the world's largest entirely student-run mobile development organization

name: Molecular and Cell Biology Cell Developmental Neurobiological Association
description:
MCBcDNA (Molecular & Cell Biology, Cell Developmental, Neurobiological Association) serves the needs of the Molecular and Cell Biology undergraduate community, providing our peers with the resources for success!

As a club, we provide a liaison between student and faculty members through a variety of organized events and workshops (e.g. MCB Emphasis Night, Research Night, MCAT Night, Summer Opportunities Night, and many more).

Aside from our duty to the MCB community, MCBcDNA provides a medium for its members to prepare for the professional world. Club members will develop essential social, organizational, and communication skills as they interact with their club peers, plan events for the MCB community, and participate in MCBcDNA.
summary: MCBcDNA is an MCB department-sponsored student organization serving the needs of the MCB undergraduate community through a variety of events and workshops. Members plan, organize, and execute events for the MCB community.

name: Molecular and Cell Biology Undergraduate Student Association
description:
mcbUSA works in tandem with the MCB Undergraduate Advising Office (UAO) and other biology-related clubs to provide an excellent student experience at Cal. We are run by a group of driven, passionate, and hardworking MCB students who all want the best for all students in any biology field. We aim to facilitate the formation of relationships between students and faculty, and explore different paths of biological careers in health and industry. By providing valuable resources and hosting a variety of events, we strive to promote the professional and educational development of students at Berkeley. Additionally, we also host the annual Summer Undergraduate Research Program to assist students in finding research opportunities.  

We are recruiting this semester! More information about our recruitment timeline and events can be found here: https://mcbusa.berkeley.edu/recruitment/
summary: Molecular & Cell Biology Undergraduate Association (mcbUSA), the original MCB student organization sponsored by the MCB department, is a committee-based student organization.

name: Molecular Cell Biology Graduate Student Organization
description: The GSO is organized and run by MCB graduate students, acting as a liaison between the university-wide Graduate Assembly, MCB, and our grad students.
summary: The GSO is organized and run by MCB graduate students, acting as a liaison between the university-wide Graduate Assembly, MCB, and our grad students.

name: MOMO BoardGames
description: Our organization focus more on the international students community. Boardgames is a great way for building friendship. However, we found that people in different region of the world plays very different boardgames because of the complicated rules and the hardship for translation. This largely prevent people with the same interest to make friends with each other. That is why we are building this organization. We want to bring boardgames around the world to Berkeley and provide a community for international students to play boardgames they are familiar with. We will focus not only on game nights, but also on the translation of boardgames from other culture to different languages and a more friendly board game environment for non-native english speakers. We aim to help international students to find a close community that share similar interest and background in berkeley shortly after they arrive and to promote the interaction between boardgames community around the world.
summary: We want to build an international boardgames community where people from different places around the world can share the boardgames they like and make friends.

name: Mongolian Student Association
summary: The Mongolian Student Association aims to promote the presence of Mongolian culture and art on campus. We support the Mongolian community in the Bay area by volunteering at various events throughout the year. Membership is open to all.

name: Mood Psychology at Berkeley
description:
As a student organization, we are dedicated to building a supportive community for international students who are challenged by mental problems. We will achieve our goals through the following approaches:

1) helping international students to gain a better understanding of mental health problems and to learn effective self-care methods to manage stress; 2) facilitating international students to communicate their mental difficulties and guide them to different psychological services based on their needs; 3) forming a student-led research group under the guidance of a faculty member that investigates the barriers that prevent the international students at Cal from obtaining the mental health services they need and explore the strategies to address these obstacles; 4) pairing up new international students with current international students to help them build a new support system at Cal. We will also post original mental health articles on social media, host speakers, present workshops, and connect with counseling service on campus. By taking these proactive steps, Mood Psychology hopes to promote mental health for international students and help them thrive in their study abroad experience at Cal.
summary: Mood Psychology strives to improve the psychological well-being of students at UC Berkeley by generating awareness of mental health issues and promoting access to mental health resources.

name: Mosaic
description: Our purpose is to provide a platform for student clubs to collaborate, share their unique traditions, and promote intercultural understanding. Through our events and initiatives, we aim to break down barriers, challenge stereotypes, and cultivate an environment where individuals from all backgrounds can learn, appreciate, and engage with different cultures.
summary: At Mosaic, our mission is to create a vibrant and inclusive community by uniting the international clubs at Berkeley through a diverse range of events, with our primary focus being an international festival.

name: Motorsport Mechanics of Berkeley
summary: MMoB is dedicated to educating students on repairing their own motor-vehicles and providing students with a motorsport community. We intend to educate our members and provide a location and tools to perform repairs.

name: MOVE: AA Community Organizing Fellowship (Formerly known as: MOVE: API Organizing Fellowship)
description:
MOVE aims to bridge the on-campus and off-campus Asian American (AA) community and develop the next generation of AA community organizers. MOVE facilitates the political consciousness and critical thinking of student fellows through social justice-based experiential learning by placing UC Berkeley students at local community organizations. 

Inspired by the UC Berkeley Public Service Center and Seeding Change’s National Fellowship Program for Asian American Organizing and Civic Engagement, REACH! (the Asian/Pacific Islander Recruitment/Retention Center at University of California, Berkeley) launched MOVE: AAPI Community Organizing Fellowship in Spring 2017. We were a small team dedicated to bridging the gap between the university and the larger community. Currently, in our fifth year, MOVE: AAPI Community Organizing Fellowship has grown to work with 33 student fellows and 12 different host organizations in the Bay Area.

We are now also collaborating with the Asian Pacific American Student Development (APASD) office and Asian American and Asian Diaspora Studies (AAADS) department at the University of California, Berkeley to improve our capacity in supporting fellows and partner organizations.

This group MOVE: AA Community Organizing Fellowship was formerly named MOVE: API Organizing Fellowship - 10/5/21 Angelica M.
summary: MOVE aims to bridge the on-campus and off-campus Asian American (AA) community and develop the next generation of AA community organizers, by placing UC Berkeley students at local community organizations.

name: Multi-Cultural Greek Council
description:
We, the undersigned Greek organizations have joined together to form this council known as the Multi-Cultural Greek Council at the University of California, Berkeley in order to better meet our individual needs, voice our concerns and promote the greater good of our community. Our official charter date is February 2007. We recognize that there are certain areas of action and programming that can be best carried out by the joint efforts of all such organizations. As culturally based organizations, we strive to promote and uplift our common heritages and history. As a council we shall uphold our commitment to service, scholarship and the values of sisterhood and brotherhood.

 

Member Organizations: 10 Sororities, 5 Fraternities

Alpha Epsilon Omega Fraternity

* Armenian Interest Fraternity

Aion Sorority

* Asian Interest Sorority

Delta Xi Phi Multicultural Sorority

* Multicultural Interest Sorority

 Gamma Rho Lambda National Sorority

* LGBTQ & Ally Interest Sorority

Gamma Zeta Alpha Fraternity, Inc.

* Latino Interest Fraternity

Lambda Theta Alpha Latin Sorority, Inc.

* Latina Interest Sorority

Lambda Theta Nu Sorority, Inc.

* Latina Interest Sorority

Lambda Theta Phi Latin Fraternity, Inc.

* Latino Interest Fraternity

La Unidad Latina, Lambda Upsilon Lambda Fraternity, Inc.

* Latino Interest Fraternity

Phi Lambda Rho Sorority

* Multicultural Chicana/Latina Sorority

Phi Sigma Rho National Sorority

*Engineering & Engineering Technology Sorority

Sigma Epsilon Omega

* Gay and Queer fraternity

Sigma Omicron Pi Sorority, Inc.

* Asian American Interest Sorority

Sigma Pi Alpha Sorority, Inc.

* Chicana / Latina Interest Sorority

Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc.

* Multicultural Asian-Interest Sorority
summary: Multi-Cultural Fraternities and Sororities

name: Music Connection, The
description:
The Music Connection (TMC) aims to provide free, supplemental music tutoring for young musicians in the Berkeley and Oakland area through in-class tutoring and private lessons. By doing so, TMC provides young students with a strong foundation in music, which will help them to develop cooperation, self-confidence, and an appreciation for music.

We are an organization that currently has about 70 tutors and continues to grow through our success within UC Berkeley and our surrounding communities. We provide free music lessons to students in the Berkeley community in many different forms. Our tutors are UC Berkeley students from a variety of academic backgrounds, but all with extensive musical experience. TMC is a way for students at Berkeley to become involved in the surrounding community by connecting with their students and sharing the expressive and creative gift that is music. Tutors are given the opportunity to connect with the community, practice music, and hone valuable teaching skills. Our programs include In-Class Tutoring and Private Tutoring. We emphasize tutoring for low-income students who may not have ready access to music lessons.

In addition to our two main tutoring programs, we also host free events for the local Berkeley community. Our past events outside of our end-of-semester TMC Recital include College Music Days, Spring Music Festival, and Instrument Petting Zoo. For our College Music Days, we invite BUSD/OUSD students to visit a rehearsal of the UC Berkeley Symphony Orchestra or UC Berkeley Wind Ensemble and play along. Every April, we host a Spring Music Festival, during which students can perform a piece for UC Berkeley Music Department faculty and receive feedback. On Cal Day, we lead an Instrument Petting Zoo, during which children may try out different instruments.

Applications for FALL 2023 OPEN NOW! See our website for more information.
summary: The Music Connection (TMC) aims to provide free, supplemental music tutoring for young musicians through in-class tutoring and private lessons in the Berkeley and Oakland area.

name: Music Meditation Club
description:
Discover spiritual solutions to material problems through musical mantra meditation, philosophical discussion and free vegetarian food. Everyone and anyone is welcome!
The Music Meditation Club at UCB helps enhance and balance out the lives of students through musical mantra meditation, soulful philosophical discussion and sumptuous vegan snacks. We meet every week and have a variety of other exciting events throughout the year. All events are free for everyone!
summary: The Music Meditation Club invites students to explore higher levels of awareness through mantra meditation, guided breathing, yoga and conscious foods.

name: Muslim Tech Collaborative
summary: MTC is dedicated to creating an intersectional space for Muslims in tech to come together as a professional and spiritual community, fostering representation and making tangible, lasting impacts on the Muslim community and in the tech industry.

name: Mycology Club at Berkeley
description:
Specifically this clubs hopes to:

  • Foster individual scientific development and a community around mycology.
  • Encourage every club member to interact with mycology how they desire. Our calendar will be populated with events from all other California mycological associations.
  • Foster more of a Socratic learning experience in which it is encouraged to generate individual projects that will help interaction with mycology and the natural world. This could range from learning how to ID Fungi to making art!
summary: We intend to create a space for students interested in mycology to hone their mycological and biological skills and enjoy mushroom related fields such as taxonomy, identification, and foraging.

name: Myopia Control Club at Berkeley (MCC)
description: Myopia Control Club (MCC) at Berkeley aims to introduce students to the clinical aspects of evidence-based myopia control. By 2050, the prevalence of myopia (nearsightedness) is expected to rise to 50%. Myopia progression causes vision-threatening complications that can be mitigated with corrective lenses, atropine, etc. Guest speakers from Berkeley Optometry, industry and research come to share new developments in myopia control and provide hands-on fitting workshops. We plan to also offer opportunities for student clinicians to assist with patient care and get hands-on experience with key instruments.
summary: Myopia Control Club aims to introduce students to the clinical aspects of evidence-based myopia control. We hold seminars and workshops with hands-on learning regarding the various modalities of myopia control such as atropine and corrective lenses.

name: Naach at Berkeley
summary: Naach is a workshop-based South Asian dance club that is open to all (no auditions), and provides the opportunity to explore the diverse dance styles of South Asia, and an inclusive community for students who seek a fun fitness & social activity.

name: NALA Project at Berkeley
description:
The Native American Legal Assistance Student Led Project (NALA) provides pro bono legal assistance to Native Americans in California in partnership with practicing attorneys. This provides an opportunity for law students to gain meaningful legal experience.

FKA Karuk Collective. Name changed 10-14-19
summary: The Native American Legal Assistance Student Led Project (NALA) provides pro bono legal assistance to Native Americans in California in partnership with practicing attorneys.

name: Name and Gender Change Workshop
description: NGCW assists clients in navigating the process of changing their legal name and/or the gender marker on their government identity documents. We help them to complete forms, give advice on how to file forms, and assist them with fee waivers where applicable. While the name and gender change processes are relatively simple legal issues, there are few service providers that are able to help the transgender community with the process.
summary: NGCW is a student initiated legal project at Berkeley Law. We work to assist transgender individuals complete legal name and gender changes.

name: NAMI on Campus at Berkeley
description:
NAMI (National Alliance on Mental Illness) is a mental health club focused on both community advocacy and creating a supportive environment for UC Berkeley students. We work to combat Berkeley's toxic "race to the bottom" culture, and instead prioritize mental health through a focus on self-care, mental health resources, and mutual support.

To learn more about us, please check out our facebook page @UC Berkeley NAMi, and our instagram page at @ucbnami.


Come find out how to get involved with the UC Berkeley chapter of the National Alliance on Mental Illness, and help us to spread mental health awareness, reduce stigma, and build a support network on campus. If you are interested, please fill out our interest form at https://forms.gle/oZkTCacqUd4Xqw4d6.

We hope to see your interest in NAMI, and will be in contact with further details once you fill out the form. If you have any questions please contact us at namiucberkeley@gmail.com. We can't wait to meet you!
summary: We provide mental health resources, facilitate support groups, work on community advocacy projects, and organize events to raise awareness for those with mental health challenges!

name: National Lawyers Guild, Berkeley Law Chapter
description: The National Lawyers Guild, Berkeley Law Chapter is an association of progressive lawyers, law students, paralegals, judges, legal secretaries, and community activists, dedicated to the fight for civil rights and social justice.
summary: The National Lawyers Guild, Berkeley Law Chapter is an association of progressive lawyers, law students, paralegals, judges, legal secretaries, and community activists, dedicated to the fight for civil rights and social justice.

name: National Optometric Student Association
description: The National Optometric Student Association (NOSA) is the student extension of the National Optometric Association (NOA). NOSA is a service organization open to all and dedicated to providing the delivery of effective and adequate eye care to minority and underserved communities. In addition, NOSA creatively markets the field of optometry in an effort to increase recruitment and retention of underrepresented minorities into the profession. The association shall strive to stimulate and encourage high professional, intellectual, and social relationships with members of optometric programs as well as other health professional student organizations.
summary: NOSA is a service organization open to all and dedicated to providing the delivery of effective and adequate eye care to minority and underserved communities.

name: National Organization of Minority Architects Students
description:
What is NOMAS? NOMA stands for the National Organization of Minority Architects, an organization dedicated to giving a platform for minority architects to advance their place in the architectural industry, fight social and environmental injustices (not necessarily limited to architecture), and bring unity to a diverse body through shared visions and goals. NOMAS is the NOMA representative for Student university chapters.

Learn more about NOMA here: https://www.noma.net/about-noma/ and established NOMAS chapters here: https://www.noma.net/nomas-chapters/ Learn about SFNOMA here: http://www.sfnoma.net/

 

Why does Berkeley need NOMAS? And why now? Berkeley is famous for its student involvement with the social discourse and the individual unlearning processes of biases and stereotypes. However, the Architecture students of the CED represent a passionate, yet frustrated student body, regarding the diversity of architects studied, redundancy and hypocrisy in the curriculum, and the treatment of peers in the LGBTQ+ community. The CED has one of the most diverse architecture student bodies nationally; however, that statistic is not an excuse for an unsatisfactory student experience, academically and socially. Today, at the height of the BLM Movement, is a perfect opportunity for students and faculty to raise a NOMAS Chapter and foster productive dialogue for the benefit of the student experience.

For more information or any questions, please fill out our interest form: For more information, please fill out our interest form: https://forms.gle/5Louxn2Z9Pf4REqd8
summary: We are dedicated to giving a platform for minority architects and students to advance their place in the architectural industry, fight social and environmental injustices, and bring unity to a diverse body through shared visions and goals.

name: National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC)
description:
To stimulate the member organization to foster and sponsor projects which will raise the educational, moral and cultural consciousness of the campus and community.

 

Member Organizations: 3 Sororities, 5 Fraternities

Alpha Phi Alpha - Alpha Epsilon

Alpha Kappa Alpha - Rho

Kappa Alpha Psi - Gamma Alpha

Omega Psi Phi - Epsilon Mu

Delta Sigma Theta - Kappa

Phi Beta Sigma - Delta Beta

Sigma Gamma Rho - Beta Psi

Iota Phi Theta - Gamma Zeta
summary: To develop unity and cooperation among the Greek letter organizations. To promote and coordinate a positive image for the individual NPHC member organizations and for the NPHC itself.

name: Native American & Indigenous Business Association
summary: NA&IBA is a community of business students that seeks to promote the success of Native American & Indigenous students, create awareness around Native issues, and foster a positive culture of unity, cooperation, and respect.

name: Natural Hair Collective
description:
The Natural Hair Collective’s mission is to empower black students to embrace their natural hair's beauty through our decal class, our community-wide hair workshop events, and a published guide. As a publications & cultural RSO, we foster community and creativity by: 

  1.  Publishing an online natural hair guide that publicizes on/off-campus braiders, hairstylists, and barbers specializing in curly and afro-textured hair, etc. 
  2. Facilitating a decal class discussing and exploring the intersection of natural hair and the black experience. With this class, we hope to teach students the history and stigma of Black Hair, the traditional hairstyles of the African Diaspora, how to love their natural hair, how to care for their natural hair, and how to do select protective styles.
  3. Hosting campus community-wide events allowing students to learn curly hair tips and be in community with each other (our events are open to all students, and we hope to see you there)!

Our goal is to educate students about Afro-textured hair, championing self-love, confidence & black pride in the process! Follow our Instagram & TikTok to find out more ways to get involved in our club!
summary: NHC’s mission is to empower black students to embrace their natural hair's beauty through classes, events, and a published guide. We stand for inclusivity, authenticity, and self-discovery, championing self-love, confidence & black pride!

name: Natya at Berkeley
description:
Founded in March 2013, Natya is UC Berkeley's premier Indian classical dance team. We perform locally for cultural events and compete nationally in the collegiate Indian classical dance circuit. We proudly craft and choreograph each of our award-winning pieces ourselves. 

 

Past Awards:

  • Origins 2023 - 1st Place
  • Mayuri 2023 - 1st Place
  • Laasya 2023 - 3rd Place
  • Origins 2022 - 2nd Place
  • Laasya 2022 - 1st Place
  • Mayuri 2020 - 1st Place 
  • Hansini 2020 - 1st Place
  • Laasya 2019 - 1st Place
  • Hansini 2019 - 2nd Place
  • Dhirana 2019 - 1st Place and Most Traditional Award

Our dancers are a diverse group of UC Berkeley students who hail from all over the country and abroad, but are united by our love to practice and perform classical Indian dance. 

Natya auditions are held at the beginning of each Fall semester. 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChg5GUXTf9P45DJGV0qQpPw/playlists
summary: Natya at Berkeley is UC Berkeley's Indian classical dance team. We aim to cultivate artistic talent and cultural awareness by performing locally and at nation-wide intercollegiate competitions. Auditions are held at the beginning of each Fall semester.

name: Nazakat at Berkeley
description: Much of the campus population and even the greater Berkeley population recognizes the talent of Nazakat at Berkeley, formerly known as Kathak at Berkeley, a dance team trained in the ancient North Indian classical dance known as Kathak, and invites us to perform and even compete. We are known for our use of contemporary music in addition to classical music to accompany our intricate footwork, complex hand gestures, and facial expressions in self-choreographed routines, as well as for our extraordinary level of synchronization. With our unique style of dance, we plan to collaborate with other student performing arts groups on campus, such as through the Perspectives Showcase. We welcome all Cal students who are trained in Kathak to join us in spreading the joy of dance and appreciation of our unique genre.
summary: Cal's Premier Kathak Dance Team!

name: Nepali Student Association
description: By bringing together all Nepalese students on Berkeley campus, we wish to promote the Nepali heritage throughout the campus and its students. We wish to further diversify the Nepalese heritage in the Berkeley campus by assisting other Nepalese students in schools and community colleges through community outreach and mentorship activities. We also strive to join hands with other organizations and partake in various programs to benefit the student population at large.
summary: Promote Nepalese culture and further diversify the Berkeley campus through peace and understanding.

name: Net Impact at Haas
description: The purpose of this club is to mobilize a new generation to use their careers to drive social and environmental transformational change on campus, in their workplaces, and in the world. Net Impact’s mission is to connect like-minded individuals who aim to use business as a force for environmental and social good by providing events and programming for members to connect, learn, and collaborate.
summary: To be completed by student leader at registration

name: Net Impact Berkeley
description:
Net Impact Berkeley (NIB) is the UC Berkeley undergraduate chapter of Net Impact, an international organization of over 100,000 students and professionals with the shared goal of creating a more socially and environmentally sustainable world through responsible business practices. In addition to being an ASUC-sponsored registered student organization, we have also been sponsored by the Haas School of Business and the Center for Responsible Business.

Every semester, we work on several impact-driven strategy consulting projects for all kinds of clients operating in a wide range of industries/areas. Our project teams (typically 5 people) consist of several consulting associates led by a project manager, and are the core component of the NIB member experience.

Beyond our consulting work, we also provide a wealth of academic & career resources, training programs, learning opportunities, and other initiatives to advance our members' personal growth and professional development.

NIB is a tight-knit social community—our members frequently organize fun events and activities with each other and also make connections within our network of nearly 200 alumni.

We recruit new undergraduate students from all majors and backgrounds every semester and do not require any prior consulting or business experience. Please visit our website for more information on our work and how to apply.
summary: Net Impact Berkeley is a premier undergraduate student consulting group at UC Berkeley focusing on sustainability and social impact strategy projects for social enterprises, businesses, and non-profits.

name: NeuroNet
summary: NeuroNet offers students a space to discuss topics in neuroscience, in addition to providing potential career and research opportunities in the field.

name: Neurotechnology at Berkeley
description: Neurotech@Berkeley provides a forum to learn about the major biotechnologies used in research and industry to collect, send, and analyze signals from and to the brain. The applications of neurotechnology extend everywhere from treating neurodegenerative disorders to controlling the devices around us to transformative healthcare techniques. By working on projects and hosting speaker events, we are dedicated to fostering a vibrant community of brain-computer interface enthusiasts at UC Berkeley. Please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and check out our website!
summary: Neurotech@Berkeley provides a forum to learn about the major biotechnologies used in research, healthcare, and industry to collect/send/analyze signals from and to the brain. We consult, build software/hardware projects, write, and educate via our DeCal.

name: NewSpace at Berkeley
description: NewSpace@Berkeley brings the space industry to Berkeley campus! We run the NewSpace Entrepreneurship DeCal, as well as running events with industry professionals on campus and supporting the space engineering teams through partnerships.
summary: NewSpace@Berkeley connects the Berkeley student community to the emerging commercial space industry. We aim to connect and educate students from all majors about the opportunities currently available to them in the NewSpace economy

name: Next Generation Consulting at Berkeley
description: NextGeneration Consulting (NGC) is a student-run management consulting organization that provides leading-edge solutions to clients of various sizes and industries. At NextGen, we recognize how diversity is now more paramount to success than ever before. By providing hands-on experience to our members, we help mold better-qualified students, inside Berkeley-Haas and beyond.
summary: We are a student club that provides strategic consulting for clients in all industries and aims to improve access to the business experience for everyone.

name: Next Generation of Entrepreneurs
